317252074.content: You are the only one who can see me. Please, don't be scared. This has happened before.

317252075.content: The first piece of the image the girl drew has already been removed. And you are the second.

317252076.content: It has been four years, but I have use of you again.

317252077.content: We've been waiting for what feels like hours, but there's still no sign of Shadow Crow. I can sense that we've lost control of the situation.

317252078.content: This is no good. Something must have gone wrong. We can't just wait.

317252080.content: Admin, do you mean we need to head for the Crow's Nest?

317252081.content: Er... I can get us two more rifles. Maybe. I can try, at least.

317252083.content: The worst-case scenario is that we need to go in fighting, despite all the risks. After all...

317252085.content: We stand ready to fight. When I see who is approaching I'm a little surprised, but also feel that things had to be this way.

317252086.content: We're too likely to be found here. I know somewhere more secluded.

317252087.content: Kagutsuchi leads us to a quieter hiding place and we can finally take a moment to relax and let our nerves settle.

317252088.content: I think this is what you're looking for?

317252089.content: I take the bag Kagutsuchi passes to me and I hurry to open it. At long last, I see Mimir. He's hibernating, possibly to keep himself safe.

317252090.content: Thank you... What happened to Shadow Crow?

317252092.content: I look at the bag again and notice the bloodstains. They tell me all I need to know about Shadow Crow's absence. The three agents fall silent and I clench my fists.

317252093.content: Shadow Crow was not the first sacrifice in the fight to defeat the Crow God once and for all, nor will he be the last. We must continue, or those deaths will have no meaning.

317252094.content: I look up in surprise at the youth in front of me. It's a familiar face, but something's different.

317252095.content: Thanks to him, I am free of the Crow God's influence.

317252096.content: And I have revisited my choices.

317252097.content: I know you have many questions for me, but none of that is important right now.

317252098.content: I look back at the sleeping Mimir and nod my head gravely.

317252099.content: I use my access rights to cancel hibernation and Mimir gives a lengthy yawn, as if irritated at being woken early.

317252100.content: How dare you use your filthy hands to remove the best shield tech The Cryptics can invent? I'd be within my rights to counter-attack, you know!

317252103.content: Mimir calms down, seeming to sense from my tone that something important is going on.

317252104.content: I need to reach Kuninotokotachi and the others, as soon as possible. Problem is, they might be in a different dimension. Can you help?

317252105.content: I knew this would happen sooner or later... Okay, Rookie, give me your hand. The Cryptics require I use your access rights to unlock a secret comms protocol.

317261001.content: Whoops, the data's a bit messy. Bringing new module online... that's more like it.

317261002.content: The call connects and Tsukuyomi and Kuninotokotachi both turn to Sekhmet.

317261003.content: Hey, Admin. Long time no call me for help.

317261004.content: Wait, so the only comms terminal I could find in our private dataspace belongs to.. CORG? Hmm. That's less than ideal.

317261007.content: Before I answer that... Have you been in touch with the outside world?

317261008.content: Smart thinking, Sekhmet, I'm glad you read the instructions carefully. Item 2, do not call for reinforcements.

317261009.content: Admin, I hereby move you up a place or two in my league table of Aether Gazer personnel. But you need to remember that we can't contact the outside world.

317261010.content: It's rare for Sekhmet to use such an explicit warning tone and I understand this must be very important. So even though I've got my doubts, I answer in the affirmative.

317261012.content: Sounds like you've gone through a lot, Admin.

317261013.content: That all you've got, Sekhmet? I was expecting a more penetrating analysis.

317261014.content: I was thinking of doing one, but...

317261015.content: Sekhmet glances at Kuninotokotachi, waiting off to the side and dangerously impatient. She hands the communicator over.

317261016.content: So, crazy lady, you can read a room after all. Admin, you okay?

317261017.content: For now, sure. Where are you guys?

317261018.content: That's good. Hard to say where we are. Lost somewhere in a... mazespace? We need to regroup, stat!

317261019.content: I agree. But we can't seem to find a way now...

317261020.content: Kuninotokotachi falls silent. They're still trapped in that dimension and contact with me offers no more than temporary relief. There's no guarantee I'm going to be able to help them get out.

317261021.content: Okay, now we've got the necessary formalities out of the way, maybe we can let the technical staff take over?

317261022.content: Hmph. How do you manage to sound so polite yet be so punchable at the same time?

317261023.content: Despite the barb, Kuninotokotachi hands the communicator back to Sekhmet. It seems like they've been through enough together that they've formed some kind of tacit alliance.

317261024.content: I have tried to reach the outside world, but the dimension we're in is blocking the signal. But if your terminal can reach us here then it must be using a protocol that interfaces directly with low-level Gaea data?

317261025.content: Shu did mention that Mimir had been fitted with a new comms module.

317261026.content: Ahem! Do not divulge top-secret tech info.

317261027.content: If we're dealing with this level of tech I can understand why you want to be cautious. But I don't need to know how it works. I just need some parameters to work with.

317261029.content: For example, signal strength fluctuations during cross-dimensional comms.

317261031.content: It's easy to see this dimension is effectively a sandbox, cut off from both the Source Layer and the Surface Layer.

317261032.content: It can't extend in the same way as those two layers, so it has to be limited in size. But those inside it can be confused by the mazelike structure and that's why we can't find the edge of the space.

317261033.content: If we had some kind of external reference point, we could easily get to the edge.

317261034.content: Your comms signal is making use of Gaea's lowest-level dataflows, which means it isn't affected by this dimension. That makes it the ideal reference point. We need to find where the signal is strongest and break out there.

317261036.content: Hey, crazy lady, isn't that what I said way back when?

317261037.content: I carried out a professional interpretation of your individual reported experience and used it to develop a feasible solution.

317261039.content: I'll thank you if and when we get out of here.

317261040.content: So, Admin, I'm hoping that Mimir over there will permit us to open a two-way channel so we can send you a signal too. That will let us monitor signal intensity.

317261041.content: It's hard to keep a channel open like that. You'd better move quick.

317261042.content: Then let's get started. I'll have Mimir keep comms open.

317261043.content: The longer we wait the worse things could get... We've already got enough bad news over here, I would hate for you to...

317261045.content: Tsukuyomi's voice, suddenly sounding out over the communicator, ends my moment of anxiety and leaves me silent.

317261046.content: Admin, thank you for looking after Pheasant Squad for me.

317261047.content: But there's nothing to worry about now we're both here.

317261048.content: That's the best news I've heard in a long time. I'll wait to hear from you.

317262003.content: Now things get... crude. The data structure at the edges of the space is weak. Even a minor energy blast should be enough to crack it open, if delivered accurately enough.

317262005.content: Tsukuyomi unsheathes her blade and lands a blow exactly where Sekhmet is pointing. There's a sharp flash of electric light and the surrounding space starts to deform.

317262007.content: I watch as Kuninotokotachi and the others emerge from the rift. There's so much I want to say, and so little I can actually put into words.

317262008.content: They, meanwhile, look at the three agents and Kagutsuchi in surprise.

317262009.content: I know you've all got a lot to talk about and this is a safe space for that. But can I suggest we move fast?

317262010.content: You... You're that Mod. Okay, so whose side are you on?

317262011.content: The question forces Kagutsuchi to think for a moment.

317262012.content: It's like I said before. I don't think we're enemies.

317262013.content: Sekhmet looks into Kagutsuchi's eyes and soon reaches a conclusion.

317262014.content: He's not lying this time either.

317262015.content: In that case, the first thing we need to do is swap intel.

317262016.content: The conversation is intense. It adds to the mysteries we face, but also allows us to form new theories. We try our best to figure things out logically and come up with an explanation for everything that's happened.

317262017.content: A meme monster? Quake Damage Control Department? My real identity is constantly engaged in a life and death struggle? Can't believe it...

317262018.content: Initially, you didn't want to sign up for a combat posting, despite your outstanding skills meaning you were constantly being put forward for one. I had to persuade them to give you triple the usual salary to get you on board.

317262020.content: I didn't grow up with the Karasugo? I'm a special agent? That is kinda cool...

317262021.content: So you're saying we're on some vital mission, but our memories have been tampered with? Is that right?

317262022.content: From what I've been able to see, things here don't exactly tally with the reports I've read in CORG files.

317262023.content: There's been no change to your basic psychology, but your memories have been completely rewritten. It's... more like you're dreaming?

317262025.content: Think about it. We've all had dreams where we are completely different people in completely different circumstances, right? And in the dream you play that role.

317262026.content: But if it's a dream, then we should wake up when something that doesn't fit happen, like you guys turning up. But I still can't remember anything about being a special agent.

317262027.content: The meme monster is too smart for that. It works on your subconscious, which creates the dream. The subconscious isn't susceptible to data mismatches.

317262028.content: If something out of place appears in a dream, your subconscious just comes up with some way to explain it.

317262029.content: You can try thinking about what I've said, but if your subconscious has already dismissed me as some weird outsider you won't be able to take me seriously.

317262030.content: The three agents look at each other but don't say anything.

317262031.content: It's a well-designed plan. We're up against a meme monster which has already developed initiative and agency. We'll have to try memory wiping to counter its influence.

317262032.content: Then, she suddenly looks at Kagutsuchi.

317262033.content: It would take incredible self-awareness and discipline to be able to free yourself from the dream.

317262034.content: I don't understand all of what you're telling us, but if you're trying to stop the Bladechoosing then I'll do what I can to help.

317262035.content: I have no idea of how to fight those Visbane monsters you talk about, though. I can't even remember what they are. Isn't that going to be a problem?

317262036.content: Sekhmet turns to Agent H and, for some reason, takes a while to respond.

317262037.content: You're all still alive. That's good enough for me.

317262038.content: It seems to me we can be sure we're all on the same side. So I think it's time we consider the intel provided by our former enemy.

317262039.content: You mean you're still wary of me even now?

317262040.content: I just want to verify what you've told us is true.

317262041.content: I've already changed my mind. There's no need for me to mislead you... Even though I know the consequences of doing this could be grave.

317262042.content: All you told us was that the "Afterlife Realm" alter-dimension was part of Izanami's powers and that she was still resisting the Crow God. But it's all hard to understand. We need to know more.

317262043.content: Kagutsuchi sighs, as if recalling a painful and long-lost past.

317262044.content: Izanami and I started working together at the time of the last Bladechoosing, four years ago. She had been blamed for the accidental death of her adoptive mother and was accused of being an incarnation of the Crow God. And I was being ostracized for refusing to proceed to the next round of the Bladechoosing.

317262045.content: So we made a deal. She helped me win the Bladechoosing and a chance to stay alive. And I killed the Crow God's presence amongst the Karasugo, clearing her name.

317262046.content: Ever since, the Karasugo have assumed the Crow God has been destroyed. But I'm not sure Izanami was able to do that.

317262047.content: The family have always taught that the Crow God is an evil spirit, the name of which must never be spoken of. They have always aimed to make the ordinary people forget it ever existed.

317262048.content: I think Izanami must have read the secret family documents and realized the true nature of the Crow God. I was able to kill only its physical form, so she decided to use her own mind as a prison to contain it.

317262049.content: And that worked well for a while, until after the Akishika incident. Strange things started to happen here. Some started claiming to have seen the Crow God in their nightmares and others suggested it wasn't dead. Some tried to escape from the manor.

317262050.content: Izanami used her Access Key to seal the entire manor in that alter-dimension. That stabilized the situation again, until the agents arrived.

317262052.content: The most dangerous moment came when the Quake Damage Control Department decided to investigate the Karasugo. There were hundreds of people on the case.

317262053.content: If all of them formed an idea of the Crow God, that would be more than enough meme hosts for it to reach the critical mass it needed. It would also give it the ability to influence the real world.

317262054.content: The investigation team got into the manor and sent back that vital info. That was when we managed to confine the meme pollution within the manor again.

317262055.content: So Izanami was able to keep things under control even under those circumstances? Impressive.

317262056.content: But if she had everything under control, why didn't she just tell us what was happening?

317262057.content: Thinking back to the very start, the people who asked us for help were all under the Crow God's influence. The people who tried to kill them were those fighting the Crow God. If only we'd known sooner...

317262058.content: I'm sure she had her reasons.

317262059.content: Reasons? We were in that space hunting for the Crow God. She didn't just fail to help us! She actively made things more difficult!

317262060.content: She was as good as helping the Crow God. We even thought she was the Crow God at one point.

317262063.content: As everyone else pondered what that might mean, I thought back to the story Senba told me and suddenly all the answers became clear.

317262064.content: Senba, I think I finally understand you.

317262065.content: Everyone looks at me, waiting for an explanation. With clenched fists, I share what I've realized.

317262066.content: What if... What if someone manages to fool everyone else into thinking she is the Crow God and then lets herself be killed. What happens next?

317262067.content: I watch as everyone has the same shocked realization. There's a long pause before anyone can form any coherent thoughts.

317262068.content: That would mean... It would mean the majority of people, those who didn't know the truth, would believe the Crow God had been destroyed.

317262069.content: And even if that isn't really true, truth is irrelevant to a meme monster. If most people believe it, it becomes true.

317262070.content: It's an efficient solution. I like her already.

317262072.content: I know what you're going to say, Admin. Any attempts you made to conceal your personal feelings just now were, I'm afraid to say, an abject failure.

317262073.content: However, I don't think you could have formed such a close relationship with her in such a short period of time. A lot of the emotions you're feeling must have been transferred from some other past experience you haven't fully processed.

317262074.content: That shuts me up and enrages Kuninotokotachi.

317262075.content: Hey, crazy lady! You'd better watch your mouth!

317262076.content: You think that loss was cruel? What about all the other losses we've seen?

317262078.content: Kuninotokotachi thinks of all the agents who went willingly to their deaths and her anger evaporates.

317262079.content: But the plan only works if you kill her, and you failed to do that.

317262080.content: That's why we're experiencing these dreams of the past.

317262082.content: In answer, Sekhmet turns to Kagutsuchi.

317262083.content: If a conscious being with enough willpower and determination chooses to combine with the meme monster, she could be able to influence the nature of the post-merger being.

317262084.content: Izanami has been absorbed into the Crow God and no longer exists independently. But the remnants of her will can still force the combined being to carry out some of her wishes. For example, rewriting people's memories so they reenact events of four years ago and select a warrior to kill the Crow God.

317262085.content: So if you're right, the "Crow God" they killed four years ago was Izanami, right?

317262086.content: There's a long pause, but finally Kagutsuchi decides to reply.

317262087.content: What happened four years ago in the imperial city convinced the Karasugo she was the incarnation of the Crow God. Apart from her, virtually nobody knew the truth. Even I never heard her speak of it.

317262088.content: If she hadn't reached out to me and tried to clear her name, she could have been killed by this very sword I carry.

317262089.content: I think back to everything Senba has done lately and the farewell she gave me.

317262090.content: There's somewhere we need to go!

317262091.content: We act immediately. I lead the charge towards the dungeons where Senba is locked up. The others quickly deal with the guards while I head for the usual cell.

317262092.content: She's not there. The cell is empty.

317262093.content: Where's the girl? Spit it out!

317262094.content: Agent F has the guard by the collar and looks ready to use a very particular set of skills.

317262095.content: Who are all these... These are the rebels they warned us about! Listen, if you dare go against the Lord...

317262096.content: The Lord, you... we're against you all. So answer, or you'll be first up against the wall!

317262097.content: The guard knows he's beaten and can see that Agent F is in a murderous mood. He backs down.

317262098.content: There's no point blaming me. The girl's important and all I do is keep an eye on her. I don't even have the key to the cell!

317262099.content: The Lord's bodyguards took her just a few minutes ago.

317262101.content: Where do you think? The Crow's Nest!

317262102.content: That's been the arrangement all along. The witch was only being locked up here so the winner of the Bladechoosing could execute her. She's the Crow God!

317262104.content: Are you really trying to help her? You need to take a long hard look in the...

317262105.content: A swift blow from the butt of Agent F's gun shuts the guard up. I'm still staring into the cell, at the corner where she used to be.

317262107.content: But she never told me. She just gave me this mark and told me to help Kagutsuchi and the others proceed through the Bladechoosing.

317262108.content: You're right. This was her backup plan. If the dream plays out to the end, she'll be executed for being the Crow God and the world will be saved.

317262109.content: No, it can't be. Kagutsuchi was able to pull himself out of the dream, so he doesn't have to kill the Crow God now. There will have to be a different ending.

317262110.content: This isn't any one individual's dream. It's a mass mind rewrite affecting a whole group. If the dreamer's will is strong enough, the dream will adapt to any changes.

317262111.content: If any one character disappears, someone else will fill that role. Someone who thinks they're Kagutsuchi's second will take over and fulfill his mission. Just like the agents thought they were Mihakashisyuu.

317262112.content: And from what you've said, I don't think this Izanami girl is going to do anything to stop it, so any ordinary human will be able to kill her.

317262116.content: Look at the situation. Everything is running exactly as it should. We can't even see any evidence of the Crow God or the threat it presents. Why? Because that girl is a genius and she's got it all under control.

317262117.content: If you insist on saving her, you ruin it all. The consequences will be more than we can handle.

317262118.content: Sekhmet is, as always, coolly analytical. So cool she makes me shiver.

317262119.content: So what, Sekhmet? We sit back and watch the show?

317262120.content: Sekhmet meets my furious gaze and refuses to back down.

317262121.content: It seems you are not going to accept my advice. I'll need an explanation.

317262123.content: You don't want to wait, you want to act. Very well. But acting will incur losses. Is saving Izanami going to be worth the deaths that will result? If you want to persuade me you're right, you need to explain why this is an acceptable trade-off.

317262125.content: CORG's top priority is to prevent disaster occurring for the minimum possible sacrifice. But any of us, including a Mod, can form part of that sacrifice.

317262126.content: Sekhmet's expression makes it clear she wants answers. She's even got her hand on her Access Key. I think of all the agents we've lost and I don't know what to say.

317262127.content: There's a long and solemn silence, only broken when Tsukuyomi comes to a decision. She stands between Sekhmet and I, so I'm no longer fixed by the CORG agent's glare.

317262130.content: I wasn't completely candid when we were swapping intel earlier. The so-called Crow God told me a few things and it means the Child of Heaven could be a Cognizant Visbane.

317262132.content: Yes. And that could be much more of a threat than any of the Mountain Gods.

317262133.content: Everyone looks at Tsukuyomi in shock, while Sekhmet seems to realize something.

317262134.content: If that's the case... You're right. The events in Sasanami are becoming increasingly tied up with family politics. The Child of Heaven stands above the families and can't simply be an observer.

317262135.content: There's a lot of evidence for it. The current Child of Heaven is the Karasugo's daughter, Izanami's sister by adoption. There has to be a link there.

317262136.content: What happened to Izanami in the imperial city four years ago has to be connected to some secret about the Child of Heaven. If we can find out what that secret was, maybe we can save Sasanami.

317262137.content: So we can't just let Izanami die.

317262139.content: Captain, if everything you said is true... Should we still call you Captain?

317262141.content: We heard your conversation just now. It seems you're concerned for our safety.

317262142.content: Guess I also failed to conceal my personal feelings.

317262143.content: If you're right, and we are agents on a mission to save the world, then we wouldn't worry about our own safety, would we? We'd just do our job.

317262144.content: And I can't let something like the Bladechoosing happen. I want to stop it.

317262145.content: Agents K and F glance at each other before nodding and looking back at Sekhmet.

317262146.content: We didn't become agents to sit behind desks, right? Anyway, I want to play with my new rifle more.

317262147.content: And if it gets out I watched as a young girl got her head chopped off... well, I might never find a wife.

317262148.content: There's a long pause and then Sekhmet sighs.

317262149.content: Hmm. I guess there are some things these mind rewrites can't change.

317262151.content: Sekhmet... To be honest with you, the Quake Damage Control Department isn't what I expected a CORG department to be.

317262152.content: I don't care. Give your orders, Mission Commander Sir.

317262153.content: Sure... If we can't break Senba out, there's only one other option I can think of. We need to find Agent E and the memory-wiping gear he has. Then we can reset everyone's memories back to before all this started. That should eliminate the influence of the Crow God.

317262154.content: For whatever reason, Sekhmet doesn't comment.

317262156.content: Consider this. If our young warrior is correct, and Izanami is working against the Crow God, she could have made contact with our team at any point and used that memory-wiping equipment to deal with the problem once and for all.

317262157.content: But she didn't. She chose another plan, one that will see her killed.

317262158.content: Maybe she doesn't know who the agents are. Maybe she doesn't know they have memory-wiping gear.

317262159.content: She has control over the entire manor. If she wants to know who the agents are and what they carry, she can find out easily.

317262160.content: I think of the suffering Senba has gone through. Sekhmet's skepticism makes me angry.

317262161.content: At least this way we have some hope!

317262162.content: In many dangerous situations, unfounded hope is no more than a slow-acting poison. But...

317262163.content: Sekhmet looks back to the three agents. Agent H is looking as determined as ever.

317262164.content: You are in charge. I will follow your orders.

317262165.content: But if we are going to find Agent E, we need to do it before the Bladechoosing ends.

317262166.content: Unfortunately, Agent E is an expert in concealment. Many of our opponents have wasted many hours searching for him to no avail and it won't be any easier for us. We need to move quickly.

317262167.content: Agent E? An expert at concealment, you say?

317262168.content: Wait a minute! What if Agent E is the intruder they had our security team trying to detain?

317262170.content: Almost. He was too good at getting away. The best we could do was pin him down to a closed-off part of the manor, on its western side. The plan was to go back this evening and bring him in.

317262172.content: Let's go. We don't have much time.

317271001.content: Despite being pinned to the ground by a staff, Izanami manages to raise her head and glare at the enemy who stands in front of her.

317271002.content: At her adoptive sister, the Child of Heaven.

317271003.content: Mother... What did you do to Mother?

317271004.content: A newly awakened Mod? How unfortunate... I never thought Kamonomakoto would send a young girl to test me.

317271005.content: Perhaps they could no longer resist, knowing that I had obtained the Cinders of the Three Wise Monkeys?

317271006.content: You're not Haruka! You're a Visbane!

317271007.content: How dare you! Never use such base language to describe me again!

317271008.content: The pressure on the staff increases, but Izanami keeps her head raised.

317271009.content: Are you still plagued by human emotions even after awakening? What a second-rate weapon you are.

317271011.content: Akika looks towards the sword Izanami just used in her attack and senses from it an emission of Divine Grace she almost recognizes. It makes her shudder.

317271012.content: Where did you find a blade able to hurt even me?

317271013.content: Izanami glares at Akika, the final bit of confusion and uncertainty disappearing to become nothing but anger.

317271014.content: That is the blade which will kill you. That's all you need to know!

317271016.content: Akika's rage is converted into a blast of Bane Energy. Her attack is blocked, though, by a figure who appears in front of Izanami wrapped in a cloak of cold.

317271018.content: A Mod with two Aether Codes? How troublesome.

317271019.content: Your boasting won't last. I will tear that disguise from your face with my own hands and the five families will see you for the usurping monster you are. The imperial guards will no longer obey you and more Mods will come to aid in your death.

317271020.content: You will be nothing more than a beast backed into a corner.

317271021.content: Haha. What a sharp tongue you have, girl. I'm not sure you're fully aware of your plight.

317271022.content: Izanami pauses for a moment as she notices something. The two guards holding her down have much more than normal human strength, and they're giving off similar Bane Energy to Akika.

317271023.content: The guards are just pawns in my game. As for the five families... You Karasugo freaks aside, they all owe their existence to "monsters" like me. And if they fail to bow their heads, I will cut them off.

317271024.content: The Mod who used to guard this land, meanwhile, has abandoned her mission. Which makes me ruler of all I survey.

317271026.content: She's still struggling to raise her head, but the fury in her face is fading and she's starting to look confused.

317271027.content: Tut. Well, if you can't kill 'em, make use of 'em.

317271028.content: Bring me pen and ink. I have a letter to write.

317271030.content: I'm going to use you to test the Karasugo. We'll see who should live. The Crow God or you?

317271031.content: As Akika writes, Izanami stretches out a hand in a desperate attempt to reach Karasugo Ayako, lying nearby in a pool of blood. Her adoptive mother, the human she loves more than any other.

317271033.content: There is no response. That kindly face is now splattered with blood and the nightmarish scene engraves itself into Izanami's memories, becoming a scar that will never fade.

317271034.content: Stop struggling. She's very much dead. And all because she tried to protect you.

317271035.content: But her dying wish has been imprinted onto your Access Key, which will continue to protect you from attacks... Like I said, humans are such troublesome creatures.

317271036.content: As Akika puts down her pen she notices how Izanami is glaring at her hatefully.

317271037.content: I will destroy you. Even if I have to wreck all Sasanami to do it.

317271038.content: Izanami awakens from her reveries and realizes her eyes are full of tears. She wipes them dry.

317271039.content: I understand that on awakening, a Mod immediately realizes their mission is to protect humanity.

317271040.content: But the first thing you saw on awakening was a human who sacrificed herself to save you. Such a cruel twist.

317271041.content: I was hoping merging with you would mean never having to see your stupid face again.

317271042.content: I managed to create a calm zone within the turbulent consciousness flow. We can exist separately here for a short time. Please, make yourself at home.

317271044.content: Perhaps I should get to the point. But before that, I want to remind you of a promise you made, little girl.

317271045.content: You swore to destroy your mother's killer, even if it ruined all of Sasanami. An impressive threat. So why are you so willing to die here in this dingy little manor?

317271046.content: I see you're trying to make some kind of deal.

317271047.content: You have impressive control of your emotions. I should expect that from a Mod who has battled me for these four years.

317271048.content: To put it plainly, I admit that you have certain skills and would like us to work together.

317271049.content: What other option do you have, apart from begging for mercy.

317271050.content: Come on. Tell me what I get in return?

317271051.content: Ultimately, what you want is revenge on the Child of Heaven. I can help you.

317271052.content: Over the last four years, you have sent your young Mod to investigate the other families. I'm sure you've learned my Madoibi have a fatal hold over them. The only flaw is the side effects for the user.

317271053.content: However, you need something else, something vital, before you can use Madoibi on the Child of Heaven. Fortunately, your Access Key is already able to harm her even without Madoibi, and is extremely suitable to use alongside them.

317271054.content: I suspect that your Access Key, combined with my Madoibi, is the ideal weapon I am looking for. If we work together we have every chance of killing the Child of Heaven.

317271055.content: The Crow God's suggestion seems perfect, but Izanami sticks to her guns.

317271056.content: The only thing I can be sure of is that the Madoibi are fatal for the mountain gods. After all, I tested them on you.

317271057.content: Haha. That, obviously, was our first partnership.

317271059.content: I know you've already established that the relationships between the five families and the five gods is not, shall we say, harmonious. The Child of Heaven desperately wants to kill us, in order to obtain our Cinders. Or, more accurately, to get her own Cinders back.

317271060.content: The Cinders are the source of the five gods' powers, but also chains the Child of Heaven uses to control them. As long as the Cinders exist, the gods are at her mercy.

317271061.content: So why not ask yourself what I would like to do to improve this situation?

317271062.content: At long last, Izanami starts to look serious.

317271063.content: That's right. I found a way to destroy my Cinders and survive.

317271064.content: I have chosen to undergo a memetic transformation.

317271066.content: When the Madoibi kills a god, the god's Cinders are also destroyed. When you destroyed my physical form four years ago, my Cinders were also lost. But my essence lived on.

317271067.content: It was you who helped me rid myself of a useless shell, deceive the Child of Heaven, and become a true god.

317271068.content: And with such a happy history behind us, why not work together again? I achieve my dream, you get your revenge.

317271070.content: Then this time, I'll make sure you are dead. When the Bladechoosing ends everyone will think of you as nothing more than a corpse.

317271071.content: You are the reason my brother sent my mother and I to the city to see my sister. You sensed I was a dormant Mod and used me to test the Child of Heaven.

317271072.content: I want revenge on you too. All I want to do is tick one of you off my list as soon as possible. I don't care which.

317271073.content: That relaxed smile on the Crow God's face finally disappears.

317271074.content: Little girl, do you really think this dreamworld of yours will conclude the way you expect?

317271075.content: The willpower you have used to create this dream is, I admit, powerful. But a little manipulation at the right point and it will all come tumbling down.

317271076.content: How are you going to do that, when you're trapped in the consciousness flow too?

317271077.content: I chose to undergo the memetic transformation. Do you really think I haven't considered ways to retain my self-awareness?

317271078.content: I'm sorry, little girl, but I'm not reading from your script. And if I deem it necessary, I'll even make a few edits to it.

317271079.content: For example, maybe we need some more characters, some more variables in the plot. Perhaps they should push a certain youngster to face up to his inner demons.

317271080.content: And if that happens, this dreamworld will start to collapse.

317271082.content: You remain so calm... I have to admit, it surprises me.

317271083.content: I'm sure you know that Kagutsuchi quitting would only mean another of the Mihakashisyuu goes on to win the Bladechoosing and kill the Crow God.

317271084.content: The actors will respond to the script, and you do not have complete control. If the number of characters reaches a certain critical mass, then I win in the end.

317271085.content: Both players have made their last moves before the endgame commences. The conclusion is starting to become clear.

317271086.content: Ah... You are a hard girl to please. Did you ever think about the impact those characters who win their freedom will have?

317271087.content: Izanami thinks for a moment, as if remembering someone.

317271088.content: They will see what I have done and figure out why I chose this path. They will understand and choose to wait.

317271089.content: To sacrifice a single person and save the world... It is the rational choice, yes. But have you ever seen humans be rational for long?

317271090.content: With a sudden flap of wings, the Crow God moves to stand in front of Izanami, as if keen to examine her reaction to what he is about to say.

317271091.content: Think of your mother. She knew she could do nothing to save you, yet foolishly opted to try anyway.

317271093.content: That's it. That's the look I wanted.

317271094.content: Humans are, after all, imperfect and their greatest flaw is their emotions. They will never act as you expect them to, no matter how rational it might be.

317271095.content: So, would you like to reconsider my offer?

317271098.content: Do you think I'll fall for this? You can't trade on the basis of something that hasn't happened yet.

317271099.content: Tut. I had thought I'd found the words to push you over the edge. Weren't you even a little moved?

317271100.content: Very well. Let us wait and see who wins.

317271101.content: The Crow God fades away, leaving Izanami alone in the dark room. It reminds her of being locked up in the dungeon.

317271102.content: The Crow God's questions still ring in her ears. She thinks about when she used her spatial powers to observe the agents as they made their decisions.

317271103.content: She thinks about how they strived to find out what was happening and discovered only bitter truths. How they then insisted on courses of action which protected others, even at the cost of their own lives.

317271104.content: Just like her mother did four years ago.

317271105.content: Oh, mother. It should have been me...

317271106.content: And this time, it is my turn to protect others.

317271107.content: And as she thinks, alone in that room, that oddball character comes to mind. The one who comes and goes at random, muttering illogical nonsense. The one she can never forget.

317271108.content: The one who seems like a wandering collector of stories, who ignores the dangers of a cursed island for the sake of hearing a young girl's tale.

317271109.content: I'm sorry. My story isn't quite perfect.

317271110.content: Questioner, you know why I did this, don't you?

317271111.content: The light finally fades from Izanami's eyes as she recites, yet again, the end of the story.

317271112.content: One dawn, the girl hung herself at the market gate.

317281001.content: Agent H points them towards a long narrow corridor. It twists and turns and is lined with plants. It's a great place to hide.

317281002.content: What's Agent E's story? How come he can dodge such an intensive search?

317281003.content: Makes sense to me. He'll know all your tricks.

317281004.content: It's funny to hear you ask about Agent E, H.

317281006.content: Before you had your memories rewritten, you knew Agent E better than anyone in the Quake Damage Control Department. Better than me, even.

317281008.content: You were both recruited at the same time and served in the same special anti-terrorist force. He was actually your subordinate. You always went on missions together.

317281009.content: Sounds like very important memories. I'll be sad if I never get them back.

317281010.content: Treasuring memories is a positive psychological trait. But there's no point worrying about that now.

317281012.content: Sekhmet's been talking to the other two agents, but that hasn't stopped her watching as I take stock of the environment.

317281013.content: Hmm... I remember walking through here when we arrived. There's a lot of corners and curves in there.

317281014.content: If we start the hunt from one side, he can make use of our blind spots and get away. I think we should send a team to sneak across to the other end of the corridor, then we close in on him from both sides.

317281015.content: Good plan. K, F, get moving.

317281016.content: Roger! Uh... if that's what agents say?

317281017.content: Day 1 and we're already getting bossed about.

317281018.content: Agents K and F set off. We soon arrive at an entrance on one side and spot a team of Mihakashisyuu, also searching for something.

317281019.content: Oh yeah. The Karasugo security team were going to close the net on Agent E, remember?

317281020.content: The Mihakashisyuu start shouting and a strong-looking figure bursts out of the vegetation and disappears in a corner of the corridor.

317281022.content: I think we need to play hardball if we're going to make sure we get there first.

317282001.content: Keep going and you'll get shot!

317282002.content: As I'd hoped, Agents K and F have cut off Agent E's line of retreat.

317282003.content: Agent E looks like he's been fighting constantly for days. He's exhausted and wounded and has no chance of escaping our pincer movement.

317282005.content: As we're all focused on Agent E, some Mihakashisyuu we missed suddenly attack from our flank. As they do so, Agent E raises his gun.

317282007.content: There are a few short sharp reports from Agent E's gun, but he's not aiming at us. He's shooting at the two Mihakashisyuu attacking us. One of them, though, reaches him and manages to land a blade.

317282008.content: Agent K immediately takes out Agent E's attacker, but it's just a moment too late. Agent E totters and slumps down on the ground, then places his gun under his own jaw.

317282009.content: Put that down! We can save you.

317282010.content: Agent H? Because if it's not, I'm firing.

317282015.content: That's not the password I know. Get back!

317282017.content: Sekhmet, don't you know Agent H's password? Can't you...

317282018.content: I can't give another agent's password. Identify verification immediately fails in those circumstances.

317282020.content: The situation stands on a knife-edge. Agent H looks at Agent E, who is ready to blow his own head off. He claps his hand to his forehead, as if remembering something.

317282023.content: At long last, Agent E lowers his gun.

317282024.content: If you trust me, you can trust the people with me. None of them are our enemies.

317282025.content: (Cough! Cough!) Are they reinforcements? I don't remember there being any backup on the way.

317282026.content: Is he having memory problems as well?

317282027.content: He didn't even remember my password... Time count check: 87,679.

317282029.content: Agent E's answer leaves me, and all those of us who understand what it means, speechless.

317282030.content: That's a huge difference. How long is it?

317282031.content: Almost ten years. Basically, all his memories since he enlisted.

317282033.content: Agent E coughs violently, then removes a backpack and tries to pass it to Agent H. Every move is agonizing.

317282035.content: Agent H rushes forward and tries to examine his colleague's wound. He sees the most recent injury is only one of many. Agent E was never going to survive.

317282037.content: With the last of his strength, Agent E pushes the bag into Agent H's hands. Then he slumps over, motionless.

317282038.content: What the heck is going on here...

317282039.content: Sekhmet walks over to Agent E and, with practiced movements, removes his dog tags. It's something she's had to do too often.

317282040.content: The team's recording gear should be in the bag. We should take a look and see what he's been through.

317282041.content: Agent H looks at the bag, which is dripping with blood. He opens it up carefully and sees a recording pen at the top.

317282042.content: He hesitates for a moment then presses play.

317282043.content: Agent E, what I'm about to tell you is of vital importance for our mission. I'm going to record it all on this pen and nowhere else. I hope you will make good use of the information.

317282044.content: Given the nature of our enemy, I need to control distribution of this intel. Therefore, I am only discussing our strategy with you.

317282046.content: Agent B took all our other communicators, apart from mine, and never came back. I think they've made their own decisions.

317282047.content: Let's assume B's theory was right. That means this situation could, if we lose control, very quickly become an S8 global-destruction event. The only reference we have for this is Case 2950.

317282049.content: It's worse than that. The monster in this case is stronger than Case 2950 and seems to have basic self-awareness. That means a lower critical mass of believers.

317282050.content: So just removing the communicators won't be enough, will it? We need memory-wipes.

317282051.content: Definitely. But even that might not get the job done.

317282053.content: The reason we're here investigating is... the meme has already leaked out.

317282055.content: Is that why they only left my communicator? I know we've always found Agent B to act suspicious, but he's one of our most careful thinkers.

317282056.content: We can still send one final message to the outside world. But it must mean the meme gets sealed off in this manor.

317282057.content: And you've worked out what to say, haven't you?

317282058.content: Yeah. But it's not enough to ensure it's completely sealed off.

317282059.content: If we remove all external influences and wipe the memories of all our agents, how are they going to carry out their mission?

317282060.content: If it was me, I guess I'd work with whatever memories I had left and decide what to do. I'd know I had been given a mission to investigate the Karasugo. But the missing memories would act as a warning that something wasn't right, that I was in danger. So I'd try to leave the manor and call for help.

317282062.content: What if we wipe more memories, from even earlier?

317282063.content: No use. Even if we go back months the same thing will happen.

317282064.content: Quake Damage Control Department agents are all trained in dealing with memory cutoffs. As soon as they realize something is wrong they'll leave and try to get in touch with HQ. And that means all our work is wasted.

317282066.content: I need to come up with a lie. Something that will fool all our agents.

317282067.content: You mean, leave some kind of message they'll think is from the Captain? Something that will steer them in the right direction?

317282068.content: Yeah. I know that when the Director gets my message, the Captain will be sent to check up on things. But until she gets here I need to keep all of our agents and the Karasugo here in the manor.

317282069.content: Our agents need to understand they can't trust the Karasugo and can't let them leave. They also need to believe the target of our mission has already been eliminated, so there's no need to call for backup. But nor can they leave.

317282070.content: Okay, but what story can you come up with to explain all that?

317282071.content: I guess you need to come up with a plausible mission, but something they can't actually complete.

317282072.content: Agent E, I think you've got an idea.

317282073.content: They're cut off and aware their memories have been wiped. So leave them a message telling them to find me, because I've got the recording gear which will fill in the gaps. Makes sense, right?

317282074.content: I'll be able to help protect them. If anyone finds me, I subdue them and use the memory-wiping gear to reset them to whatever starting point you decide on.

317282075.content: And I won't tell anyone anything until I see you.

317282076.content: That would mean an extended mission on your own, without any support. With everyone in the manor hunting you.

317282078.content: No, it doesn't work. It would require leaving your memories intact. But you are already infected, you're aware of the meme monster. If it gets enough Karasugo servants and passes that critical mass, it's very likely to come for you.

317282079.content: There's another option. You remember that mission ten years ago?

317282081.content: That was an out-of-control meme as well. They blindfolded us, knocked us out, then dropped us off with no idea where we were going.

317282082.content: We set up a one-way comms protocol before setting out, and my mission was to keep a bag safe and wait to rendezvous with you. In the meantime, I had to memory-wipe anyone who tried to approach me, even if they seemed to be a friendly.

317282083.content: So, wipe my memory back to that point. I'll assume I'm on that mission and it'll fit perfectly with what we actually need to achieve.

317282084.content: But CORG memory-wipes are irreversible. You're talking about losing ten years of your own memories!

317282085.content: That's almost all your time with the Quake Damage Control Department. Ten years ago you were a lonely hired hand doing our dirty work. Now look at you. You want to turn the clock back ten years?

317282086.content: Agent H, I just thought of something.

317282087.content: If we carry out this plan and it works, and we keep everyone in the manor until the Captain gets here... what happens next?

317282089.content: Because if we refer back to Case 2950, the outcome is already determined. All we can do is hold out until the Captain gets here.

317282090.content: We're like the detonator cap on a bomb. We're there to make it safe, but also to blow it up if necessary.

317282091.content: And when you think about the deaths that could occur, me losing ten years of memories doesn't seem that important.

317282092.content: You're right. I should have seen it earlier.

317282094.content: The recording ends and everyone turns to Agent E, in awe of the sacrifice he was willing to make, and in shock at the new facts.

317282095.content: So the recording tells us that memory-wipes weren't enough to fix the problem.

317282097.content: Sekhmet doesn't say anything, until Tsukuyomi's questioning glance becomes a hard stare.

317282098.content: If they decided the Crow God was a more powerful meme than that in Case 2950, then memory-wiping wouldn't have been a complete solution.

317282099.content: Every time you rewind memories, fragments remain and create cognitive dissonance. Even if we control the networks and official announcements, even if we do all we can to wipe out any traces of the original memories, something always slips through where you never expected it.

317282100.content: Usually, that doesn't do much harm. Humans are very good at coming up with reasonable-sounding explanations for odd phenomena and that helps keep the deviation rate stable.

317282101.content: But with a meme monster as powerful as Case 2950, the mental gymnastics required become dangerous.

317282103.content: On that occasion, the infection was limited to some of our agents. Initially, the agents sent to handle the case thought it would be as easy as wiping their memories to a pre-infection point and then using fake mission logs to explain the missing time.

317282104.content: But the faked-up logs weren't as good as they should have been, especially when intended for special agents with relevant training.

317282105.content: In the end, they all became suspicious about what had happened. They discussed those concerns with other agents and soon enough Case 2950 had reached critical mass and manifested in an even more terrifying form.

317282106.content: The whole thing was a disaster. It almost wiped out the Quake Damage Control Department's base in Lamashka.

317282107.content: So how did you wrap things up?

317282108.content: Well, this is why I have so much admiration and gratitude for Izanami.

317282109.content: Her chosen course of action is right out of the CORG textbook. A dreamworld emerging from the subconscious is a much wiser course of action than memory wipes.

317282110.content: As long as we don't interfere, everyone in the dreamworld will believe whatever they see happen and carry on living in it.

317282111.content: You didn't answer my question. How did you solve Case 2950?

317282112.content: A while ago, you opted to hide some intel from me. I have the right to do the same.

317282113.content: Sekhmet, we've already explained why it's so important to help Senba.

317282114.content: I'm sorry, Admin. I've reconsidered the sacrifices that would be made and I'm afraid I don't find your reasoning adequate.

317282115.content: Just as it seems we're at a deadlock, a communicator tone sounds from each of the three agents.

317282116.content: It's a message from the Lord.

317282117.content: What's he doing? And what are these photos...

317282119.content: When did you get issued with communicators?

317282120.content: Obviously, Karasugo servants get communicators... No, wait. Why are we Karasugo servants?

317282121.content: The message, whatever it is, makes the three agents act strangely. Sekhmet, apparently realizing that something is wrong, sprints off in the direction of the Crow's Nest.

317282122.content: Bad time to do crazy, crazy lady!

317282123.content: But Kuninotokotachi last barb goes unheard by Sekhmet, who has already disappeared into the night.

317282124.content: Whatever she's doing, we can't just stand here while she does it. Let's get after her, Admin!

317291001.content: The message was only broadcast a few moments ago, but already everyone is acting strange.

317291002.content: They keep on saying things that don't make any sense, as if possessed. Or as if sleep-talking as they wake from a dream.

317291003.content: It's almost her birthday. I can't be late again.

317291005.content: No, wait. I'm a Mihakashisyuu. There can't be anyone waiting for me.

317291006.content: But you can't get rid of the idea, can you?

317291007.content: I'm a Mihakashisyuu... Someone is waiting for me...

317291013.content: Everyone starts to become fuzzy and if you stare long enough, they seem to transform into bizarre forms. Forms which stretch their wings contentedly, as if enjoying being back on the Surface Layer after so long.

317291014.content: It seems consciousness alone was not the solution. The key lay in humanity's biggest weakness. Emotion.

317291015.content: Savor this, mortals. This content has been carefully selected from your very own memories.

317291016.content: We adults are sneaky, little girl. We hide our very best pieces and use them to trick you at the last minute.

317291017.content: Ah, it's so good to feel real again. And now, time for my final move.

317291018.content: I will be, of course, the final victor!

317291019.content: Just as we're in full-speed pursuit of Sekhmet, we hear that hateful sound yet again.

317291021.content: That's the Visbane sound we heard in the alter-dimension. What's it doing here?

317291022.content: I've got a very bad feeling about this, Admin. We need to pick up the pace!

317292001.content: Seems like there's a constant supply of Visbane reinforcements...

317292002.content: The Mihakashisyuu Command Room is further in. That's the only place a broadcast message could be sent from.

317292003.content: You push in that direction. I'll watch your backs!

317292004.content: When we catch up with Sekhmet she's already interrogating the sender of the message.

317292005.content: What were you trying to do?

317292006.content: I was simply returning their most precious memories.

317292007.content: I thought so... You can't have freed yourself from the dream alone. Who helped you?

317292008.content: I wouldn't call it help. I just made another deal with that dammed god.

317292009.content: Karasugo Sendou twists his head, with some difficulty as Sekhmet has him by the collar. Through the door we can see the arena has descended into chaos.

317292010.content: This way, there is no need for Senba to die.

317292012.content: I have to ask you to remain calm, honorable agent. We are not executioners.

317292013.content: Tsukuyomi already has her hand resting lightly on the hilt of her weapon. There's a long pause, then Sekhmet shoves Karasugo Sendou aside.

317292018.content: The three agents have caught up with us. Sekhmet turns away and does not answer, so Agent H carries on.

317292019.content: When the Crow God's meme infected us, he entered our subconscious. Once it was there, it had all the intel it needed.

317292020.content: The Quake Damage Control Department encountered a mass dream scenario like this in Case 2950. A lot of people died before we figured out how to bring it to an end. Human emotions.

317292022.content: The Department often needs to do memory wipes. Part of that work once involved running an experiment with our tech people. The results were... surprising.

317292023.content: It doesn't matter how often you wipe a memory, or how often you rewrite something new over the top of it. There are aspects of human memories that simply cannot be altered.

317292024.content: It's a vital part of our "humanity", something Gaea is simply unable to model. It is very likely to be the reason Gaea has a system for cycling, for reusing the consciousnesses of individual humans.

317292025.content: The data is so important that, whenever irreversible internal conflicts arise within consciousness data, Gaea simply adjusts other data to compensate.

317292026.content: Agent H, still clutching that bloodstained bag, looks to Sekhmet.

317292027.content: And when Agent E confirmed our identities, that was enough to wake me up... We're back, Captain.

317292029.content: Sekhmet greets the news with little more than a grunt. She seems to dislike the idea the three agents are themselves again.

317292030.content: You knew that already. Why didn't you say anything?

317292032.content: In the dream, the Crow God meme is forced to be a young girl trapped in a dungeon, waiting for her execution.

317292033.content: But as soon as that dream ends... We have no way of controlling what ideas and assumptions the investigation team members will have acquired about the Crow God while they weren't themselves.

317292034.content: You saw those Visbanes on your way here, right? The Crow God's influence has reached the Surface Layer. As soon as the dream ended it reached the critical mass it needed.

317292035.content: But this means Senba is saved!

317292036.content: And that's why you're a moron!

317292037.content: It's a rare display of anger.

317292038.content: As a meme, the Crow God has a basic level of self-awareness. That proves it isn't something that naturally evolved out of erroneous data within Gaea. It's some kind of being that deliberately turned itself into a meme.

317292039.content: Your sister opted to merge her mind with the Crow God and, incredibly, had the willpower to contain that self-awareness. Then you went and ruined everything.

317292040.content: Now, the dream has ended. The script is no longer a constraint. As soon as the Crow God regained control over the meme, it will have fully consumed your sister's mind. She's gone.

317292041.content: And now all the Crow God needs do is find a change to get its meme outside the manor and... Gaea's done for.

317292042.content: So we need a way to save Senba AND stop the Crow God. That's CORG's job, isn't it?

317292044.content: You want to risk the whole world because of your own personal attachments? I don't even want to start psychoanalyzing a person who'd do that.

317292045.content: There's a sudden clash of blades. Tsukuyomi manages to draw Shinri just in time to catch Sekhmet and she blocks the CORG captain's attack. Sekhmet's urge to kill has been thwarted, for now.

317292046.content: First, honorable agent, you are no doubt aware that Gaea's current rules will not allow your attack to land. Second, I would hope to see CORG agents maintain a certain basic standard.

317292048.content: As the two face off, Karasugo Sendou suddenly bursts out into odd laughter. It's not guilt. Maybe resignation?

317292049.content: I know I'm being very selfish. I've tried not to be.

317292050.content: The Karasugo Family have always required the Lord to fight the Crow God. We haven't fled in fear like the Sansaru, or fallen into disrepute like the Miyahebi. Nor have we lowered ourselves to worship, like the Akishika.

317292051.content: We chose to fight from the shadows.

317292052.content: Whether that fight is for Sasanami or for the world, it doesn't matter. Our Lords have never wavered, even when they know they will die in ignominy.

317292053.content: When I first took on my father's legacy I thought I too must fulfill that mission. Until four years ago, when I lost my mother and nearly killed my sister with my own hands.

317292054.content: I knew I had to be a little more selfish, to retain the few things in my life worth keeping.

317292055.content: Karasugo Sendou is not defensive, nor does he hide his reasoning. His speech leaves us all silent.

317292056.content: I think back to talking with Senba. I think of her expression as she made up her mind. I can't find anything to be angry about.

317292057.content: There's no need to be confused, Admin. I think most of us might do the same, if we didn't have our missions to guide us.

317292058.content: But what about Senba? Who's worried about what she thinks?

317292059.content: And that, finally, causes a trace of guilt to appear on Karasugo Sendou's face.

317292060.content: She always said she would destroy Sasanami for the sake of her revenge. But in the end, she opted to protect humanity. She did the most selfless thing, all while claiming to be selfish.

317292061.content: I claim to be doing the best for all the Karasugo or for Sasanami, but send the Mihakashisyuu to their deaths to protect my family. I am the selfish one, no matter how I pretended otherwise.

317292062.content: I failed to be a good Lord. Now, I just want to be a good brother.

317292063.content: Sekhmet has stood down from her face-off with Tsukuyomi. She stands silently at the side, no anger in her eyes. Just an odd grief.

317292064.content: Honorable agent, we don't have the time to debate the rights and wrongs of what he has done.

317292065.content: The dream is over and there is no point in allowing Izanami's sacrifice. She is too valuable to us. We need to figure out how to stop the Crow God and save Izanami.

317292066.content: From what you've told us, it sounds like CORG has successfully dealt with a similar incident before. I'm hoping you'll be able to come up with some plausible solutions.

317292067.content: Yeah, like... get everyone in one place and do a mass memory wipe?

317292068.content: The recording Agent E left should have made clear that memory wipes won't solve the problem. It just buys us time.

317292069.content: Unfortunately, we can't just keep delaying.

317292070.content: Think about it. If a Mod team like us lose contact while in the Karasugo manor, what will CORG and Aether Gazer execs start to think about the Crow God they believe eliminated? How many more people will they send?

317292071.content: We can't just sit and watch everything run out of control, though. Isn't there anything we can do?

317292073.content: It wasn't Sekhmet that answered, but Agent H. The three agents stand.

317292074.content: While the Mods are worrying and unsure what to do, the agents remain calm. It almost looks as if they have a plan in mind.

317292075.content: And while the smile on Agent H's lips looks normal, I can see determination there too.

317292077.content: In Case 2950, some of the agents had similar experiences to us.

317292078.content: They sacrificed a small but elite team in order to seal off the base and cut comms.

317292079.content: Unfortunately, the number of infected within the base had already passed critical mass and the meme Case 2950 took physical form. The agents in there could do nothing to stop it. They knew that if it escaped into a populated city it would immediately cause an S8 disaster.

317292080.content: So, at the critical moment, the base commander made a decision.

317292081.content: The serial numbers of all the survivors in the base were randomized. They had the survivors kill themselves, in that randomized order. The hope was that by reducing the number of hosts, the number of infected would drop back down below critical mass.

317292082.content: With every suicide they revaluated 2950's intensity and reallocated security system resources to contain it.

317292083.content: There'd been no word from the base for a long time when backup arrived. All we found was an encrypted disc, a lot of bodies, and a handful of survivors.

317292084.content: 2950 was ultimately classified as a D1, a case controllable with good data encryption.

317292085.content: If we take that approach again, we should be able to get the Crow God under control and extract the young woman's consciousness from its data.

317292086.content: The young Mod will be saved. The Crow God and the team will both perish. And the Crow God meme will be contained.

317292087.content: Everyone is shocked at Agent H's proposal. Everyone except Sekhmet, who was clearly already aware of it all. Even Karasugo Sendou, the author of the current situation, is stunned into silence.

317292088.content: Even if it saves the world, how could anyone order their team to kill themselves one by one...

317292089.content: It wasn't like that, Admin. The base commander didn't give anyone an order to kill themselves. It was an appeal to emotion.

317292090.content: The Lamashka base was in a very special location. It was intended for research into data hazards and so spent long periods isolated from the outside world.

317292091.content: An EM blocking field was maintained, only dropped on particular days designated for comms updates. That was the only day family members could send messages to their loved ones, and vice versa. Even those messages had to be checked by the base commander before they were passed on to the recipients.

317292092.content: That meant those messages only contained information of great emotional weight.

317292093.content: Case 2950 broke out on one of those days, and the base fell before the base commander had finished checking the messages.

317292094.content: In the end, he decided to restart internal comms and send all the messages. At the same time, he explained the plan. The recipients could decide what to do.

317292095.content: At that point, everyone was terrified by the meme attack, panicking. There was no chance of implementing any kind of resistance.

317292096.content: But receiving the letters they'd so long looked forward to somehow calmed the survivors. In the end almost all of them opted to implement the base commander's plan.

317292097.content: As Agent H speaks, he places Agent E's bag in front of us.

317292098.content: Our agents often have to undergo memory wipes to complete missions, despite the psychological risks that brings. So ever since Case 2950, we've always carried sealed messages with us. Messages that we know we'll want to read when things are at their worst.

317292099.content: The emotions contained within are more precious to our agents than anything the Karasugo Lord could use to end the dream.

317292100.content: So, we could use that plan.

317292101.content: I can't help but look at Sekhmet, who's remained silent. Finally, I realize why she hasn't spoken.

317292103.content: I don't know. But the experience gathered in Case 2950 indicates that the critical mass for maintaining a meme monster is much lower than that required to create it in the first place. That will be even lower for the Crow God, which already had a basic level of self-awareness.

317292104.content: And that means... more people have to die for the plan to work, right?

317292105.content: We'll only know how many when we count the bodies, but yes. It could even be everyone.

317292106.content: So you want to kill yourselves, one after the other, in the hope that at some point it'll work?

317292107.content: I clench a fist, but then relax.

317292108.content: I hate the plan. Do we have to lose so many to save one person?

317292109.content: It's not just a matter of numbers.

317292110.content: Agent F speaks out at last. He's chewing on a toothpick, but it's clear a cigarette would be better for his mood.

317292111.content: The girl, Izanami. The first time I saw her I knew she'd never known a father's love.

317292112.content: I don't care if she can save the world or not. I just want to save her. Because if I don't, I'm not going to be able to go home and look my own daughter in the eye.

317292114.content: Mods die saving humanity. That act like that's normal and we call them heroes. Well, I don't see why Mods should get all the glory.

317292115.content: Agent K had been unsure, but she seems to have made up her mind. Her voice is quaking and she's obviously nervous, but there's a little excitement in there too.

317292116.content: Maybe this is our chance. Our chance to be heroes.

317292117.content: The three agents have made their position clear. The rest of us fall silent, our search for answers forgotten. Agent H is still trying to come up with a way to convince us.

317292118.content: Admin, we're both human. As mission commander, the final decision is yours. But could I explain my thinking?

317292120.content: You know what the toughest test for any rookie enlisting with the Quake Damage Control Department is?

317292121.content: It's not combat training. It's understanding.

317292122.content: Mission requirements mean the Department insists we know as much about what's going on as Mods do. In a very short time we're told about Gaea, the Visbanes, the Source Layer, the cycling of consciousness data, all that.

317292123.content: A lot of the people I started with couldn't handle it. They opted to have their memories wiped and return to their old posts. Now, here's what might surprise you. Agent E and I actually had more trouble accepting the new info than they did.

317292124.content: We were both part of an anti-terrorist squad previously. We'd risked our lives to save civilians, and now we were finding out those civilians were data in a Gaea memory bank.

317292125.content: Even if we hadn't saved them, they'd have been recycled through the system.

317292126.content: It seemed to me that we weren't even human any longer. Our civilization was dead. Everything I believed, everything I held dear, was worthless.

317292127.content: Agent H has given me a lot to think about, but he's as sure of himself as ever.

317292128.content: For a while, Agent E and I wanted to quit. Then we went on our first Quake Rescue mission.

317292129.content: What we were facing on that mission wasn't the crazed terrorists we were used to. It wasn't even Visbanes. It was people. Ordinary people of all types.

317292130.content: On that single mission, I saw more wounded civilians than on all my anti-terrorist missions combined. I saw kids lose their mothers. I saw lovers lose their partners.

317292131.content: But that wasn't all I saw. I saw mothers run through debris to get their kids to safety. I saw lovers die fighting Visbanes to save their partners.

317292132.content: I don't believe any of that was just a Gaea simulation. How can data decide to sacrifice itself? How can data create such powerful emotions?

317292133.content: As long as there are still people brave enough to make this decision, we'll still be "human" and our civilization will never die.

317292134.content: Agent H's speech makes me realize that the agents made their decision a long time ago. Now is simply when the decision gets put into action.

317292135.content: I can't see any reason to stop them.

317292136.content: Hmph. Destiny's the biggest bastard of them all.

317292138.content: She ignores me. She's lowered her head and seems to be muttering to herself.

317292139.content: I mean, I've even got the Omega gear with me...

317292141.content: I know the potential consequences. But it's worth it if I can get you all out of here safely. I knew that when I came here.

317292142.content: And it's turned out our enemy here isn't susceptible to simple violence...

317292143.content: When you were all declared KIA in a single message, I knew better than anyone that was nonsense, just a way of keeping the situation under control.

317292144.content: What am I meant to do now, at the end? Let that come true?

317292145.content: That'd be the dirtiest trick to play...

317292146.content: Actually, Captain, I think destiny is being kind to us.

317292147.content: It's like E said. We're both safety and detonator. Maybe we were meant to die five days ago, but destiny decided to keep us alive so we could see you again.

317292148.content: That last "see you soon" is now a promise that was kept.

317292149.content: Sekhmet thinks for a while until, finally, her clenched fist opens and she turns to me.

317292150.content: Admin, we need to set up a local comms network, but ensure no external signals gain access. Can your terminal do that?

317292151.content: I'm not a terminal! I simply happen to have that functionality.

317292153.content: Ah, relax. Anyway, I can do what the lady wants.

317292154.content: Then let's get started, Mission Commander Sir.

317292155.content: Sekhmet's determination is clear in her eyes. I know what I need to do.

317292156.content: Before we start, there's one more thing... Sekhmet, I'm human. That makes me one of the meme monster's hosts too, right? I want to go on the list.

317292159.content: I can't order people to do something I'm unable to do myself.

317292162.content: Sekhmet is confusing me. I can't see what she's got to laugh about and I don't know what her sigh means.

317292163.content: That's the fun part of studying humans. I can watch as you slowly evolve and grow out of the things I don't like about you.

317292164.content: I wish I could go back and change my initial assessment.

317292165.content: Sekhmet looks towards me again. There's some admiration there, some sadness too.

317292166.content: Admin, I respect your commitment. But I refuse your request.

317292168.content: Izanami has already made peace with the idea of dying. Even if we get the number of Crow God meme hosts down below critical mass, it's very likely she won't be able to get herself free.

317292169.content: If that's the case, someone will need to go into the consciousness flow and bring her back. There aren't many people who'd be able to handle the turbulence memetic dissociation will cause. Even Mods might not survive.

317292172.content: I don't know how you did it, but you were the only person to face merger with the meme and maintain your sense of self. We need you alive.

317292173.content: So I get to be protected, yet again?

317292174.content: Wrong. I can't imagine what kind of enemy you will face down there in the depths of the consciousness flow.

317292175.content: You're the only one who can do it, though. I'm not protecting you. I'm sending you into danger.

317292176.content: As for the rest of the team...

317292177.content: Sekhmet looks again at the three agents. The light in her eyes changes for a moment, until her expression matches that of the agents. Clear and determined.

317292178.content: There's no need for you to feel guilty. You have selfish reasons for saving Izanami, I know. But you're just sending the message. Everyone will make their own decisions.

317292180.content: We quickly set up a local comms network and I hand the info from Agent H over to Mimir.

317292181.content: The message is going out, H. You should give the specific instructions, yes?

317292182.content: I'm not sure any are necessary. But if I had to...

317292183.content: This is Agent H. Attention, all team members. I want you to remember the oath you swore on enlisting.

317292184.content: "We do not pray. No gods will save us."

317292185.content: "Nor do we run. We fight beside those gods."

317301001.content: There's an outbreak of chaotic chatter over the new public channel.

317301002.content: What kind of plan is that? Why not just admit we're going to die here?!

317301003.content: But... she shouldn't have to face all this...

317301005.content: It seems like several voices disappear, leaving only questions.

317301006.content: Is this going to work or not? Are we just going to let those Visbanes get away?

317301007.content: I point my gun at our enemies, not myself...

317301008.content: I have plenty of ammo. If I'm going to die, I want to do it fighting!

317301009.content: The number of voices gradually reduces, but the tone of the messages becomes more hopeful.

317301010.content: Spatial structure here is changing. I think we're about to win!

317301011.content: Yeah, I guess there can't be many people left to reply to me.

317301012.content: As a medic, I should do everything I can to save people.

317301013.content: We have saved many more than have been lost. Many, many more.

317301014.content: The decreasing number of voices are sad, they're helpless, they're pleading... but in the end, they're all determined.

317302001.content: The number of voices on the public channel is falling, just as the number of agents fighting by our side is. We pass through the portal and everything turns white. I feel as if I've been wiped clean.

317302003.content: We're in the gaps between consciousnesses. The minds absorbed by the meme are separating.

317302004.content: Keep moving forward. We need to split up soon.

317302005.content: Hmm. I can sense Bane Energy one way and a weak Divine Grace signal the other.

317302006.content: Honorable agent, I hope you won't think me presumptuous for asking, but... Can you escort Admin from here on? You are more familiar than we are with the problems that might arise during memetic dissociation.

317302007.content: Worried I'll used the Omega gear against the Crow God?

317302008.content: That may be a part of it.

317302009.content: If we can resolve the situation with combat, I'd hope we do it without putting any of us at risk.

317302010.content: Perhaps you could consider it... a favor for a friend?

317302011.content: There's a moment of joint surprise at Tsukuyomi's comment, but it's shortly followed by smiles.

317302012.content: Friends, huh? Sorry, but I don't think it's wise to bring emotion into mission planning.

317302013.content: Can't you sense how the Crow God's Bane Energy is changing? Seems likely it's made itself a new physical form since the number of infections reached critical mass.

317302014.content: If that's the case, then the sacrifices our agents made may have made it possible to fight it head-on, but not reduced its ability to fight.
