317302015.content: And if we don't wipe out its physical form, then all our efforts are wasted, even if Admin does manage to pull Izanami from the consciousness flow.

317302016.content: We can handle the Crow God. I'll make sure of it.

317302017.content: Kagutsuchi suddenly speaks up, before Tsukuyomi even has a chance to respond.

317302019.content: Kagutsuchi has been quietly fighting alongside us, following any orders he's given. But now I see this is, for him, personal.

317302020.content: My mission is, once again, to kill the Crow God. But this time I know how it feels to wield my blade not with my hands, but my heart. I think I've tamed those flames that used to rage inside me.

317302021.content: Admin, you saw what it was like when those human agents came to their senses. It's the same for me.

317302022.content: There's a measured determination in his eyes, and a probing look from Sekhmet does nothing to change that.

317302024.content: Kagutsuchi, I'll look after Izanami for you.

317302025.content: Admin, I... I tried to help her. But I failed.

317302026.content: I cleared her name, I helped her become the true power behind the Karasugo throne, I helped her get the vengeance she wanted... But psychologically, I think she's always been trapped in that dungeon.

317302027.content: I'm sure you will do better than I did, Admin.

317302028.content: His expression is both guilty and pleading. It makes me think of looking at Izanami through the slot in the cell door, and what I said then.

317302029.content: I've also made promises I have to keep, Kagutsuchi.

317302030.content: There's no need for more talking. We split up, disappearing into the white light in search of the battles we have to fight.

317311001.content: So is this where the Crow God is hiding?

317311002.content: The Bane Energy is even stronger than I expected...

317311003.content: It's almost the same as four years ago, but... not exactly.

317311005.content: Tsukuyomi's small team all reach for their weapons as the entire space starts to flicker. A figure can be made out in the confusion of light and shadow.

317311006.content: Even a god like me must admire your determination. For mere humans to get this far...

317311007.content: Tsukuyomi isn't fooled by the Crow God's disguise and attacks, slicing her sword through it. But the voice just starts up somewhere else.

317311008.content: Humans are only human, though. How foolish to think their pointless sacrifices can bridge the chasm between mortals and the gods.

317311010.content: Kuninotokotachi's kunai smashes through the figure, but the Crow God's voice continues.

317311011.content: I am no longer that weak shadow of myself. Do you see me in chains? Am I waiting to be taken to the executioner's block?

317311012.content: Nor am I merely an idea in your heads, limited by the terror I can create there.

317311013.content: Now, I will both swim in the sea of consciousness and walk the land of reality. A true god, perfect and complete!

317311014.content: Has it got a new physical form?

317311016.content: Kagutsuchi attacks something up ahead. It's as if he's shattered a huge mirror.

317311017.content: The levels of Bane Energy increase, reaching horrifying new heights. Finally, the owner of that voice makes its true form known.

317311018.content: It's what most people might imagine a nightmare to look like. Cunning but elegant.

317311019.content: Now, the name Kamonomakoto becomes that of a god!

317312001.content: Sekhmet, in the lead, suddenly stops.

317312002.content: It's far below critical mass now. They did it.

317312003.content: Sekhmet whips out her terminal and tries to reach any survivors on the public channel.

317312004.content: This is Sekhmet. Memetic dissociation successful. I repeat, memetic dissociation successful. Survivors, report in immediately.

317312006.content: I repeat. Survivors, report in immediately.

317312007.content: There's nothing from the terminal but the steady quiet hum of static. A silent answer.

317312008.content: Eventually, she gives up and lowers the device.

317312011.content: Let's not waste any more time, Admin. I know what you want to say.

317312013.content: But this time I do know what you're feeling.

317312014.content: Sekhmet places a hand on my shoulder. She won't let me comfort her, but I think she's grateful nevertheless.

317312015.content: Now, let's make sure you keep your promise.

317312016.content: I think the only thing keeping Izanami and you apart now is her own beliefs. She would never have expected to return after sacrificing herself to merge with the Crow God.

317312017.content: So you're going to need to shout loud to wake her up. Grab her, pull her back.

317312019.content: I turn to look in the direction she's pointing. Then I set off, following that familiar scent.

317312020.content: Sekhmet disappears. A formless consciousness barrier suddenly rushes towards me, a wall of wind I can't pass.

317312021.content: It'd have been a disaster for everyone on the island for the girl to be understood.

317312023.content: We said I'd try to understand you!

317312024.content: I reach out with both my hands, trying to push my way through that barrier. It feels as if countless knives are carving into them.

317312026.content: When my eyes open again, Izanami is staring off into the blankness. And at me, standing before her once more.

317312030.content: For me, yes. You are Senba.

317312032.content: Izanami tries to take a step forward, but some invisible hand seizes her by the throat. The Crow God has returned and on spread wings flies at her.

317312034.content: But there's still a chance, if I merge with you again and use your powers.

317312035.content: A figure appears to block the Crow God— it's me. Once more I stand in front of Senba, pointing my gun at an enemy who would harm her.

317312036.content: You? Such foolishness. Do you really think a human weapon can...

317312038.content: Urgh... How could a mere human...

317312040.content: Argh... How dare you attack a god!

317312042.content: Urgh... It can't be! Beaten by a human...

317312044.content: After a volley of shots, the Crow God wails in disbelief and disappears into a dimensional vortex.

317312045.content: Why didn't the Crow God's meme effects work on me? Maybe my belief I could defeat anything trying to stop me saving Senba made me immune.

317312046.content: The white space is finally calm and I'm able to take a look at Senba. It feels we've been apart for so long. I reach out to her.

317312047.content: It's all over, Senba. We can go home now.

317312048.content: She looks at my hand. She reaches out to take it, but stops before we make contact.

317312049.content: Why? Why did you protect me again?

317312050.content: We agreed that I would protect everyone. I was obviously the only one able to do so.

317312051.content: When your mother died in the imperial city, she was trying to protect you from the Child of Heaven, wasn't she?

317312053.content: I figured it out a while ago.

317312054.content: Protecting someone isn't about feeling you can do it, that you're strong enough. It's not a case of I can protect you, so I will. It's something you have to do, win or lose.

317312055.content: Senba, humans aren't the kind of creatures who sit around waiting to be rescued.

317312056.content: Your mother was a great woman and she made her own choices. None of that is your fault.

317312059.content: The only person blaming Senba is herself. She just can't forgive herself for what happened. I shout as loud as I can, putting all my energy into trying to convince her.

317312060.content: I know she needs to hear this more than anything else.

317312061.content: Senba stops and doesn't speak for a while. Then she starts to sob.

317312062.content: Whatever happens in our lives, Senba, we will always have regrets. I know that as well as anyone.

317312063.content: But we have to say our goodbyes and move on. To hold on to whatever we have left. It's hard, but we have to.

317312064.content: There's an even greater crisis coming for Sasanami, Senba. We need you.

317312065.content: There's a long pause before she finally takes my hand. I hope she can take some warmth and strength from it.

317312066.content: Maybe I shouldn't say no to you, Admin. At least this once.

317312067.content: The thing is, I never got to say that goodbye.

317312069.content: The empty whiteness fades away and we find ourselves in the Karasugo courtyard again. The night is long gone and the noon sun shines down, bright and warming.

317312070.content: Once more, Senba summons up that human-shaped energy field. Then she holds it, looking into a face that's a match for her mother's.

317312072.content: It doesn't seem Senba is expecting any response. It's as if she's hugging a doll. Something she can talk to, complain to, but that will never reply.

317312073.content: But the energy field does respond. As if sensing what Senba needs, it returns the embrace.

317312076.content: No, I know you're not. You're energy embedded in my access key.

317312077.content: You've grown up, Senba. You're too old to believe in talking dolls.

317312078.content: The voice seems to be coming both from the energy field, and the depths of Senba's mind. From a feeling she can't give up.

317312079.content: She hugs the figure closer. It suddenly feels warm. It's that warmth she's missed for so long.

317312080.content: Gaea's rules really can't handle human emotion, can they...

317312081.content: If only we could just stay like this.

317312082.content: But you understand this is goodbye, don't you, Senba. And once we've said goodbye I have to leave.

317312083.content: Get out now and then. Feel the sun on your skin. Make some friends.

317312084.content: You're going to go a long way, my girl.

317312088.content: You're ready to say goodbye now, aren't you?

317312089.content: Senba doesn't reply. She just tightens her embrace.

317312091.content: There's no response from the energy field, just a faint smile at the corner of its lips. Then it fades away to nothing, merging with the sunlight.

317321001.content: The power maintaining this dimension has finally dispersed, and it now breaks up like a shattering mirror.

317321002.content: Suddenly, everything becomes bright. Tsukuyomi and her team raise their hands, shading their eyes from the long-missed sun.

317321003.content: I guess Admin got it done too.

317321005.content: Kagutsuchi looks down at his hands. His appearance and clothing have returned to what they were before the mind rewrite.

317321006.content: The alter-dimension's gone. Izanami must have recovered her powers.

317321007.content: It feels as if our entire fight with the Crow God took place in our minds and we never left here.

317321008.content: Whatever. We won in the end. That makes all the sacrifice worthwhile.

317321009.content: You? Won? Fools! You haven't beaten me yet!

317321010.content: The Crow God's voice rings out once again. Tsukuyomi and the two others immediately scan the area and spot the Crow God's distorted image in several reflective fragments.

317321012.content: Did you forget? The Crow God can never be completely destroyed.

317321013.content: Haha... Just remember, those of you who have survived will continue to host my meme. I will lurk in your minds, always there to keep you company.

317321014.content: Until one day, when I will take up my quest once more.

317321016.content: A sudden eruption of energy from Tsukuyomi puts an end to the Crow God's arrogance. Finally, its boasting comes to an end.

317321017.content: We're going to have a lot of questions for you. It will be convenient to keep you on hand.

317321018.content: You presumptuous worms! You think your weakling wills can contain a god!?

317321019.content: An immortal enemy within our minds? One we have to defeat to keep the world safe? It does sound like a tough task.

317321020.content: But the girl managed to stick it out for four years, so I'm sure we can manage.

317321022.content: The Crow God suddenly notices that Tsukuyomi, Kuninotokotachi, and Kagutsuchi are all looking at it without fear. In fact, there's nothing but contempt in their eyes.

317321023.content: A god that is not feared, a god that is trapped within the minds of a handful of enemies, will never be able to bring its powers into play.

317321024.content: No. This isn't right! You wait, one day I'll...

317321025.content: Tsukuyomi simply shatters the shard of glass. The Crow God's cawing ends.

317321026.content: Karasugo Sendou stands alone at the center of the courtyard, looking at the bodies lying scattered about. There's a mix of Quake Damage Control Department agents and Karasugo servants.

317321027.content: He quickly averts his gaze. It's not something he dares look at for long.

317321028.content: He stands there, silent, waiting for something.

317321029.content: Finally, you are here. Are you ready to arrest me?

317321030.content: Sekhmet has suddenly appeared behind him. She ignores his question for a while as she looks over those bodies herself.

317321031.content: It looks like your guards all opted to kill themselves when the dream ended.

317321032.content: I think my ancestors had guessed the true nature of the Crow God many years ago. And so our teachings are... strict.

317321033.content: There are no ordinary servants in the Karasugo family. Only warriors, taken in as young orphans and trained to welcome death.

317321034.content: We save their lives when they are young and in return they offer the Karasugo the ultimate sacrifice. They are taught the circumstances in which they must offer up their lives. All this is done to combat the Crow God.

317321035.content: But just when we were about to defeat the Crow God and bring all this to an end... you went against your family's teachings.

317321036.content: May I ask you a question?

317321037.content: I know what you want to know. Izanami is alive. Admin got her out.

317321038.content: Karasugo Sendou gives a long sigh of relief before turning to face Sekhmet's glare.

317321039.content: She's alive. That's all that matters... I know I've been selfish, exchanging so many lives for my sister's. I wouldn't blame you if you held me responsible for every one of those deaths.

317321041.content: She continues staring at Karasugo Sendou, but she seems to be asking herself something.

317321042.content: Like Agent F said, it's not a simple matter of numbers. And I'm selfish too, sometimes.

317321043.content: According to the official procedures, I need to complete the questioning you refused to attend before deciding whether to arrest you or not.

317321044.content: Exactly what role have the Karasugo played in all the chaos Sasanami has suffered? Is it all part of some plan?

317321045.content: Our role? As you have seen, we have been the only resistance.

317321046.content: Cross-regional rules mean you should have reported what you knew to CORG immediately and asked for assistance. Just like the Akishika did.

317321047.content: Investigator, don't you realize? The Izuru already have complete control of all comms between Sasanami and CORG.

317321049.content: We did try to get word out. But the messengers we sent to CORG offices all mysteriously disappeared and our manor was under close watch.

317321050.content: All the five families of Sasanami have suffered at the hands of the mountain deities. But it was the Izuru who decided what CORG could be allowed to know.

317321051.content: They managed every outside intervention. Including your current investigation into my family.

317321052.content: You keep on talking about the Izuru. The answers I'm looking for are closer to home.

317321053.content: The biggest problem is the Child of Heaven, right?

317321055.content: The Child of Heaven plays a unique role in the family politics of Sasanami and the Izuru may very well be her tool. If she wanted to control communications between Sasanami and the outside world, she could do so.

317321056.content: I have considered this. It could be that the Child of Heaven is an Izuru puppet. But when I think of what happened four years ago...

317321057.content: That woman cannot be my sister.

317321058.content: So our next target has to be the Child of Heaven? That means you can still be of use to us.

317321059.content: Dealing with the Child of Heaven won't be a case of defeating a single enemy. It will leave Sasanami in chaos. She will incite the people to rise up against anyone who attacks her.

317321060.content: Only two Lords of the five families are left. You and Izuru Masayoshi. If you claim to resist what is happening, stand up and say so. Make use of your status as Lord.

317321062.content: I know I have only limited information, but I am aware the Child of Heaven is some kind of monster, similar to the five mountain deities, but superior to them.

317321063.content: We have already incurred terrible loses in our fight against the Crow God. If we now fight the Child of Heaven...

317321064.content: I have saved the person most important to me. That is enough.

317321065.content: But can't you see? Those terrible losses are why you have to keep going.

317321066.content: Karasugo Sendou suddenly steps to the side, placing a pillar between himself and the sight of those bodies.

317321067.content: We humans will always be weak when compared with gods. There is only so much we can hope to do.

317321068.content: Humans? You dare talk about humans?

317321069.content: Sekhmet suddenly lashes out, punching the pillar. It's solid marble, but still collapses under the force of the blow. Its removal forces Karasugo Sendou to face the scene he tried to avoid. And to make sure he sees it, Sekhmet grabs his hair and points him in the right direction.

317321070.content: Look at them! Every one of them, human!

317321071.content: Don't you dare call them weak!

317321072.content: The Karasugo Lord stares blankly. He looks, then tries to turn away. Sekhmet doesn't let him.

317321073.content: So, I'm going to ask you one more time. You're the resistance, right?

317321074.content: With one last look at those corpses, he nods heavily.

317321076.content: Sekhmet sets him free and Karasugo Sendou falls to his knees. He gathers up the swords of the fallen, sobbing silently. Because of the guilt he's been denying, or relief at a decision now taken?

317321077.content: Sekhmet pulls out her communicator and checks she has a signal. With a glance up at the sky, she dials a direct line to the Quake Damage Control Department.

317321078.content: Voice message: This is Special Investigator Sekhmet.

317321080.content: I can confirm the Crow God has been eliminated. I repeat, the Crow God has been eliminated.

317321081.content: The investigation team... My team is dead. All of them. They died in the line of duty and we couldn't have done it without them.

317321082.content: Incident classed as D1. Please ensure appropriate levels of confidentiality. Message ends.

317321083.content: The door to the Division Nine Manager's office opens a crack, as if blown by the wind, and then closes again. Odin finally gets a reply from Shu.

317321084.content: The high-backed office chair is turned to the picture window and the deserted scene outside. But it spins to reveal Odin. She places her elbows on the desk and rests her chin on interlocked fingers.

317321086.content: This certainly is a bit surprising.

317321087.content: Odin hears hurried footsteps approaching and raises her head to watch as the new arrival rushes in. She gestures for her to take a seat.

317321088.content: Why the sudden recall? I was finally getting somewhere in Jokurr.

317321089.content: Shu ignores the offered seat and walks up to the desk, where she places a file.

317321090.content: If you'd told me the Jokurr icefield is actually a—Do you know what's there?

317321091.content: That's all very last-era. Has to be dealt with, though.

317321093.content: Are you sure you don't need our assistance? To be honest, for the first time ever I'm worried you don't have a handle on a combat matter.

317321094.content: If I had a handle on everything I do, our work here at Division Nine would have been finished a long time ago.

317321097.content: Yes. We're all allowed our mistakes, aren't we?

317321098.content: Odin laughs as Shu stares at her in shock. When was the last time she saw Odin look this tired, even for a moment?

317321099.content: Anyway, I haven't called you back for some rest and relaxation. #{nickname}# has dealt with the Crow God. You'll need to keep an eye on Sasanami.

317321100.content: As for why you had to accompany the Jokurr investigation team... the post-action report will tell you everything you need to know.

317321102.content: For us, no. For CORG... too many.

317321104.content: Anyway, we can't delay the Jokurr job too long. See you.

317321105.content: Odin stands and pats the back of the chair, passing usage rights of it back to the original owner. Then she swipes open a Source Layer Pathway where she stands.

317321106.content: And reach out to Sasanami as soon as you can. Things aren't over there.

317321108.content: Odin waves goodbye and, without another word, walks into the Pathway.

317321109.content: Shu stares after her in surprise for a moment, then rummages through the reports lying on the desk. Then, with a sigh, she throws them into the shredder.

317321110.content: She checks her communicator and is surprised to find a post-action report.

317321111.content:
I can confirm the Crow God has been eliminated.

The investigation team... My team is dead. All of them. They died in the line of duty and we couldn't have done it without them.

Incident classed as D1. Please ensure appropriate levels of confidentiality. Message ends.

317321114.content: "My team is dead." The words echo in Shu's ears. She sends a comms request to the team in far-off Sasanami.

317321115.content: As she waits for the call to connect, she tries to shift her focus from the chaos of her last mission to this new one. Then she realizes the call still hasn't connected and her brow furrows.

317321116.content: I thought they'd won? What's keeping them so busy?

317321117.content: She's thinking about hanging up when a holographic display pops up on her desk. Urgent messages appear one after the other, filling the space.

317321118.content: It's the one from Kamau that grabs her attention.

317321119.content: Urgent: Sasanami has disappeared from the Photon Rail network. Reasons unknown.

1105801002.content: I put all my strength into my arm and focus on the moving target. Seeing my opportunity, I let the net in my hand fall.

1105801004.content: Looks like you've lost... Do you need help, Admin?

1105801006.content: While I admire your perseverance, the fireworks show is about to begin, and I'd like to beat the crowds.

1105801008.content: Yep. It happens every year, and people come from all over to see it. They say that if you and your friends make a wish while watching the show together, it'll come true.

1105801009.content: The fireworks show is an important event in Sasanami. It holds special meaning for a lot of people.

1105801010.content: I hear that it's also a ritual offering to appease the spirits and ward off evil, so it's still celebrated today.

1105801011.content: Oh, I see. So that's the reason for all the full-page ads in that booklet I got at the door.

1105801012.content: Are we going see the fireworks today?

1105801013.content: If you want to watch, I can go with you...

1105801014.content: There's no harm in coming back a little late. In fact—

1105801015.content: I'm sorry, Admin... but Pheasant Squad is still in the middle of a mission. I'm afraid there won't be time.

1105801017.content: It's alright. I did ask at the last minute. I was just thinking it would be better if we could all go together.

1105801018.content: After all, this event only comes once a year. It would be a shame not to see it.

1105801019.content: I see your point, but... I worry about leaving you here all by yourself.

1105801020.content: Don't worry. I've got my medication, and I'll keep the comms open.

1105801021.content: Fine—but if you do get into trouble, contact us immediately. That's what we're here for.

1105801022.content: I love the fireworks show. I'm not sure if you'll enjoy it, but it is a shame I won't get to watch it with you.

1105801023.content: After seeing them out, I return to the goldfish booth. There's still some time before the fireworks, so I decide to try it again.

1105801024.content: ...I'm going to hit it this time. I'll at least get that small prize!

1105801025.content: It's clear, though, that with my lack of skill, no amount of trying will help. Right as I'm debating whether or not I should start the next challenge, I hear the prize bell ringing.

1105801026.content: Congratulations! Second place! Your prize is ten fish.

1105801028.content: A familiar young man with white hair stands next to me, holding his hand and thinking deeply. When he notices I'm watching him, he turns to face me.

1105801031.content: As I start to say his name, he claps his hand over my mouth. His other hand motions for me to be silent.

1105801034.content: It's a long story... All you need to know is that I snuck out here.

1105801036.content: Do you think I'm a child?! ...It's not like that.

1105801037.content: Kagutsuchi's face is rather red and he looks like he's about to argue, but then he quickly draws back.

1105801038.content: He glances in all directions, then, having made sure it's safe, fixes his gaze on my empty goldfish bag.

1105801042.content: After suffering yet another meaningless failure, I drop the net into Kagutsuchi's hands.

1105801044.content: Shh! Didn't I tell you to keep it down? Just let me do it.

1105801046.content: Calm down. Go too fast and you'll scare them. You have to wait for a guaranteed hit.

1105801047.content: You lean over like this, then throw it...

1105801048.content: The net flies in Kagutsuchi's hands, scooping up lots of goldfish and flying in a perfect arc into his open bag.

1105801049.content: The white-haired man looks like a completely different person, concentrating intently until the bell rings.

1105801050.content: Congratulations! First prize this time. That's 18 fish!

1105801052.content: Nice... It's even better than your last attempt.

1105801053.content: This is usually what happens for me. I just wasn't in the zone last time.

1105801054.content: So you were making up for it?

1105801055.content: N-no! How many times do I have to tell you, I'm not a child!

1105801056.content: Sure. Well, go get your prize.

1105801058.content: Nope, I don't really care about it. I'm just enjoying the festival.

1105801059.content: I take the tightly-wrapped prize from the attendant, but just as I'm about to open it, I feel a tug on my sleeve. My hat has somehow found its way onto Kagutsuchi's head.

1105801062.content: Before I even register what he's saying, two problems appear.

1105801063.content: Excuse me, have you seen a tall, imposing man pass through here?

1105801064.content: Wait, what are you talking about? The Captain is a short girl with a bow in her hair.

1105801065.content: Well, unfortunately, I haven't seen either of them.

1105801066.content: Sorry, it's just that this person is very... important. Just to make sure, could I ask the two of you to verify your identities?

1105801067.content: The tug on my sleeve slowly becomes stronger, and I can sense how worried Kagutsuchi is. I keep my expression blank as I show my ID.

1105801068.content: I'm sorry, but I believe I have the right to refuse.

1105801069.content: You two are from the Karasugo family, I presume? Your behavior is quite unprofessional, asking such impertinent questions and randomly demanding identification.

1105801070.content: A guest of Ain Soph... Our apologies.

1105801071.content: I'll need more than an apology from you. You've scared my... friend here. Checking ID is one thing, but you've really upset him.

1105801072.content: Standing next to me, Kagutsuchi just stares. Then, as though he's only just understood, he shrinks behind me.

1105801073.content: We're sorry, we really are—We didn't mean anything by it, we just—

1105801075.content: Nothing, nothing. We'll go now. Please, just forget this ever happened.

1105801076.content: Ugh, he's too hard to find, anyway. It's not worth it.

1105801077.content: It's better to keep asking, rather than stand around complaining. If we can't find him, we'll be the only ones who can write today's report.

1105801078.content: I wait until the two are far away before breathing a sigh of relief.

1105801079.content: Pffft—hahahahaha! That was some quick thinking on your part!

1105801080.content: That was some great acting, Admin. You really had them quaking in their boots.

1105801081.content: Oh, it was nothing compared to you. I thought you were actually scared for a moment!

1105801082.content: Kagutsuchi and I look at each other, then burst out laughing.

1105801083.content: Still, I ought to thank you. I didn't think I was going to be able to finish enjoying the festival.

1105801084.content: You got me such a great prize, I had to thank you somehow. Getting you out of trouble is the least I could do.

1105801085.content: The way you said that reminds me of something...

1105801086.content: ...Never mind. What are you doing after this?

1105801087.content: I'm going to the fireworks show, but the manual says it doesn't start until evening.

1105801089.content: Do you know about it? It's supposed it's a very important event here.

1105801090.content: I do. I used to watch it from the rooftop...

1105801091.content: Shall we go together? I'm sure being at the show itself will be an even better experience.

1105801093.content: Kagutsuchi stares at me and his lip twitches. But he says nothing—he seems to be thinking.

1105801095.content: Sorry. I was thinking of the last time someone asked invited me out like that. They ended up not following through.

1105801096.content: You're the first person who's asked since then.

1105801097.content: Well, I was being rather blunt about it...

1105801098.content: No, not at all. I don't have any plans at the moment, so—let's go.

1105801099.content: But Admin, don't we have to get tickets?

1105801101.content: Yeah, the flyer says, "Tickets will stop being sold six hours before the event."

1105801102.content: By the time Kagutsuchi and I rush to the ticket stand, the attendants are already cleaning up.

1105801103.content: Excuse me, are there any tickets left?

1105801104.content: Oh, I'm sorry, it's too late. They're all sold out.

1105801106.content: Hey, aren't you the little Captain of the Karasugo family? I was wondering why I hadn't seen you today.

1105801107.content: There were people asking around about you, but don't worry, I sent them away.

1105801108.content: They give each other a fist bump, like they're old friends or something.

1105801109.content: Anyway, returning to the matter at hand—are there really no tickets left?

1105801110.content: Well... the general admission ones are all sold out. We do have a few more, but they're all reserved for members of the Sasanami Five.

1105801111.content: I could get one for you since you're the captain, but... you wouldn't be able to bring anyone with you.

1105801113.content: The man named Yukimura looks at me apologetically.

1105801114.content: You know there are rules. I'm in a tough spot.

1105801115.content: Kagutsuchi, it's okay if you go without me. It's my own fault I didn't realize we needed tickets. At least you can go.

1105801116.content: Hold your horses, Admin. You're the one who invited me in the first place, so you have to be there.

1105801117.content: But I don't have a ticket, and it wouldn't be right to inconvenience you...

1105801118.content: Don't worry about that. We'll still be able to watch the fireworks.

1105801119.content: Kagutsuchi turns and gives me a sneaky smile.

1105801120.content: Come with me. We're going to do things by the rules.

1105802001.content: I expected the Sasanami countryside to be sweltering in the summer, but it's actually quite tolerable.

1105802002.content: Except for the occasional chirping of cicadas, it's unusually quiet.

1105802003.content: The wind blows through bamboo, and the rustling of the leaves sweeps towards Kagutsuchi and me.

1105802005.content: Kagutsuchi, your idea wasn't to climb up the hill, was it?

1105802007.content: The bamboo parts, and we're now standing in front of a clear lake.

1105802008.content: Kagutsuchi pulls a well-concealed bag of tools out from a clump of foliage. After looking through it for a moment, he sets up two lounge chairs beside the water.

1105802010.content: A fish? What has that got to do with the fireworks?

1105802011.content: We're making a little trade—though it's not easy to explain. Just trust me, you'll see.

1105802012.content: Kagutsuchi sits on one of the chairs. He pulls out something that looks like mud and sprinkles it into the water.

1105802013.content: Willing to give it a shot, I sit down next to him. I watch him expertly assemble his rod, then sling the float into the water in a beautiful arc.

1105802015.content: If you're talking about just regular fishing, then no, not really.

1105802016.content: Ah, well then... were you just not interested in it?

1105802017.content: No, I'd like to learn... It's just that I didn't know anyone who was good at it in Ain Soph...

1105802018.content: I see. Well then, why don't I teach you the basics?

1105802019.content: He puts together another slightly worn rod and starts telling me about all the parts.

1105802020.content: Before you start, you need to adjust your float. Clip this sheet here—that balances it—until the float is level with the water.

1105802021.content: Then you put your bait on and start adjusting the float's position. You clip the sheet again to do that. The more you cut, the more it sticks up above the water.

1105802022.content: You usually want to have four ticks above the water, but you can do fewer if you want it to be more sensitive. But then it's more likely to be disturbed by stray movements.

1105802023.content: Now, as for how to hold the rod...

1105802024.content: I'm inundated with all sorts of information I've never heard before. I keep nodding but wear a confused expression all the while.

1105802025.content: As though sensing my bewilderment, Kagutsuchi stops his lecture.

1105802026.content: Haha! Sorry, I'm talking too much. You're a beginner. That's all you need to know for now.

1105802027.content: I'll do the setup, and you can just worry about casting the rod and reeling it in.

1105802029.content: After making his adjustments, Kagutsuchi hands me the rod. Just like he showed me, I cast it, but the float lands not far away.

1105802031.content: But I don't think it went far enough. Should I try again?

1105802032.content: That's fine. It doesn't necessarily mean you won't catch anything; you can do what's comfortable for you.

1105802033.content: Besides, if you move it now, you might scare away the fish.

1105802035.content: It was just an example. Don't be nervous. Fish aren't very easy to catch.

1105802036.content: "Don't let fishing get in the way of the fish," as I always say.

1105802037.content: That kind of sounds like an excuse for not catching anything...

1105802039.content: Kagutsuchi can't hold back his laughter. He grabs his stomach and doubles over like bamboo swaying in the wind.

1105802040.content: The water ripples and shines in the rainbow light of the evening.

1105802041.content: Ha... haha... Admin, are you a child? Why would you think that?

1105802042.content: Um... I thought you were just trying to make me feel better about being bad at this.

1105802044.content: If you're too focused on catching the fish, the whole endeavor is pointless.

1105802045.content: When you're watching the colors of the sunset and listening to the birds fly about... suddenly, whether or not you catch anything feels much less important.

1105802046.content: When you talk like that, Kagutsuchi, you seem a lot like...

1105802048.content: Looking at the white-haired young man, I bite back the phrase "an old grandpa."

1105802049.content: Never mind. I was just thinking, it sounds like you fish here a lot.

1105802050.content: This is my favorite fishing spot. Most people don't know about it.

1105802051.content: Do you often come here when you run away?

1105802053.content: I suppose nobody likes staring at ten-page reports all day.

1105802055.content: But to tell you the truth, maybe I'm not cut out to be captain... Admin! Grab your rod!

1105802056.content: The float seems to have chosen the time when I wasn't paying attention—it jerks downward, and the rod almost slips from my grasp.

1105802059.content: Just before the rod can fly out of my hands, I feel Kagutsuchi behind me, lending me his strength. He helps me pull and saves me from swimming with the fish.

1105802061.content: It's not over yet. Keep holding on tight and tire it out.

1105802062.content: Now slowly reel it in. Pull from your waist, then straighten up...

1105802063.content: After a considerable struggle, the huge fish is caught in Kagutsuchi's net and curls up docilely in his bucket.

1105802064.content: Nice job, Admin, getting such a big fish on your first try.

1105802066.content: Yep. We should even take a picture. Make it your background for the month!

1105802068.content: We keep relaxing and fishing until dusk falls and the fireworks are about to begin.

1105802069.content: For some reason, we don't catch anything else, but we're content just to sit there and pass time.

1105802070.content: This one should be good enough. Let's go.

1105802071.content: Kagutsuchi gathers his things and stands up.

1105802072.content: You don't want to wait some more?

1105802074.content: We've waited long enough. Returning empty-handed is a family tradition. Catching anything at all would be cause to celebrate.

1105802075.content: Besides, you joined me today... Fishing hasn't been this noisy in a while.

1105802076.content: I think I know what you mean by "don't let fishing get in the way of the fish."

1105802077.content: Sitting around doing nothing is pretty nice too, although I know that's not all you meant by it.

1105802078.content: If you want to fish some more, you can always come back here.

1105802079.content: But isn't this your special spot?

1105802080.content: It is! So don't tell anyone else. I don't want my teammates to come here and spoil it for me.

1105802082.content: He grabs our prize and strides right off, not even looking back.

1105802083.content: When we return to the festival, night has already fallen.

1105802084.content: So can you tell me why we went fishing just now?

1105802085.content: We're going to follow the rules, and exchange the fish for tickets.

1105802086.content: Kagutsuchi returns to the closed ticket booth and knocks on the window. Before long, the door opens a crack, and the attendant named Yukimura pokes his head out.

1105802088.content: Two tickets to the fireworks show, please.

1105802089.content: I already told you, I can only give you one private ticket.

1105802090.content: I know, but my friend said I can trade this for one.

1105802091.content: Upon seeing the big fish, Yukimura immediately pulls out two tickets and takes the fish in exchange, handling it like it's a precious relic.

1105802092.content: So the "rules" are you can trade fish for tickets?

1105802094.content: But you should know, people really do put pictures of fish on their pages.

1105802095.content: Alright, stop staring. Let's get to the show.

1105803001.content: Ladies and gentlemen, due to the rain, this year's fireworks show has been postponed...

1105803002.content: I repeat, due to the rain, this year's fireworks show has been postponed...

1105803003.content: The announcer's cold voice echoes across the field as the crowds pour out. Kagutsuchi and I are displaying particular displeasure.

1105803004.content: Heavy clouds cover the sky, turning it dark even on this summer evening and rendering the mood even gloomier.

1105803005.content: Why now... It wasn't easy to get those tickets, either...

1105803007.content: I'm afraid not. I probably shouldn't have even come today, since I'm so busy.

1105803010.content: I guess that's it for today. It's too bad, really.

1105803011.content: You don't want to see the show?

1105803012.content: I'd love to if I could, but you heard the announcer. They're not having it today.

1105803013.content: He rubs his face, thinks, and then offers me an invitation.

1105803014.content: Admin, if I said there was a place we could go to watch fireworks, would you want to come?

1105803015.content: Although it wouldn't be quite as spectacular as the yearly show...

1105803016.content: Are they doing a show somewhere else?

1105803017.content: Not exactly. Come on, I'll tell you as we walk.

1105803018.content: Apparently, the place we're going to isn't far away, but it is uphill, and it's dark already.

1105803019.content: I can clearly see the silhouette of the young man walking ahead of me. He moves confidently, as though he knows this route like the back of his hand.

1105803020.content: I'm sorry to make you go uphill at night.

1105803021.content: It's alright. It'll be worth it if we get to see fireworks.

1105803022.content: I just hope you won't be disappointed.

1105803023.content: You're not doing much to sell it.

1105803024.content: You've helped me a lot today. I feel like I'm the one who's made trouble for you.

1105803025.content: Noticing that I'm lagging behind, Kagutsuchi falls back so we're walking side by side.

1105803026.content: It's not often that you come to Sasanami. I don't want you to leave here with any regrets.

1105803027.content: You seem awfully eager for someone who's content to sit on a lakeshore, doing nothing.

1105803028.content: Is that what you think of me?

1105803029.content: Well, maybe you're just more open to trying new things than I am.

1105803030.content: Kagutsuchi stops and picks up a leaf he just stepped on.

1105803032.content: As though to underscore his words, the clouds open up.

1105803033.content: The rain falls so heavily, I lose my sense of direction for a moment, but Kagutsuchi quickly grabs me and pulls me into a cave at the side of the path.

1105803034.content: It seems like the sky really doesn't want us to be out tonight.

1105803035.content: Are you okay, Admin? Did you get wet?

1105803036.content: I'm fine. My hair's just a little damp.

1105803037.content: I'm sorry... I forgot to return your hat.

1105803038.content: It's alright. If we can't find shelter, it might not just be my hair that gets soaked.

1105803039.content: Anyway, it's great that you found this place.

1105803040.content: What do you think? It's kind of like a "secret supply point," isn't it? We can stay here until the rain stops.

1105803043.content: I am a little chilly, but it's nothing.

1105803044.content: It's not nothing. Wait here. I'll go get something to make a fire with.

1105803045.content: Kagutsuchi stands and walks off, and before long I can't even hear his footsteps. The air becomes heavy with the silence.

1105803046.content: Thankfully, it doesn't last long. Soon the cave is lit by firelight, and I can finally see my surroundings.

1105803048.content: Hm? I don't think so. Not now, at least...

1105803049.content: But then why are there all those bowls and dishes?

1105803050.content: Kagutsuchi looks where I'm pointing, and then he bursts into laughter.

1105803051.content: Hahaha! Oh, that's what you meant.

1105803052.content: Don't worry, Admin. Me and my friends left that stuff there.

1105803053.content: To tell you the truth, I used to live here, but that was a long time ago.

1105803054.content: Kagutsuchi finally seems to have gotten the fire roaring. He puts the stick he's holding down and sits near me.

1105803056.content: I just thought a member of one of the Sasanami Five would live somewhere nicer.

1105803057.content: Oh, the Karasugo Family has nice rooms, to be sure. I can have one readied for you, if you like.

1105803058.content: But this hill doesn't belong to any one of the Five. And obviously, this isn't my room in the Karasugo Family household. It's just a place me and my friends used to come to, to skip practice.

1105803060.content: I'm sure you know of my past as one of the Mihakashisyuu.

1105803061.content: Now that you mention it, the place I lived in then was probably even worse than here.

1105803062.content: I'm sorry... I didn't mean to bring it up.

1105803063.content: It's okay. It was a long time ago. There's no point in dwelling on past mistakes.

1105803064.content: Kagutsuchi shakes his head and leans back against the wall behind him.

1105803065.content: More than once, I wanted to escape my pain back then. And this was a good place to do just that. At least here, I didn't have to think about rankings or the Madoibi.

1105803067.content: Haha, what do you mean by that? I actually think Ranmaru's problems were bigger.

1105803069.content: Ranmaru is the friend I told you about. Technically, he's the one who found this place first.

1105803072.content: I can't quite imagine you with a friend.

1105803073.content: Kagutsuchi stares, then laughs bitterly and shakes his head.

1105803074.content: You've got a point. After all, he called me his friend while I didn't return the favor.

1105803075.content: But it sounds like you got along well.

1105803076.content: Well... I never really said it, but at the time, he was my only friend.

1105803077.content: He straightens up slightly, picks up his stick, and pokes the fire.

1105803078.content: The improved air flow helps the fire burn, and the wood crackles, flaring with sparks and setting Kagutsuchi's stick aflame.

1105803079.content: Aren't you curious about why I was so dead set on seeing the fireworks?

1105803081.content: Then let me tell you a story.

1105803082.content:
Kagutsuchi: A long time ago, there was a family that had a secret dojo. Everyone in there had to fight until a single winner was declared.

Kagutsuchi: But there was the person who was always in last place, and he was called "useless." It meant that there was only one thing he need to think about—how to survive.

Kagutsuchi: It was a terribly painful life, but fortunately the useless person had a friend. This friend was a skilled swordsman, the one who was most likely to come first place. But he preferred to be idle and was not interested in that.

Kagutsuchi: Everyone in that dojo looked at the others as mortal enemies. But this skilled swordsman took the useless person to the rooftop to see the fireworks instead.

Kagutsuchi: The useless one had never seen anything so bright and beautiful. Seeing his excitement, his friend asked him if he wanted to go someplace nearby to see the biggest fireworks yet.

Kagutsuchi: But at the end of the story, and before the following year's fireworks show began, the two never saw each other again.

1105803088.content:
Me: They stopped being friends?

Kagutsuchi: They were probably still friends. It's just that he couldn't answer that question.

Kagutsuchi: The Madoibi affected Ranmaru's mind, but I couldn't do anything for him.

Me: I see... That's a shame. You had already decided to go together.

Kagutsuchi: It was a shame. So when you invited me today, I thought I just had to go.

Kagutsuchi: We decided to go, so I had to make it happen. Maybe it was for my own sake, but it was more to make sure you wouldn't have any regrets.

1105803094.content: His voice is quiet but calming.

1105803095.content: I see the firelight, rolling and shifting, reflected in his eyes.

1105803096.content: His stick burnt out long ago, and the rain has stopped.

1105804001.content: Not long after leaving the small shelter, we arrive at the top of the hill.

1105804002.content: Standing on the path and looking back, I see the flickering lights of the city laid out before me.

1105804005.content: I can't quite say. It just feels like we've done so much today.

1105804006.content: But it's also so quiet here, like nothing has happened at all.

1105804009.content: Haha. You are kind of right, though, in a way.

1105804011.content: It is quiet here. There's no one to disturb us. It's a good place for forgetting all your troubles.

1105804012.content: Do you come here a lot?

1105804013.content: Sometimes, if I lose a fight really badly, I'll look for a place to sit a while and nurse my wounds. Sometimes I come here, and sometimes I go to the cave.

1105804014.content: I haven't died yet, so I think this place has done its job.

1105804015.content: Why don't we rest a while here? Then we can go inside.

1105804016.content: I look where Kagutsuchi is pointing and see a house, standing there in the middle of nowhere.

1105804017.content: That building has been abandoned for years. Ranmaru and I used to come here a lot. If the cave is a "supply point," then this is our "base."

1105804018.content: Would you say this is like a home away from home?

1105804020.content: The wooden door creaks as it opens. Inside, the house smells as old as it looks.

1105804021.content: I remember we hid a few fireworks in here, but we never used them.

1105804022.content: So those are the fireworks you were talking about.

1105804023.content: (Cough) Wow, it's dusty... No one's been in here in ages.

1105804024.content: It's probably been three or four years, I'm guessing. Let me see—where did I put them...

1105804025.content: Why did you put the fireworks in here? Were you going to celebrate something?

1105804027.content: He soon pulls out a stack of fireworks from a corner.

1105804028.content: Suddenly, he stops to inspect the packaging.

1105804030.content: Year two, year three, year four... Did I really think we would survive that many years?

1105804031.content: Kagutsuchi hands me the fireworks, and I see that each one is marked with a different year.

1105804032.content: Ranmaru figured out a way to get these so he could throw his own fireworks show. But there weren't enough, so we decided we'd only light one each year.

1105804033.content: Unfortunately, we only ever did it once.

1105804034.content: It's good that there's so many left. We can set them all off at once.

1105804035.content: Kagutsuchi grabs all of the fireworks, dusty packaging and all, and leads me up onto the roof.

1105804038.content: A flicker appears and lights up Kagutsuchi's palm, as well as the fuse. The spark travels along the fuse until it disappears into the body of the firework.

1105804039.content: One, two, three... We wait for it to burst, but after a whole minute, the night is as dark and silent as ever.

1105804040.content: It must be a dud. Let me try another.

1105804041.content: Seeming a bit frantic, he lights another one, only to get the same result.

1105804042.content: He lights a third one, then a fourth... but nothing. Not even a spark.

1105804043.content: Honestly, it makes sense that they won't light. They've been sitting there getting damp for years.

1105804044.content: I'm sorry, Admin. It looks like I brought you here for nothing.

1105804045.content: Don't say that. I've actually had a lot of fun during this festival.

1105804046.content: We went to so many places, you taught me how to fish, you won me a prize...

1105804047.content: I pull out the oddly heavy package that I received.

1105804049.content: The prize from the goldfish booth. I never looked inside.

1105804050.content: You want to open it now?

1105804051.content: It's a festival prize. For all we know, there could be balloons inside, and then we'd at least get to hear a fireworks show.

1105804052.content: I open the package and, lo and behold, a string of brand new sparklers falls out.

1105804053.content: Kagutsuchi grabs one excitedly and tries lighting it.

1105804054.content: Its light streaks through the darkness like a shooting star. Kagutsuchi and I look at each other in the faint glimmer, and we can't help smiling.

1105804056.content: It's like a star... Very pretty.

1105804057.content: One tiny little firework, suspended beneath the deep blue sky.

1105804058.content: Kagutsuchi stands up, as though he wants to cheer it on so hard, it flies towards the heavens.

1105804059.content: I guess the thing I was looking for all this time was right by my side.

1105804060.content: An unexpected catch—much like your fishing philosophy.

1105804062.content: Kagutsuchi lights another sparkler and hands it to me. I lift it high the same way he did.

1105804063.content: If we could pluck it right back out of the sky, I bet this is what it would feel like.

1105804064.content: It's too bad this isn't the actual fireworks show.

1105804065.content: But I think this is even better.

1105804067.content: Fireworks are really just a way for people to escape reality for a moment.

1105804068.content: When they light up, they're like a symbol of ephemeral beauty. Or of a fleeting moment between lovers and the feelings between them.

1105804069.content: They're so beautiful, people forget that their lives aren't always that way.

1105804070.content: And now, I've found an even better symbol.

1105804072.content: The sparkler burns fast, leaving only traces of its existence behind as it burns out.

1105804073.content: Admin, have you heard the big rumor about the fireworks show?

1105804074.content: That if you make a wish with friends, it'll come true?

1105804075.content: Right. Although this isn't the actual fireworks show, so I doubt the effect will be the same...

1105804076.content: Still, it's a great opportunity. Want to make a wish?

1105804078.content: When the next one explodes, we'll make a wish together.

1105804080.content: You don't have to make a wish. Just wait for me a bit.

1105804081.content: Kagutsuchi taps his sparkler against mine. The light flickers, then starts to blaze.

1105804082.content: Thank you, Kagutsuchi. I definitely don't have any regrets.

1105804083.content: So I don't think I was any help, in the end...

1105804084.content: I wanted to ask you something, if I could...

1105804085.content: Kagutsuchi's eyes are wide. It looks like he's made his wish.

1105804087.content: I can't tell if I'm seeing the stars or the sparklers' light in his eyes.

1105804088.content: This might seem strange to say, but when I'm with you, I feel like myself again.

1105804089.content: I only stayed with the Karasugo family to repay my Lord's kindness. I never wanted to get involved in any quarrels... I left for my own survival.

1105804090.content: But I've never thought about things like that when I'm with you.

1105804091.content: I thought we were already friends.

1105804093.content: We went to the festival together, fished together, watched fireworks together... Some things don't have to be said.

1105804094.content: Like being friends—you don't have to ask, and you don't need a reason.

1105804097.content: Kagutsuchi thinks for a moment, then looks at me seriously.

1105804098.content: I think some things don't need to be said.

1105804099.content: We laugh and fall silent, watching the final sparkler complete its shining journey.

1105804100.content: As the last ray of light vanishes into the sky, everything becomes dark.

1105804101.content: Shall we watch the real fireworks show next year?

1105804102.content: I'll have to remember to get tickets.

1105804103.content: Don't worry—I hear that the Karasugo family is putting on next year's show.

1105804104.content: But even if something comes up again... we can always come back here.

1106605001.content: The alarm clock rings and I gather up my things, smiling at the thought of what's to come.

1106605002.content: It isn't a mandatory patrol or lab duty, but something recreational... a rare occurrence.

1106605003.content: Even since we found BunBun-0, Ookuninushi and I have gotten closer, but this is the first time she's invited me to hang out.

1106605004.content: I'm not quite sure what today will bring. Does she have some sort of secret plan?

1106605005.content: ...Regardless, I need to take good care of her today.

1106605007.content: The door opens, and a small figure leaps into my arms and start nuzzling my chest. Meanwhile, the girl in question is standing in the doorway, lips pursed.

1106605008.content: Good morning. It seems BunBun-0 has recovered.

1106605009.content: Mm-hmm... Oh, you can come in.

1106605010.content: There's no need to be so formal.

1106605011.content: I'm not being formal. It's just...

1106605013.content: It's just that I thought up a lot of different greetings, but I forgot them all as soon as I saw your stupid face.

1106605014.content: Seeing Ookuninushi puff her cheeks out and look off to the side, I can't help laughing. I walk inside, holding BunBun-0.

1106605015.content: So what are we doing today?

1106605016.content: The BunBun AI system is about to have some upgrades and maintenance done.

1106605018.content: Then I have to do some data collection.

1106605020.content: I've decided on a plan for integrating divination with BunBun's prediction system. Considering you've already had an effect on BunBun-0's simulated nerve feedback, I need your help.

1106605023.content: So when you said you wanted to hang out, you just wanted to gather data?

1106605024.content: Ookuninushi lifts her head and stares at me seriously for a good few seconds.

1106605025.content: As I thought, you can still think of nothing but goofing off. There's no help for you, but it's as I predicted.

1106605026.content: Hey, there's no need to be rude! You were the one saying—

1106605027.content: I'm about to retort, but Ookuninushi stands on tiptoes and claps her hand over my mouth. Murmuring softly, she takes BunBun-0 from me, her face turning red.

1106605028.content: You'll understand when the time comes... dummy.

1106605029.content: Just leave the plans for today to me.

1106605030.content: When we step out of our vehicle, the sea breeze is blowing and warming our faces. Ookuninushi pokes her head out of BunBun-3's shadow, but immediately after, she pulls it back in.

1106605031.content: The sun is the bane of a Modifier's existence.

1106605032.content: Why is that? Careful, you'll hurt its feelings.

1106605033.content: The silicon dioxide-based compound is currently giving me a very ugly look.

1106605034.content: This experiment is too difficult. We'd better—

1106605036.content: We rarely get the chance to go outside. How can she give up so easily? I take her hand and firmly bring her out of the vehicle.

1106605038.content: Well? It's not as bad as you thought, is it?

1106605039.content: When I look down, I see Ookuninushi grumbling, an angry look on her face.

1106605041.content: What do mean, "what"? Do you not know how to look after a person?

1106605043.content: She moves around me without speaking and tentatively looks at the ground.

1106605044.content: Which foot should I take my first step with? I'd better consult the Tarot.

1106605045.content: You have to do a reading for that?

1106605046.content: Hmph. You've messed up my plans, so now you have to walk ahead and guide me to the water.

1106605048.content: Listening to her mumbling behind me, I can't help but laugh. Maybe she got scared because there are so many people on the beach?

1106605049.content: We walk side by side, the roiling ocean water splashing over our toes. This long shoreline could be considered peaceful, the waves and the breeze calming.

1106605050.content: It's nice to get out once in a while, isn't it?

1106605051.content: ...I might not have been able to come here at all if it weren't for you.

1106605052.content: Well, now that you've done it once, you can do it again. Take things step-by-step and you'll be able to do it.

1106605053.content: There's no point in going out all alone...

1106605054.content: Oh, here it is. Our first stop in the data collection.

1106605056.content: I look around, confused. No matter where I look, all I can see is sand.

1106605057.content: Look here—this shell is shaped like a BunBun.

1106605058.content: How... Oh, the crack makes it look like it's got bunny ears.

1106605059.content: So does our data collection just consist of gathering shells?

1106605060.content: You're just like the Fool card—starting your journey with an empty head.

1106605061.content: Ookuninushi bends down and carefully collects the broken shell, then continues picking through the sand.

1106605062.content: I guess everyone's a kid their first time at the beach, playing with shells and water.

1106605063.content: I guess everyone's a kid when they fall off a stupid tree and hit every branch on the way down, using their limited experience to form woefully inadequate judgments.

1106605064.content: I was talking about BunBun-0, not you, great sage of wisdom who has never touched the stupid tree. There's no need to get defensive.

1106605066.content: I just smile to myself and watch the waves. Suddenly, I get an idea. I scoop up some water and splash Ookuninushi.

1106605068.content: How could we come to the beach and not play in the water? It would be a missed opportunity!

1106605069.content: Hmph. BunBun-3, use your fully automatic squirt gun.

1106605070.content: Now the tables have turned. I dodge left and right, but BunBun-3 hits me no matter where I go.

1106605073.content: Still dripping with seawater, Ookuninushi comes closer and stares at me for a few seconds. Then she reaches out her hand and pulls a clump of seaweed from my hair.

1106605074.content: I suddenly leap up and at her, but I'm blocked by BunBun-3. My eyes are wiped dry by a pair of soft hands. I blink until I can see Ookuninushi getting closer, concern on her face.

1106605075.content: You know you're no match for me, dummy.

1106605076.content: You've really made a fool of yourself, and now no one's here to rescue you!

1106605077.content: Wow, what happened to "I might not have been able to come here if it weren't for you"?

1106605079.content: Scowling, Ookuninushi moves as if to shove me, But just then, her foot slips and she falls on top of me, knocking both of us onto the sand, still dripping wet.

1106605080.content: Was this also part of your plan, Ookuninushi?

1106605081.content: You're the one ruining my plans, so you can't talk.

1106605082.content: Looks like this is what the Fool card was talking about... You're going to have to make this up to me.

1106605083.content: Ookuninushi crawls off of me. Despite the wind and the waves, the silence between us is deafening. We can even hear each other breathing.

1106605084.content: Well... I'll buy us two nice cold sodas. How does that sound? Just wait here, little bunnies.

1106605086.content: The soda shop has such a long line, I worry that Ookuninushi will get bored. When I finally return, I find her looking down at something on the sand.

1106605090.content: Just listen to me. First, hop up and down.

1106605091.content: Even though I've still got a head full of water, I obey.

1106605092.content: I hop two steps to the left, then back, then come around from the right.

1106605093.content: I've drawn the Chariot, reversed. You must direct your power carefully to avoid getting knocked about.

1106605095.content: Ookuninushi cries out when I press a cold soda bottle to her face.

1106605096.content: Quit messing around! We're doing data collection. Don't forget how important you are to this experiment!

1106605097.content: I hand the soda to BunBun-3. Ookuninushi grabs my hand and places a small shell in it, then closes both of my hands around it.

1106605098.content: The warmth of her palm presses into the back of my hand. Her pink eyes are gazing at me earnestly.

1106605100.content: Feel... what? Is this really part of the data collection?

1106605102.content: First, of course, is the smell of the waves, beach, and sea breeze.

1106605103.content: The shells are kinda prickly in my hands, and I can feel sand on my fingertips.

1106605107.content: ...We've all heard. Now connect the final part of the shell.

1106605109.content: We each take the final fragments of the shell and piece them into a rabbit shape. BunBun-0 and BunBun-3 stand quietly off to the side.

1106605110.content: But it's high tide, and the water's going to reach us soon. It'll wash the rabbit away.

1106605111.content: This time, your prediction regarding the experiment was correct.

1106605112.content: Really? That's a strange time for me to get lucky.

1106605113.content: Did what I said have any effect on the experiment?

1106605114.content: There may have been some small changes, but the result was unaffected.

1106605115.content: So what was the point of making me saying anything?

1106605116.content: You really don't get what this experiment is about, do you, dummy?

1106605117.content: Ookuninushi looks up at me. The waves flow over our toes and wash away the rabbit we put together. Ookuninushi's eyes are still bright, and when I see where she's looking, my heart skips a beat.

1106605119.content: The words stick in my throat, and Ookuninushi tosses back her ponytail, her cheeks reddening.

1106605122.content: Ookuninushi places the drink on the table. A bunny made of froth makes a light jump and lands in front of me.

1106605123.content: Ookuninushi draws with the coffee froth just like she's doing an experiment. Who would've thought she'd eventually succeed? And all I got was her practice runs...

1106605124.content: Knowing how to use your tools is crucial to any experiment. Naturally, I have steady hands.

1106605125.content: Fortunately, this time, I only need you to sit back and watch. Otherwise, who knows how you might interfere.

1106605126.content: Come on, I was just concerned about how your studies were going... Fine, I'll be serious. I know I should be for experiments.

1106605127.content: BunBun-3 suddenly approaches, bringing Ookuninushi another, almost identical cup of coffee.

1106605128.content: Wow! Even BunBun-3 can do it.

1106605129.content: The Star foretold it. It requires both my effort and reciprocal mental energy...

1106605131.content: The thick aroma of the coffee fills the air. Ookuninushi and I look at each other and drink the fruits of our labor.

1106605132.content: You've got some froth on your face, dummy.

1106605133.content: Then you're also a silly little rabbit.

1106605134.content: I told you not to call me bunny!

1106605135.content: Sitting across from each other in the coffee shop, we slowly finish our beverages.

1106605136.content: Ookuninushi buries herself in her terminal for a while, then suddenly looks up.

1106605138.content: ...That machine that takes photos and prints them into cards?

1106605139.content: That is what the Wheel of Fortune spoke of—it has to be. This is our chance. We have to take a picture with BunBun-0 and BunBun-3.

1106605140.content: Next, Ookuninushi and I start handing out the BunBun cards to passersby.

1106605141.content: There are lots of people around, and many of them look curiously at the sight of us and BunBun-3 holding the cards. During a point when I'm not paying attention, Ookuninushi comes up behind me.

1106605142.content: If I tell you to hand out the cards, that should count as me participating, too.

1106605143.content: Didn't you say something earlier about this experiment being serious? What happened to collecting data?

1106605144.content: A researcher must also be able to adapt to changing conditions.

1106605145.content: True, but if you really don't like it, maybe you could try something else? I'll help you either way.

1106605147.content: Nervous, she stays behind me. I can feel her trembling slightly—I almost feel the same way myself.

1106605148.content: I reach a hand behind me and Ookuninushi grabs onto it, holding it until she stops trembling. Her actions, rather than words, tell me of her trust in me.

1106605149.content: Wow, this bunny card is so cute! Can I have one?

1106605150.content: A little girl approaches, and Ookuninushi tenses up and looks to me for help. I nod in encouragement.

1106605151.content: Of course! She'll give you one.

1106605154.content: I'm so happy for her, and how brave she was. But just a moment later, she tugs at my sleeve and buries her face in my clothes.

1106605158.content: Finally, all the cards are given away.

1106605159.content: We walk around, handing off the last card in a park. The sun is going down, and thick clouds are drifting across the deep blue sky. The wind has become rather chilly.

1106605160.content: Finally, we can return to the lab. I'm not going out again for three months—no, I'm not going out ever again.

1106605161.content: Wait, are we done already? I still don't understand anything. Do you care to explain what we're doing here, bunny?

1106605162.content: We're gathering data to upgrade the BunBun AI. I thought that was clear. If you're having trouble understanding, that's not something I can fix.

1106605163.content: That's what you said when we left this morning.

1106605164.content: I'm not letting you go back before you give me a straight answer.

1106605165.content: I look at BunBun-3 and motion for it to stop Ookuninushi where she stands.

1106605166.content: But the big, silent rabbit and the girl don't respond. Ookuninushi looks at me, and I'm at a loss.

1106605167.content: I said we were going to hang out, right? Well, didn't you have fun?

1106605168.content: Of course—we did a lot of fun things.

1106605169.content: Then why do you need to know? I'm always doing strange experiments, and usually, no one asks any questions.

1106605170.content: Hm... Are you saying that your unique research and inscrutable BunBun titles still require some experimentation?

1106605172.content: I always thought this was strange, but I've been thinking. This world... does it look different to you?

1106605173.content: The way you look at the world, the logic you use... it's different from other people. Even though I don't understand what you do and can't read the Tarot, maybe they guide you?

1106605175.content: Holding BunBun-0, Ookuninushi turns and leaves my embrace, avoiding my gaze.

1106605176.content: You really think your silly brain can fathom what I know?

1106605177.content: So you don't mind me saying things like that... so shall I keep guessing?

1106605179.content: Hmm... What we did today was like some sort of ritual. The shell, the coffee froth, the cards... They all symbolized BunBuns in some way. You made them during a ritual, but then you scattered them all in different places.

1106605180.content: Are we... sending the BunBuns off to find something?

1106605182.content: She looks back at me incredulously, like I've said something I shouldn't have.

1106605183.content: To the ocean to see an unknown world, into the body to find oneself, to another person to experience different stories... I don't know exactly how you gather this data, but that's what my guess is.

1106605185.content: BunBun-0 has slipped out of Ookuninushi's grasp. The girl takes a step forward, eyes wide, as though she's trying to confirm something important.

1106605186.content: What do you know about my Brainwave Automatic Juice-Feeder, Admin?

1106605187.content: Aside from its breakthroughs in researching human cognition, the orange juice that automatically goes into your mouth symbolizes something, I guess?

1106605189.content: It's probably not just for saving space... Sleeping standing up brings a special equilibrium to your thoughts?

1106605191.content: So none of my answers are correct? But I was trying so hard.

1106605192.content: That's why you're a dummy! Don't your answers sound strange to you when you say them out loud?

1106605193.content: Her body and voice are both trembling slightly. Her pink eyes stare at me. When did her face take on that soft expression?

1106605194.content: Being strange isn't bad. We can be strange together.

1106605195.content: Slowly, I walk forward and steady her before she can fall. She's like a fallen sakura petal with no place to go, twisting in the wind, before finally landing gently in one's palm.

1106605197.content: I don't think I've ever received such praise from you before, Ookuninushi.

1106605198.content: I wasn't trying to praise you.

1106605202.content: She rubs her eyes and raises her head, the blue and white of the sky reflected in her gaze.

1106605204.content: The sky wasn't like this a moment ago, but now there's a cloud with long white ears floating above our heads.

1106605205.content: Is the cloud bunny heading off into the distance, too? Let's see him off.

1106605206.content: Oh... Is that two dandelions next to it?

1106605207.content: BunBun-3's weapons system can create fireworks using friction.

1106605208.content: The dandelions disappearing into the air and that fiery light, barely visible in the daylight, are rising together, waving off the vanishing cloud.

1106605209.content: Two strange people, and many strange events.

1106605213.content: The wind blows the clouds, and the cloud bunny slowly dissipates into the blue. And the sky is just the sky again.

1106605214.content: We've almost finished gathering the data. When we get back, I'll start upgrading the AI. You can come with me.

1106605216.content: Possibly. Possibly not. But either way, you're coming.

1106606001.content: This is BunBun-0, BunBun-1, BunBun-2, and BunBun-3.

1106606002.content: Little Ears, Iron Fist, Laser Gun, and Big Bun. Four differently-shaped BunBuns are lined up in front of me. Ookuninushi sits at my side.

1106606004.content: I reach out to comfort the excited little fellow, and it almost jumps into my arms before Ookuninushi stops it.

1106606005.content: This is the last step of the data collection. We all want to hear your opinion.

1106606006.content: BunBun-0 is very lively. Maybe because it's zero. It seems curious about everything, always ready for an adventure. One and Two have their own characteristics, and they are the opposite of each other in appearance. One is calm and Two is energetic, but they're both great.

1106606007.content: BunBun-3 is a quiet guy. It's the youngest, but it has the most functions and takes on the most responsibility. You never have to worry when Three is around, but sometimes it should relax as well.

1106606010.content: We're all happy to hear your opinion.

1106606011.content: Does the last little rabbit need me to evaluate it?

1106606012.content: What little rabbit? I haven't developed BunBun-4 yet.

1106606013.content: It's this silly rabbit in front of me, naturally.

1106606015.content: I know my own abilities quite well and I don't need to hear any irrelevant opinions.

1106606016.content: ...So, what were you going to say?

1106606017.content: Don't we all know what sort of person you are? A sensation in the research world, a one-of-a-kind talent, strong but peculiar, always doing things the rest of us don't understand.

1106606018.content: But once you get to know her, you'll learn how wonderful she and her world truly are. How delightful... Thank you for letting me inside.

1106606019.content: In other words, my evaluation is —I think Ookuninushi is an extremely talented researcher.

1106606020.content: The object of my evaluation is still pursing her lips, mechanical ears swaying.

1106606023.content: You can call me by my other name... sometimes.

1106606025.content: It's not often I see Ookuninushi so nervous. For a second, I don't know how to respond.

1106606026.content: I think Faye is an extremely talented researcher.

1106606027.content: ...Do you want to hear that again? I think F—

1106606029.content: Repeat data is of no help to my research. I need to get started on the AI system.

1106606030.content: With the data collection complete, Ookuninushi starts busying about. The data is rolling across the laboratory monitors.

1106606031.content: I can't help here, so I just slap on a pair of headphones and look for some way to pass the time. The two of us each take care of our own things, not interacting, but content all the same.

1106606032.content: I don't think I ever noticed how she looks when she's focused on her research... It's heart-touching.

1106606033.content: I set the device to the side and rest my face in my hands, noting Ookuninushi's every little frown and smile as she works.

1106606034.content: I do this until she unexpectedly turns around, her pink eyes suddenly meeting mine.

1106606036.content: You complained when I did it, and here you are doing the exact same thing! And what a master you are at it, too.

1106606037.content: You're the one who got distracted from your work and looked over at me. You wouldn't have discovered me watching you otherwise.

1106606039.content: I can't be disturbed while I'm working or I'll lose my knowledge, and the Tarot's powers will fade.

1106606041.content: I'm in the process of deciding what I should do next, when suddenly, she blinks.

1106606042.content: Wait... If you really wanted to get rid of all distractions, you wouldn't have let me in here in the first place.

1106606043.content: Separating true information from falsehoods is an important skill for any commander... dummy.

1106606045.content: But since you've stopped now, why not take a break? I'm going to the restaurant. Do you want anything?

1106606046.content: Coffee, a white rabbit candy, tiramisu, and an apple salad.

1106606047.content: You're really going to make me carry all that?

1106606048.content: I miss out on a lot of the food because I'm in here all the time. If I'm getting this chance, I'm going to try to make the most of it.

1106606049.content: You skip meals just so you won't have to leave the lab? ...I can't believe it.

1106606051.content: I avoid her livid expression and leave the lab. When I return, she's cleared out an area where we can eat.

1106606052.content: The window is open and she's sitting in the soft light at a table, fiddling with her Tarot cards. When she hears me approach, she fixes her bright gaze on me.

1106606054.content: I got you everything you wanted.

1106606055.content: Great! The white rabbit candy and apple salad are here, too.

1106606056.content: Hey, what's that on the coffee?

1106606057.content: It's a bunny. Um... I guess it's hard to tell. I did it myself, and it took me a few tries...

1106606058.content: No, I can see what it is.

1106606059.content: She takes the cup, and her face lights up.

1106606060.content: This is the first BunBun you've given me. I'll drink it, and then it'll become a part of me.

1106606061.content: Time passes, and the hour hand now points up. Ookuninushi is still making calculations on the monitors, while I'm sitting in my chair, about ready to doze off.

1106606062.content: Suddenly, something is blocking the light falling across my eyelids. I feel Ookuninushi poking my cheek.

1106606065.content: Do you want to go back home, Admin?

1106606066.content: I promise to help you complete the system upgrade.

1106606067.content: I guess you're not a total dummy after all.

1106606068.content: I made a promise, so I'm going to do it.
