710410216.content: I forgot to tell you just now that Mintha is my driver. I'm just a passenger.

710410217.content: You did that on purpose, didn't you...?

710410218.content: I'm sorry—it's just so amusing to see you in a tight spot...

710410301.content: Athena, my homework topic for today is "knights."

710410302.content: My teacher says I should learn more about the subject before trying to draw it.

710410303.content: So... why did you want to become a knight, Athena?

710410304.content: No reason in particular, actually. I was just very fond of how my grandmother looked as one: shiny and dashing.

710410306.content: After Athena walks Oneiroi through the topic for some time, the two enter the art studio. Athena, now Oneiroi's model, stands tall with her sword and gives off an air of dignified authority, befitting the leader of the Knights of Convallaria.

710410307.content: Hmm... I can't put my finger on it, but something's not quite right...

710410309.content: Could you... lift that arm a little?

710410310.content: No, no... How about you lower it instead?

710410311.content: Athena goes on to try several more poses, but Oneiroi is happy with none of them.

710410312.content: It's... harder than I thought, this modelling thing.

710410313.content: I think... Let's just go back to the first pose.

710410315.content: Are you done? Um... what is this?

710410316.content: That's you at the very beginning, Athena.

710410317.content: The drawing is not of Athena the majestic knight, but of the girl who spoke longingly of her dream to become one.

710410318.content: I thought... this would be the best.

710410319.content: While it's not what I was expecting, I must say, it is a pretty good drawing.

710410320.content: Wait a minute... does that mean I didn't need to hold that pose for you the entire time????

710110101.content: You say it's a celebration... So what are we going to eat?

710110102.content: How about barbecue? Actually, no, you ate that two days ago. You're probably sick of it by now.

710110103.content: What about noodles? A famous Sasanami noodle restaurant recently opened up a branch nearby.

710110104.content: Yeah, but have you seen the lines outside that place? If we go now, we'll be waiting for hours.

710110105.content: I don't know what to do...

710110106.content: I don't know what to do...

710110107.content: (Talk about first world problems... Why is it taking so long to choose a place to eat?)

710110109.content: Oh, I don't know where we should go...

710110111.content: Haha, why is it always impossible to pick a place when there are so much options?

710110112.content: (It's really not that hard! What's wrong with this place here?)

710110113.content: Hmm... This place doesn't have any reviews online, though.

710110114.content: (It can't be worse than you just standing here like idiots!)

710110115.content: Ver, I don't think walking up and down the same street is going to get us anywhere. Why don't we just go here?

710110117.content: Osiris's aura suddenly changes as Ausar takes over. She snatches Verthandi's hand and storms toward the nearest restaurant.

710110120.content: The food here is... much better than I thought it'd be.

710110121.content: I could have told you that an hour ago.

710110122.content: (Maybe I should just let you pick next time, Ausar?)

710110201.content: This bag is for Ver, this one's for Miss Shu, and this one's for the Admin, but I'm still missing one bag of cookies...

710110202.content: (Why are you baking so many cookies at this hour? Just go to bed already!)

710110203.content: But everyone has been so kind to me, I just want to give them a token of my appreciation.

710110204.content: (Are cookies even that hard to make?)

710110205.content: Nope, they're super easy. Why do you ask?

710110207.content: (Ausar, what are you doing with that piping bag of buttercream?)

710110208.content: I thought you put this in those squishy things you like?

710110209.content: (Squishy things? Oh, you mean cream puffs? Yes, but you don't need buttercream for cookies.)

710110210.content: Well, tell me what I need, then!

710110211.content: (Chop the butter into chunks and put it aside so it can soften. Then combine granulated sugar and icing sugar, mix it together, beat the butter...)

710110212.content: Wait wait wait wait, you're going too fast! Slow down!

710110214.content: Well, this looks terrible... Screw it. Throw it in the trash.

710110215.content: (Ausar, can you save this batch for me?)

710110218.content: (Liar... You can see they're all burnt.)

710110219.content: Yes, they are a little burnt, but I can taste all the effort you put into them.

710110220.content: For example, when you found out you couldn't use buttercream, you decided to use granulated sugar instead because you know that's what I like.

710110221.content: (Even so... burnt cookies can't taste good, can they?)

710110222.content: Nothing beats homemade cookies as a form of expressing gratitude.

710110223.content: (I'll make sure they look more appetizing next time... but I'm still gonna need you to do the taste test.)

710110301.content: Zenkibo! Are you here? I made cookies for everyone. These are yours.

710110303.content: I've been cleaning my tools and haven't tidied up yet. Can you leave the cookies on the table for now? Thanks!

710110304.content: You mean here? Sure... Hey, do you want a hand tidying up?

710110305.content: No, no, no, I can do it myself.

710110306.content: Besides, there are lots of powerful tools here.

710110307.content: Powerful tools? What kind of powerful tools?

710110309.content: Don't worry, I'm an expert cleaner. Besides, it'll take you hours to do all of this on your own.

710110310.content: True... I'll just pay a bit more attention. How unlucky can I possibly be? Well, then I'll leave it to you?

710110312.content: Then could I ask you to put all of those tools on the left back into the crate?

710110316.content: It's too late! A disheveled hologram pops out of the terminal.

710110319.content: The aura around Osiris suddenly changes, and her body rises into the air like a feather.

710110320.content: Someone's got the memory of a goldfish.

710110321.content: No, wait, just hear me out! It's not what you think!

710110322.content: Hmph, are those really what you want your last words to be?

711110101.content: One day in the training room.

711110102.content: What are you still doing here, Osiris?

711110104.content: Ah... You're Ausar, aren't you? Where's Osiris?

711110105.content: She burnt herself out practicing for your stupid exam.

711110106.content: I don't know what she's thinking... It's just a dumb test. Let me do it for her next time—I'll be done in two seconds flat. I don't know why she's going to so much effort.

711110107.content: But then if she passes, it won't mean anything.

711110108.content: Is that really what she wants?

711110109.content: Hmph. So what—I have to sit here and watch her kill herself?

711110110.content: That's not what's happening. She's doing some extra training, and I have my responsibilities as a mentor.

711110111.content: Saying this, Shu pulls out a notebook.

711110112.content: This contains summaries of all the recent combat tests. She should find it helpful.

711110113.content: You give it to her, then. What do you expect me to do with it?

711110114.content: She works too hard, especially when she thinks other people have high expectations of her... I don't want to add to the pressure she already puts on herself. And given your combat prowess, the contents of this notebook should be much easier for you to understand.

711110116.content: Can you coach her for the exam?

711110117.content: I knew it... But let me make one thing clear: I'm only doing this for my own benefit. I don't want to be the one to deal with things if she faints from exhaustion again.

711110118.content: Thank you. I'm so happy you're getting involved.

711110119.content: Okay, okay, enough of that. Come on, hand it over.

711110202.content: Oh, the Cryptics have made some kind of VR Gaming & Training Device and they want me to help them test it.

711110204.content: Yeah. It puts you in a battle simulation with Visbanes. I've got another headset here—do you wanna try?

711110205.content: A battle simulation? But I don't want to hold you back...

711110206.content: It's just a game—don't sweat it. I'll go easy.

711110208.content: I'm sorry I ruined your score, Thor...

711110209.content: What are you talking about? Your score was so high! Wanna give it another shot?

711110210.content: (It's just a game—what are you whining for?)

711110211.content: (But... she definitely would have cleared that stage if it weren't for me.)

711110212.content: (Oh, for pity's sake... Let me take over.)

711110213.content: When Osiris and Thor go in for a rematch, Ausar swaps places with Osiris and temporarily takes control of her body.

711110214.content: Huh? How did that happen? I was holding back... but we still won? Wait a second—you're not Osiris, are you?

711110215.content: You finally figured it out, dwarf.

711110216.content: Who are you calling a dwarf?! If you weren't in Osiris's body, I'd punch you right now!

711110217.content: Well, now that you know, why don't we actually make it challenging? Shall we try the highest difficulty? Or are you too chicken?

711110218.content: I'm just worried you won't be able to handle it. There's actually a hidden difficulty setting that's even harder than the highest level—shall we do that one? And I won't hold back this time.

711110221.content: Hey, you maniac! What on earth is that dragon?!

711110222.content: It must be the boss on this hidden setting. Who's chicken now?

711110223.content: Not me! I just hate losing, even if it is just a dumb game.

711110224.content: Well, we agree on something for once... Let's team up and destroy its shield!

711110225.content: Fine, just try not to get in my way.

410011001.content: How much further is it to the slum?

410011002.content: We'll be there in five minutes. As you know, the signal's poor here and the maps aren't great... Also, it's probably not a good idea to use the word "slum" with the locals.

410011003.content: It's like how in New Town, no one likes to hear the rich folks call us the "Old Townies."

410011004.content:
Fine, "Gharpur."
But I've never heard the word used apart from on the map of Jivitabad. Not in New Town, and not in the affluent district, either.

410011005.content: Prejudice can fuel a sense of superiority, miss. And I think it's natural for people to want to feel superior to someone else by putting them down with names.

410011007.content: Ha ha. You really are from Xu Heng. All I know is, people in Shashvat are exactly like that.

410011008.content: You were telling me about this "Frenzyx" thing just now...?

410011009.content: That's right. It's a stimulant that works on the nervous system. Have you heard of it before?

410011010.content: No. Doesn't sound like anything I'd want to touch. I'm just a driver, and I never, ever use anything sketchy.

410011011.content: It's not a good habit to fiddle with your communication terminal while driving.

410011012.content: It's not a good habit to fiddle with your communication terminal while driving AND yammering non-stop at the same time. But I don't think that falls under the category of "habit."

410011013.content: Luwu has taken in every word spoken, every movement made, and every change to the facial expression of the driver in the front seat, and distilled them into some kind of conclusion by using her knowledge and experience...

410011014.content: She's been used to this kind of close observation for a long time, but because of this, she's not sure if her conjecture is correct.

410011015.content: … Is that the reason you're heading to the slum? I can't think of any other reason.

410011016.content: I mean, you can't even feed houseflies off whatever's in the trash heaps there. I can't see how someone like you would have anything to do with the things there.

410011017.content: All you can find there are the refugees and criminals who're hiding from something, gangs, and fighters trying to punch their way out of this living hell.... and the not-so-clean fun.

410011018.content: Well, you've certainly cataloged the place for me... Do you know Gharpur very well?

410011019.content: Me? Nah, I'm just your regular working man over here. I'm not fit to "know" Gharpur. I'm more than happy to have nothing to do with whatever's going on in there.

410011020.content: I remember you saying that you're a boxer.

410011021.content: There're plenty of folks like me who've dabbled in boxing on the streets of New Town. But so what if I box? I can't box my way out of a knife fight, can I?

410011022.content: Is this why you wanted three times the usual rate from me? Am I paying a hazard premium?

410011023.content: I assure you this ain't extortion, miss. There's a reason no one else in New Town wanted to drive you to the slum, you know.

410011024.content: Jivitabad is the largest city in Shashvat, and its slum is also the biggest in all of the land. If you really run into trouble in there, that scant "premium" is far from enough to save us.

410011026.content: Of course. Those dopeheads there have no inkling of things like "status" and "power." All they know is to obey their boss.

410011027.content: Even if the boss tells them to beat up the mayor or something, all they'll think is, woohoo, time to smack around that silly old man...

410011028.content: By the way, what sort of business are you in? Don't tell me you're trying to sell that whatchamacallit in your hand...

410011029.content: Luwu's fingers, which have been fiddling with a bullet pendant unconsciously, stop. She puts the bullet back in her pocket, then glances at the tall buildings behind them in the rearview mirror.

410011030.content: She sits up in the back seat, her gaze fixed on the scene of grimness the car is moving towards. Her eyes are as sharp as ever, even while her brain works furiously at the problem.

410011031.content: I'm not a businesswoman. You can think of me as a bouncer of sorts.

410011033.content: You look like you know Gharpur. Don't worry about running into trouble. I'll hire you as my guide. Just name the price.

410011034.content: That's a little difficult, miss. It's all gang turf just up ahead. I'm not gonna stop my car here...

410011035.content: Um... you said you're a "bouncer of sorts"... Does that mean that you know how to fight, then?

410011036.content: Just enough to— What's going on? Why are we stopping here?

410011037.content: Luwu instinctively tenses up as the vehicle comes to a sudden halt. There's a scattering of buildings by the road outside, and it's obvious that she isn't too far from her destination.

410011038.content: The driver, silent, turns to look out the window. She can hear footsteps on the gravel outside, approaching them from both the front and the back. Then, there are two hard knocks on the car window by Luwu's hand.

410011039.content: Get out of the car! Now!

410011040.content: The palm on the car window moves away to reveal the mien of an aggressive-looking young man who doesn't look to be in the pink of health. He cocks his head at Luwu, then knocks on the driver's window.

410011041.content: Everybody, out! Waste any more of my time and your car's a goner too!

410011042.content: Did you call for these people?

410011043.content: W-why would I do that? Didn't you hear them threatening to smash up my car???

410011044.content: ... Never mind. Unlock the door. You're free to go back if you don't want trouble.

410011045.content: The driver quickly unlocks the doors when he sees a thug walk towards the car, holding a bat. Luwu reaches for something from her side of the seat, pushes the door open, and alights.

410011048.content: Ooh. Boss, it's another chick from Xu Heng. We can't let this one get away too.

410011049.content: Who are you trying to fool with that toy gun of yours? I've got a real one here, darling. Wanna see? Hahahaha…

410011050.content: Unlike his underlings, who are excitedly making obscene gestures at Luwu, the leader of the pack looks her up and down a few times, starts to frown, then gives her a two-finger sign.

410011051.content: Don't you know the rules here in Gharpur? You gotta pay if you wanna go on your way.

410011053.content: Nice try. They tell me that it costs hundreds of Gs to ride the Photon Rail just once.

410011055.content: ... And here I thought I'd only see such greed where the rich folks live.

410011056.content: Shut up, b---h, and just give us the money.

410011057.content: Surely there's something decent you can do for a living. You aren't going to last very long doing this.

410011059.content: The gang bursts into laughter, as if they've just heard a joke of some kind. Their leader, who's also sneering, shakes his head and whips out a jackknife from his pocket.

410011060.content: I got no idea what that is. I only know how to make money, and how to spend it.

410011061.content:
You have two choices now.
Give us the money, and we'll let you go. Otherwise, both you and your money are ours.

410011062.content: ... Don't make me do something you'll regret.

410011063.content: The response to Luwu is a vicious knife blow, which she easily deflects. The leader glares at Luwu as though he's been greatly insulted.

410011064.content: You arrogant—! How dare you tell me what to do?! So what if you're rich?!

410011066.content: Let's teach her a lesson about the rules here in Gharpur.

410012001.content: These people called the "Akkadians" are well-equipped and have remained cool throughout this encounter, as if they're all battle veterans themselves.

410012002.content: Their leader takes a cursory glance at Luwu, then leads his companions deeper into the slum. She's stupefied for a moment, then hurriedly puts away her gun and runs after them.

410012005.content: I've yet to thank you properly for getting me out of that jam.

410012006.content: You don't have to. You would have bulldozed them had you really started fighting.

410012007.content: Etiquette and trust are meaningless in this awful place. Just don't come here by cab if you don't want this sort of trouble again.

410012008.content: So the driver really was in cahoots with them...

410012009.content: I don't care why you're here, but you should know the nature of the people who join gangs here. They won't appreciate any breaks you give them.

410012010.content: You all are a gang too. But you don't look anything like them.

410012011.content: There are rules in the slum too. We just follow the rules of the turf we're on.

410012012.content: And you're using the word "slum." You aren't locals.

410012013.content: So whose "rules" do Neuhansa mercenaries follow when they're in Shashvat?

410012014.content: The entire squad stops in their tracks at Luwu's words, and the mercenaries, including the two younger members at the back, eye her with a hint of wariness.

410012015.content: Their leader waves her hand, signaling to the others to keep going. She stands alone in front of Luwu, refusing her to follow.

410012016.content: By our rules, you just made a threat.

410012017.content: Do not worry. I'm not interested in your guild's affairs. But if you are mercenaries, I want to hire you.

410012018.content: Someone under the influence of this thing called "Frenzyx" has stolen goods belonging to my boss. I need to find out where that thing comes from.

410012019.content: Your boss... The Tian Lu Traders?

410012020.content: Luwu looks down at the Tian Lu Traders badge hanging around her waist and nods.

410012021.content: You should look for the cops if you've been robbed of your stuff.

410012022.content: But the police in the affluent district and New Town don't intervene in any matters involving Gharpur.

410012023.content: So you know what kind of place this is... We no longer take on jobs that put us between two groups of people like this.

410012024.content: If you want information, you can go to a tavern or a fighters arena. You know who to look for in those places.

410012025.content: The brief silence that ensues indicates that the two have reached an understanding. The mercenary leader gives Luwu one last meaningful look, then turns to follow her companions.

410012026.content: Could you tell me the way? To the arenas?

410012028.content: Why do you look so surprised? In Gharpur, even a blind man can locate a fight from the sounds of it!

410012029.content: The cheers and shouts in the dark arena are at a deafening pitch. Two fighters have just entered the ring with spotlights trained on them. But something is not quite right about them.

410012031.content: First time here? Make your bet now. Ten-to-one odds for Azim!!!

410012032.content: Azim? The one in the singlet on the left?

410012033.content: That's him. He's won five fights in the last three months!

410012036.content: Five wins in three months may not sound like that much. However, the intensity of mixed martial arts fights like this one means that typically fighters don't compete more than five times in a year, as they have to recover in between bouts.

410012037.content: You two know the rules. No stopping, no dirty moves. Only one of you gets to walk out of this ring.

410012039.content: The burly and fierce-looking referee has also caught Luwu's eye. However, any questions she may have had vanish when the two fighters start going at each other.

410012040.content: This is like no other sanctioned fight Luwu has ever seen. The referee said "no dirty moves," but he might as well have not said that at all.

410012041.content: Despite his slightly smaller physique, Azim's flexible moves and fast punches are getting the job done. These, coupled with his superhuman reaction times, are making the fight a rather one-sided affair...

410012042.content: Though his eyes are dull and his muscles stiff, his explosive movements and reaction times are nothing like those of ordinary people. His skin is red and blotchy all over, and his breathing is highly irregular... These are exactly the symptoms the Frenzyx-fueled robbers had.

410012043.content: Looks like I've found what I'm looking for.

410012044.content: Luwu takes a look around her. No one in the audience, nor the referee, react to this scene in any way. The alarm bells in her head are ringing louder and louder.

410012045.content: Guess the use of banned substances is really commonplace around here...

410012046.content: As the match goes on, the gap between the two fighters becomes increasingly clear, and the weaker fighter is soon on the edge of collapse.

410012047.content: In the end, Azim slams his knee into his opponent's ribs, seeming to breaking them, and as his opponent staggers backwards, he follows up with a quick uppercut to the chin. The match is concluded less than three minutes after it started.

410012048.content: The cheers of the crowd drown out the thud of the loser falling to the ground. The referee raises Azim's right arm and announces him as the winner while the two of them circle the ring to acknowledge the audience sitting below.

410012049.content: As the referee and Azim's eyes sweep over the crowd to Luwu, who's still sitting in the corner amidst the excitement around her and sticking out like quite the sore thumb, both of them are momentarily taken aback.

410012050.content: Our generous and gracious guest from Xu Heng! I trust that you had fun watching the match?

410012051.content: It was quite the eye-opener, indeed... Mr. Azim, a few moments of your time, please.

410012052.content: I'm sorry, but I don't know you.

410012053.content: There's no need to worry, Mr. Azim. I just have a few questions for you.

410012054.content: Wait, wait, hold on. Are you a cop? Or are you from the local prosecutor's office?

410012056.content: Then watch your tone, visitor. Here in Gharpur, the way you're speaking sounds very hostile.

410012057.content: Azim needs to rest right now. This is not the time to talk, no matter what your business is.

410012058.content: The referee is speaking with some authority, as if he's a figure of some importance around here. The guards in the arena all train their eyes on Luwu, following what the referee is saying.

410012059.content: Luwu looks at Azim. His lips are a little blue. Though he isn't hurt, he looks unsteady on his feet, and his muscles are twitching. All effects of Frenzyx.

410012060.content: Alright, then. We can wait until you recover. You can also think about this in the meantime: If you're ever interested in fighting in a formal boxing match in the affluent district...

410012062.content: I'll see you outside in half an hour.

410012063.content: ... You've been standing here for half an hour just to jerk me around? I'm not telling you anything.

410012065.content: Azim turns to leave as soon as the word "Frenzyx" leaves Luwu's mouth. She quickly steps forward to stop him and deftly thwarts several attempts by him to just push past her.

410012066.content: The young boxer looks at the outsider before him, shocked, and a certain wariness gradually appears in his eyes.

410012067.content: I'm not yanking your chain. You have good technique and what it takes for proper match-ups.

410012068.content: I know a few businesspeople, and several of them are match sponsors. I can recommend you for a match, but first you must tell me what I want to know.

410012069.content: ... How much do you know about Gharpur?

410012070.content: This is my first time here. I just arrived an hour or so ago.

410012071.content: ... Listen here, ma'am: You have zero idea of what this place is about. You have zero idea of why they seperate this place, the Civilian District and the Affluent Distrct apart.

410012072.content: Fight in a match in Affluent District? The last person I knew who took up a deal like that is dead. He ****ing croaked in the ring, that one.

410012073.content: So you want to put my life on the line just for the entertainment of the wealthy, huh? You can ---- off right now.

410012075.content:
Looks like you've never heard that.
I'm not surprised. Just look at this street. Lives are a dozen a penny over here.

410012076.content: The sound of hawking has filled the market air, and the folks on the street wear smiles on their faces. There's graffiti, vivid and full of life, everywhere. Everything in sight seems to contradict Azim's grim complaints.

410012077.content: But keen observers know to look beneath a glossy surface.

410012078.content: Beneath all the bustle, there is chaos, and behind the smiles, there is a numbness of spirit. There is rust on the iron and cracks in the cement all through the slum, and the heavy metal music being played outside is a nihilistic protest against all that is heavy and sinking...

410012080.content: No one wants to draw attention to themselves on these gang-ridden streets. I live here, lady, and unlike you, I can't just scoot when things get bad.

410012081.content: I'm not trying to make things difficult for you. I just want to know where the stuff is coming from. Tell me, and I promise to keep you out of whatever happens next.

410012082.content: I'd sooner believe that you can help me find a new home in the affluent district.

410012084.content: If I give you that name, I could lose my life!

410012085.content: Azim cautiously scans the people around them to make sure that no one is watching, then takes two steps back to distance himself from Luwu.

410012086.content: There are certain rules here in Gharpur. B----, I don't care if you're a cop or what. That's all I have to tell you.

410012087.content: Luwu frowns slightly. But this isn't the time to stop someone who's wary of her. Azim puts his hands together to give Luwu a cursory goodbye. Just as he turns to leave, however, he suddenly stops as if he's walked into something.

410012088.content: Amidst a pleasant song of wind chimes, Luwu hears the voice of a surprised young woman from behind Azim.

410012089.content: Azim? So it's true? You're really fighting for the Panthera?!

410012091.content: Please tell me you're not doped up too.

410012092.content: ... There's nothing to worry about. I'm done with the match, and I collected the prize money too...

410012093.content: The voice is one that Luwu has heard every now and then on the comms between Tian Lu Traders and Meruism, a Modifier organization in Shashvat.

410012094.content: Luwu tilts her head to one side and sees the young lady Azim called Kali. She's holding a wind chime in her hand...

410012096.content: Although Kali is rather petite, she looks as powerful as Luwu. She's examining Azim with one hand on her hip and a serious, somewhat unhappy emotion on her face. The boxer, who's several times taller and stronger than her, looks away with a guilty expression.

410012097.content: As Luwu stares at this young lady who's suddenly appeared, the lady in question's gaze is also drawn to her, her eyes slowly widening in the process.

410012098.content: Oh, it's you, Luwu! Why didn't you tell me you were coming to Shashvat?

410021001.content: A little girl who's been squatting by the street raises her head, having heard familiar footsteps among the numerous sounds on the street corner. She runs towards the trio heading her way.

410021002.content: Lila, baby girl... what are you doing out here?

410021003.content: Everyone said that Papa is out fighting where the bad men are... Are you hurt, Papa?

410021004.content: No, of course not. Remember what I told you?

410021005.content: Papa is the best boxer and will always win. Papa will also go make movies and bring home lots of money to cure me.

410021006.content: That's right—Papa is the best boxer in all of Gharpur, and always knocks out his opponents in round one! There's no way I can be hurt.

410021007.content: Just you wait, Lila. Papa will become a famous action star. And then you'll see me in the movies!

410021009.content: Heh, time to go back inside. Come, get on my shoulders and we'll go in together.

410021011.content: Wow, a purple wind chime! I have a complete rainbow now!

410021012.content: Kali hands the wind chime to the little girl. The girl is smiling, and so is she.

410021013.content: Thank you so much, Kali! Bye bye!

410021014.content: Azim greets another two people walking behind him, then carries his daughter on his shoulders and walks into the building in front of them. The building, a mish-mash of modifications and expansions on what looks like an old structure, would probably be considered magnificent in the slum...

410021015.content: Five matches in three months. Is he working this hard so he can afford medical treatment for his daughter? How bad is her condition?

410021016.content: Yes, and what she has is really hard to treat. It could all be over for her if she doesn't get surgery soon.

410021017.content: You've seen how things are in Gharpur. We don't even have a proper hospital here. Thankfully, there's a pharma company in the area that's willing to send Lila to the Civilian District for treatment, but it'll cost money.

410021018.content: Meruism has provided lodging to Lila here to help offset Azim's costs. But he'll still have to rustle up the money for the surgery.

410021019.content: There's a thriving pharmaceutical and medical industry in Shashvat. Isn't there a doctor or two who's willing to come out here to treat the people?

410021020.content: Ah, but all the doctors in Shashvat care about is how best to climb the social ladder. All these people work so hard to get into medical school so they can to get a residence permit of the Affluent District.

410021021.content: Licensed physicians are allowed to stay in New Town even if they can't find a job in the Affluent District. They are treated with respect there, and there's no reason for them to help their fellow people in Gharpur.

410021022.content: Tian Lu Traders can help, if necessary.

410021023.content: I'm here with my colleagues from Business Development to survey the market in Shashvat. Once they're done, they should have some time to check out Gharpur and see if there's any business opportunities here, including in healthcare.

410021024.content: Meruism has done business with Tian Lu Traders for so many years. We're well aware of what you're capable of.

410021025.content: But some people may become unhappy if you wish to extend your interest beyond Meruism to the common people.

410021026.content: Come inside. We shouldn't be talking about certain matters out here.

410021027.content: Though the lobby of the Meruism building cannot be called posh, it's clear that effort has been put into its decoration.

410021028.content: The once-worn concrete flooring has been tiled over and made cozier with a rustic rug. The stained glass and graffiti on the walls convey a sense of both order and chaos in the dim light, creating a mysterious sense of loss.

410021029.content: What do you think? Looks totally different from what you can see on the comms, doesn't it?

410021030.content: I've never really looked at the background while we were talking business... But it looks good. Did you decorate the place yourselves?

410021031.content: Heh, interior decoration and all that aren't really my thing. The person responsible for it is also a Modifier. But unfortunately, she isn't here right now.

410021032.content: Luwu's keen study of the interior, which is completely different from all of the other places she's been to, is interrupted by a name Kali utters.

410021033.content: I thought Zhiming had returned when they told me there's someone from Xu Heng out here. Has she gone to look for you? Or is she back in Xu Heng already?

410021034.content: ... Zhiming? Are you talking about Zhiming, the deputy of the Quad?

410021035.content: Of course. I don't think that's a common name in Xu Heng?

410021036.content: I haven't encountered her here yet. But I don't think she's back in Xu Heng yet either. Hmm...

410021037.content: There's been some trouble in Xu Heng recently. I heard that the Quad and Aether Gazer encountered a Cognizant Visbane on the ground, and there was some problem with the Astral Engine too.

410021038.content: Why would Deputy Zhiming be here at this time, instead of holding down the fort at Shuofang Isle?

410021039.content: She was here to see Chief Brahmā, who unfortunately still isn't back yet. She stayed with us for two whole weeks, but refused to tell us the reason why. She's just as tightlipped as Brahmā...

410021040.content: And then, one day, she just left, saying that she was off to look for the Chief. That was the last time we saw her. I thought she'd returned after completing what she came here to do.

410021041.content: Brahmā. That's a name Luwu's heard before. Like Gengchen, Brahmā is a Prime Modifier and a leader of Meruism. However, she's never been a part of any of the dealings between Tian Lu Traders and Meruism, so that's all Luwu knows about her.

410021042.content: Luwu's intuition tells her that something serious has to be up for a deputy of the Quad to visit a Prime Modifier.

410021043.content: I say, Luwu, if you're looking for information in Gharpur, why didn't you just come to us? Mind you, I've invited you several times.

410021044.content: As I'm on a mission, I thought I'd come by after the job was done. I didn't think it would be nice to involve you, since Meruism isn't part of the cross-zone cooperation agreement.

410021045.content: Agreement? You mean the one CORG spearheaded?

410021046.content: Yes. I've heard that Meruism doesn't exactly have the best relationship with CORG?

410021047.content: Um... Well... I'm not sure where to start with that...

410021048.content: The duo climb up a few flights of stairs and run into Azim, who's on his way back down. Kali offers a greeting in a familiar fashion.

410021049.content: Hey, Azim. Are you off to buy Lila's medicine?

410021050.content: Yeah, we only have enough doses left for two days. I've made quite a bit of money recently, so I can pay for the medicine this time.

410021051.content: Well, as long as it's not a hardship for you. Say hi to Madam Seema for me.

410021053.content: Madam Luwu, I'm sorry about just now. If I'd known you were a friend of Meruism, I'd have immediately told you what you needed to know.

410021054.content: That's alright. I promised to keep you out of whatever happens next, and that promise still stands. Don't worry about it.

410021055.content: Azim thanks Luwu again, then leaves with just an old sling bag on him. Kali continues to walk Luwu up the building's stairs, as if the elevator in the corner doesn't exist.

410021056.content: Are we going to the rooftop?

410021057.content: No, no, we're almost at our destination.

410021058.content: On the surface, Meruism is supposed to be just another gang on the streets. We keep things looking rowdy on the levels closest to the ground for the sake of appearances.

410021059.content: The middle floors are where we house the orphans we take care of. This is also where we help folks who've run into some difficulty, like Azim and Lila.

410021060.content: The top floors are where our Modifier activities take place. Asura visited Ain Soph a few months ago and said that Aether Gazer is laid out the same way. I guess great minds do think alike!

410021061.content: Asura? Is the girl still traveling the world?

410021062.content: Yeah. I'm not sure what Brahmā told her, but she seems to be looking for something.

410021063.content: It's not a bad idea for her to scratch the itch out there, though. Beats having her stay here in Gharpur and demolish every opponent who comes her way in the arenas...

410021064.content:
We can talk now. This floor's quiet enough.
Want a can of milk tea? It's a Gharpur specialty.

410021065.content: The two of them seat themselves on a sofa set against a wall. Kali pulls out a drink from the fridge and tosses it over to Luwu. It's in an aluminum can without any brand or manufacturer information on it.

410021066.content: Luwu takes a sip of the tea, which is delicious. Perhaps in Shashvat, the tastebuds are the one great equalizer for all.

410021067.content: Azim told me just now that the Panthera are the ones supplying Frenzyx.

410021068.content: That's pretty much an open secret among the gangs here.

410021069.content: But that's illegal. Aren't the authorities doing anything about it?

410021070.content: Don't ask me... Gharpur runs on a special set of rules. To interfere with the business of another gang basically amounts to declaring war. Same goes for the police. And this is the business of humans, which means it's not something I can try to resolve with my Access Key.

410021071.content: Besides, you know our relationship with CORG. Stirring up trouble like this will only give them an excuse to close Meruism down.

410021073.content: Seeing the displeasure on Luwu's face, Kali slowly puts down the newly opened drink in her hand.

410021074.content: The riskiest businesses often bring the greatest returns, and most gang members are the risk-taking type to start with. We can't do anything about this... Sorry...

410021075.content: The best thing Meruism can do is ban all that dangerous stuff from our turf. The same goes for the other gangs. The Panthera are so powerful that no one is willing to try anything on their turf.

410021077.content: Luwu, this may be the first time I'm seeing you in person, but we've worked together for a while now. We all know that you're a good person and hate operating in the gray.

410021078.content: But working in the gray here is how one survives. This isn't something you can change with the power of a Modifier alone.

410021079.content: Luwu silently takes another sip of her milk tea. For some reason, it isn't as tasty or aromatic as her first sip.

410021080.content: It's not that she doesn't understand Meruism's position on the matter. After all, in its early days, Tian Lu Traders had to follow the rules of trade in order to deal with the greedy businessmen of Xu Heng, too.

410021081.content: Tian Lu Traders is, after all, only a commercial enterprise and can't possibly clean up the entire market, let alone right all of the wrongs wrought by it.

410021082.content: There are many everyday folks living here inside the Meruism compound. Some of them are youths who refuse to engage in illegal dealings for a living, and others are orphans. And then there are folks who need help, like Azim and Lila...

410021083.content: What they need is not the distant, abstract concept of justice, but a reprieve from the daily goings-on around them. All they need is some way to survive.

410021084.content: This bit of information is enough. Thank you for the tea.

410021085.content: What are you plotting? Don't be impulsive now.

410021086.content: It has nothing to do with impulsivity. The whole reason I came here is to help solve problems.

410021087.content: Hold on, hold on: Even if you were to go to the Panthera now—

410021088.content: Just as Kali is about to reach her hand out and stop Luwu, the surface of the plain coffee table next to them suddenly lights up. Incongruously, a holographic map appears in the otherwise old-looking room.

410021089.content: A map of Jivitabad? I see New Town, Gharpur... What's that red dot over there?

410021090.content: ... That's the problem that needs our attention.

410022001.content: Just like Kali said, the one or two Visbanes that appear now and then don't pose a major threat to the Modifiers. Luwu and Kali took care of the Visbanes in this area handily.

410022002.content: The remaining Bane Energy turns into black data bits that then dissipate into the ether, and the two of them put away their Access Keys. Kali pulls out a Bane Energy detector that's linked to Meruism HQ and makes sure no Visbanes remain.

410022004.content: No need to thank me. Does Meruism know where these Visbanes are coming from?

410022005.content: They ought to be coming from the Source Layer? Zhiming tried to look into it but came up empty.

410022006.content: You said that Zhiming was at Meruism for two whole weeks. Is this what she was busy with?

410022007.content: Not really. Although she would often creep into our workroom and stay there, not talking to anyone sometimes... But most of her time here, she was helping out with Meruism business.

410022008.content: She knows so many things. I can see why she's been put in charge of Shuofang Isle. She also created a number of really useful things for us, like that holographic display-slash-coffee table over there.

410022009.content: Amazing, isn't it? It's like she can do magic.

410022010.content: Zhiming's engineering chops are well-known... It sounds like she was passing time while waiting for Brahmā.

410022011.content: You must be kidding. That's one unusual way to "pass the time."

410022012.content: I'm not. A number of local researchers and engineers have mentioned her by name during our encounters with potential business partners here in Shashvat.

410022013.content: Our discussions would go so much more smoothly if we had her with us. She'd be such a great help with this Frenzyx issue, too...

410022014.content: I saw that Meruism has surveillance cameras installed along its perimeter. Could I look at the videos of Zhiming, by any chance? Maybe they can show us where she's gone.

410022015.content: Luwu and Kali return to the Meruism headquarters, where they pull up all of the clips of Zhiming, starting from the day she arrived and ending with the last time she was seen a week ago.

410022017.content: For some reason, the Zhiming they see in the videos looks rather unhappy and unapproachable. She doesn't speak to anyone, and nothing about her movements seems unusual.

410022019.content: She appeared to be in a little bit of a hurry on the day she left, and it looks like she was holding something in her right hand. I can't tell what it is, though...

410022020.content: She is a deputy at the Quad, after all. Maybe she had something important to attend to. We'll just have to look into this Frenzyx problem ourselves.

410022021.content: Are you still going to look up the Panthera?

410022022.content:
The boss and the supplier who was robbed are still waiting to hear from me.
Don't worry, I'll go by myself. I won't get Meruism involved in this.

410022024.content: Kali takes a worried glance at the stairs.

410022025.content: A while ago, some kids were duped into selling this stuff on the streets, but thankfully, we discovered it in time. We're looking into this ourselves, since we don't want this to happen again. But the trail stopped at the Panthera.

410022026.content: The arena Azim fought at earlier today is under Panthera control. Do you think the people at a place like that would tell you the truth?

410022027.content: ... I used to be a police officer back in Xu Heng. There are many ways to make people talk.

410022028.content: But you aren't one now, you're an employee of Tian Lu Traders. What are you going to do, start arresting people?

410022029.content: I know it's not my place to do that here.

410022030.content: All I want is to do is obtain the names of the ones responsible and the evidence against them—that's all.

410022031.content: Things won't be that easy, you know. We aren't in Xu Heng...

410022032.content: The disagreement between the two is cut short by the sound of a communicator notification.

410022033.content: Kali looks at Luwu and sees that she is gradually unclenching a fist. Luwu takes the call without another word.

410022035.content: Kali remains silent. She turns off the video player, then gets to her feet to pour glasses of water for Luwu and herself.

410022036.content: But when she returns, Luwu, who is usually so calm and collected, seems to have been overcome by panic and a sense of helplessness.

410022039.content: It's only been one night. But what happened...? I'll return right away—

410022040.content: ... I'm at Meruism HQ right now. We were just talking about Zhiming. Yes, I'll keep my eyes open... Wait, you said that Baize is the one leading the CORG group right now?

410022041.content: ... It's nothing. No, we don't have any beef or anything... I'll keep things professional.

410022042.content: ... Alright, I'll try to wrap things up here as soon as I can.

410022043.content: Luwu looks a little distracted as she hangs up. She picks up the glass of water set in front of her but doesn't raise it to her lips.

410022044.content: The water line is swaying up and down the side of the glass. Luwu looks down at it, and uses both her hands to force the movement to stop.

410022045.content: Kali simply watches Luwu, saying nothing. Judging from Luwu's side of the conversation, something happened in Xu Heng the night before.

410022046.content: A Quake in Yu Jing, a Prime-level Cognizant Visbane, Gengchen missing... Although Kali has never lived in Xu Heng, she's shaken by the grave situation she's hearing about.

410022047.content: ... The Quad can't seem to reach Zhiming, either. Nobody knows where she's gone.

410022049.content: Don't worry, there weren't too many casualties. We Modifiers need to always be prepared for occurrences like this, anyway...

410022050.content: They restored order in Yu Jing quite quickly, thanks to help from CORG and Aether Gazer. The Boss is leading a team to search for the Chief herself, and she wants me to focus on the job here.

410022051.content: The last time someone at the Quad talked to Zhiming, she was still in Shashvat. CORG's sending over a team to look for her, and the Quad wants me to keep my eyes peeled for leads.

410022052.content: I have to settle this Frenzyx matter as quickly as possible, so don't try to talk me out of it. I must get back to Xu Heng pronto—they need as many hands as they can get.

410022054.content: Find out where and when people are receiving the stuff. Once we have that, we'll locate the supplier.

410022055.content: That's quite the plan... Where and when they're receiving Frenzyx? I'll go talk to those kids who were duped earlier. Maybe they'll be able to find out.

410022056.content: You want to use kids to get intel for you? That doesn't sound right.

410022057.content:
Remember this is the way of life here in Gharpur.
Just like how the kids in the affluent district have to learn etiquette and skills and all that to get by, the kids here in Gharpur have to learn how to rely on themselves.

410022058.content: Don't forget to come to me if you need help. Meruism has a bit of sway here in Gharpur, after all.

410022060.content: We can also help with finding out where Zhiming has gone. I'll have the boys downstairs ask around. She only left here a week ago, so the people who encountered her should still remember something.

410022061.content: Oh, that's right—no one's dared enter the workroom she was using during her visit. Given the present circumstances... should we go in and have a look?

410031003.content: AAAAAAAAAAH what's going on why can't I see???!!!

410031004.content: ... It's okay. That box you just opened has a Blinder icon on it. It's disrupted the light waves in the room.

410031005.content: Let's head outside for now. I still remember the way out...

410031007.content: Wait—it sounds like something just broke. Did you step on something, Luwu?

410031008.content: I don't remember anything being here, though...

410031009.content: Perhaps entering Zhiming's workroom wasn't such a good idea, after all. Feeling rather regretful, Kali and Luwu slowly feel their way the darkness. They finally reach the door and return to the lobby very sheepishly.

410031010.content: Although it's still day outside, the room is completely dark. Luwu and Kali wait outside the door. It's a good five minutes before the rays of the setting sun start to penetrate the workroom again.

410031011.content: Smack in the center of the room is a sheet of paper with the ancient Xu Heng character for "Ethereal" on it. But one of them must've stepped on it on their way out earlier, because only a small, sad corner of the sheet remains dangling from the door.

410031012.content: All these things... You should get someone to bring them back to Xu Heng. Except for that shield, maybe, since it's already broken into pieces.

410031013.content:
Oh, is this optical camouflage coating? No wonder we didn't see it when we entered.
Don't take it to the garbage heap just yet—the coating on the shield's quite useful.

410031015.content: Luwu shakes her head in amusement at the sight of Kali waving her hands repeatedly, as if she's shying away. She finally takes a look inside, then closes the door with some regret.

410031016.content: This action finally dislodges the sheet of paper from the door, and the ancient character falls into Luwu's hand, setting off an inexplicable sense of anxiety in her. But she quickly calms down, folds the sheet, and puts it in her pocket.

410031017.content: It's unfortunate—there's nothing useful here. Only these small items and a pile of drawings I don't understand.

410031018.content: Most people don't write their schedule down on paper. It makes sense that we didn't find anything here.

410031019.content: It's getting late, and we haven't gotten any updates about Frenzyx or Zhiming yet. You should rest for now.

410031020.content: How about you stay here tonight? We have quite a few empty rooms upstairs.

410031021.content: Sounds good. I was just thinking about where I was going to stay. Thank you so much.

410031022.content: I'm gonna take a walk in the evening, since I haven't had the time to really check out this place yet. That'll help me familiarize myself with the area as well.

410031024.content: Will that be alright? If we wander into another gang's turf by mistake, they're gonna link me to Meruism.

410031025.content: If a fight were to start... people will start to talk about you... Are you worried that I'll get into trouble on my own?

410031026.content: Kali purses her lips but doesn't say anything in reply.

410031027.content: Don't worry, I know what I'm doing.

410031028.content: Luwu asks Kali for the latest map of Gharpur, which she studies as she descends the stairs to plan her route of travel.

410031029.content: Because of Kali's position in Meruism, as her guest, Luwu is greeted warmly everyone on the lower floors and she has to greet them all one by one. As a result, she doesn't manage to memorize the gangs and where their turfs are marked on the map before she gets to the ground floor.

410031030.content: Never mind. I'll just keep looking at it as I go... Hmm?

410031031.content: She glances down and sees a little girl on the street corner, who seems to be looking for something. Purple wind chimes light up the street lamps one by one. Luwu hesitates for a moment, then walks over to her and squats down.

410031032.content: Lila? Why are you sitting here all by yourself? Where's your fa— your papa?

410031033.content: Oh, you were with Kali earlier...

410031034.content:
Papa went to buy medicine for me earlier in the afternoon. I'm waiting for him to come back for dinner.
Do you know when he'll return?

410031035.content: Luwu's first impression of the safety of the slum—namely, her encounter with the bat-wielding gangsters upon her arrival—has left her less than assured. A father who's failed to show for dinner on time is cause for alarm indeed.

410031036.content: But Azim's a professional boxer, and a cautious man to boot. It's hard to imagine that someone could cause trouble for him.

410031037.content: I'm sorry, I haven't seen your papa. But I'm heading out now, and if I see him, I'll tell him to come home quick.

410031039.content: You should go back for dinner now. Eat up all your food and you'll become as strong as a horse. Then your papa won't have to worry as much about you when he's gone out.

410031040.content: Luwu walks Lila back to the elevator that will take her back to Meruism's middle floors, then lets out a sigh as she returns to the street.

410031041.content: The line between the night sky and the ground is blurred by the high-rise buildings and shadows, which loom over the people below. The noise of the streets rushes like a wave through the narrow alleys to Luwu's ears, then settle down into emptiness.

410031042.content: She's here to solve a problem: Locate the source of the illicit substance, obtain the names of the key people involved, and obtain the needed evidence. This is both her job and what her sense of justice drives her to do.

410031043.content: However, what just transpired in Xu Heng has rattled her a little. While she knows that she alone can't change the situation in Xu Heng, she can't help feeling her current mission on these chaotic streets is needlessly trivial, even absurd.

410031044.content: ... But lives are at stake here. I mustn't get distracted.

410031045.content: She massages her temples vigorously, then opens the map Kali gave her to start plotting her route for the evening.

410031046.content: Although the driver who brought Luwu to the slum was no angel, he was right about one thing: Gharpur is the biggest slum in Shashvat, and she's seen only a small fraction of it today.

410031047.content: Meruism, the Panthera, and the Akkadians... Influence over the streets of Gharpur has been divvied up among these factions, who each control just a few roads. This has also made it impossible for any one party to make any significant change in Gharpur.

410031048.content: And there are smaller factions lying in wait for the right time to pounce. No wonder Meruism is so cautious.

410031049.content: The night is growing darker. Luwu makes her way through most of the slum, asking about Azim and Zhiming along the way. She even returns to the arena she was at earlier, but is unable to learn anything new.

410031050.content: She spots a tavern and is about to enter and ask for information, when she hears the sound of bottles breaking inside. Two belligerent groups of patrons spill onto the street, brawling with each other.

410031051.content: The strange thing is, the other tavern patrons don't seem agitated at all by this occurrence. Instead, many of them, including two tipsy-looking policemen, have moved their stools closer to the door to watch the spectacle.

410031052.content: Hey, is anyone taking bets? There's no need to worry about rigging, with so many eyes here!

410031053.content: Hey, hey, hey, old man. I know you want to watch the show, and your eyesight's not good, but just keep clear, you hear?

410031054.content: Hey! Lady from Xu Heng! Who are you betting on to win?

410031055.content: What are the two of you doing?!

410031056.content: Whoa, that tone. What do you want with us?

410031057.content: You're in uniform, for goodness' sake, and there's dozens of people fighting out there. But the first thing you think of is betting?!

410031058.content: We're off duty now, miss. Besides, who are you to talk to us like that? Do you think anyone cares?

410031059.content: If you're not going to uphold the law, you shouldn't be wearing that uniform at all.

410031060.content: You dumb b----! Who's the cop here, you or me?! This slum has gone to the gutters, anyway! What can you do about it?!

410031061.content:
You want to stop the fight, go ahead!
Now who wants to bet on this person from Xu Heng to win? Let's get the pot going!

410031062.content: While Luwu is speaking with the policemen, the street fight has become more intense. While the two groups started off using nothing but their bare fists, eventually steel pipes, bottles, and chairs become involved.

410031063.content: Then someone in the scuffle produces a bottle with a rag stuffed in its opening. Luwu is taken aback for a moment. By the time she gets herself together again, a fiery puddle and shattered glass have landed on the wooden flooring outside the tavern.

410031064.content: The crowd that has gathered to watch the spectacle silently move back from the spreading fire, ignoring the enraged tavern owner's vigorous complaints. Luwu produces her spear and lightly prods both policemen in the back with it.

410031065.content: Are you still going to do nothing?

410031066.content: ... Damn it. Step back from the fire, people! And someone get the firefighters!

410031067.content: Chaos and alarm finally ripple through the crowd. Luwu massages the bridge of her nose tiredly, then starts walking towards the two brawling factions.

410032001.content: You! Yes, you, you ----face! Come over here!

410032002.content: Luwu, arms folded, is standing on one side and watching the goings-on coldly. The two policemen, who've now sobered up, are angrily putting a young man in handcuffs while reprimanding the two groups.

410032003.content: Do you bloody know who this tavern belongs to? You morons! You should thank your lucky stars that Meruism was here to put out the fire!

410032004.content: You people really crossed the line. Don't you ----ing know the rules around here? I'm putting your sorry butt in jail this time.

410032005.content: Alright, fun's over. The rest of you, scram. I don't wanna see your faces around here.

410032006.content: The onlookers have since long distanced themselves from the fray. The brawlers, blue and black all over, make their respective exits as the grumbling tavern owner shuts the door. Meanwhile, the young man responsible for the Molotov cocktail is bundled into a police vehicle.

410032007.content: Throughout this entire process, the final group of people to arrive on the scene are left unbothered by both the spectators and the brawlers. They know that the group is made up of people they can't afford to mess with.

410032008.content: ... I thought that when the policeman said go get firefighters, they were going to get the fire department.

410032009.content: You could call this a part-time gig of mine. We're really good at putting out fires too, you know.

410032010.content: Earlier you told me that you knew what you were doing. But then you went and got into an argument with policemen?

410032011.content: They're not fit to be called policemen.

410032013.content:
"The slum has gone to the gutters and is beyond help."
I can't believe I heard these words from an enforcer of the law.

410032014.content: I know what you were trying to tell me, Kali. And they weren't wrong at all. But just because you recognize the situation for what it is, that doesn't mean you have to accept it.

410032015.content: But there's little you can achieve by berating the cops like that. They're just rank and file. There've been cops who've tried to make a difference here in Gharpur, but they always vanish after a short while.

410032016.content: There's no place for the police within the system of rules set by the gangs. Those who remain here are the ones who know how to play by the rules.

410032017.content: Luwu opens her mouth as if to speak, but ultimately only lets out a soft sigh. She looks down at the bullet pendant in her hand, an item that she carries everywhere with her.

410032018.content: This bullet... is it the real deal? Do you still use guns these days?

410032019.content: It's been a long time since I last used one. This bullet... was from a friend from a long time ago. When I was still a cop.

410032020.content: You were gifted a bullet? What an interesting present.

410032021.content:
I can't tell if you really meant that.
She's someone who works at CORG.

410032022.content: ... Meruism and CORG don't have the best relationship, unfortunately. But that doesn't mean that everyone at CORG is my enemy.

410032023.content: Who is it that CORG's sending out here to look for Zhiming...? "Baize" or something like that?

410032024.content: Ah, you heard my conversation with the Boss.

410032025.content: Well, I was right in front of you. Even if I'd covered my ears, I would have heard everything.

410032026.content: So why did she give you the bullet? Sounds like there's an interesting story behind it.

410032027.content: Sorry to disappoint you, but there's not much of one. I was still with the police back then, and we were coworkers...

410032028.content: The scene of the brawl is now covered in broken glass and wood splinters, and there's a large burn mark on the wall of the tavern. Luwu pauses for a moment, then gives Kali a serious look.

410032029.content: ... Kali. Do you believe in justice?

410041003.content: Several bullets graze the fleeing criminal's clothes, and he nimbly makes his way around a corner in the Old Town Ruins and disappears. Luwu is in hurried pursuit as she picks up the call on her communicator.

410041006.content: ... Target was not hit. I'm pursuing him now.

410041007.content:
Keep going. I'm just 400 meters to your front.
And sign yourself up for a refresher training at the range when you get back.

410041009.content: As Luwu chases the criminal around the corner, she sees a great sprawl of collapsed buildings. The criminal starts to scramble over these ruins, which slows down his movement speed significantly.

410041011.content: Luwu is well-known in her squad for her physical fitness. These obstacles are nothing to her, and she soon catches up.

410041012.content: The opportunity to capture the criminal is now in front of her. With zero hesitation, she puts away her gun and swiftly climbs over a low wall. Now, she's almost directly above her target.

410041014.content: Luwu fires several shots as she pounces on the criminal, and one of them hits him in the calf. However, before he falls, he quickly rolls sideways to put some distance between himself and Luwu.

410041015.content: When he's on his side, the weapon grip in the inner pocket of his coat becomes visible. The sight of it alarms Luwu. Upon landing, she quickly draws her gun and aims it at the fugitive.

410041016.content: Her target is a little slower at drawing his gun. However, he's clearly unwilling to surrender and keeps the muzzle raised. Instinctively, Luwu pulls the trigger.

410041017.content: Her bullet passes through his right shoulder and his gun-toting arm drops. But he stares at the gun in Luwu's hand as if he can't feel the pain at all. She's run out of ammo.

410041019.content: In the heat of the chase, Luwu has forgotten to keep track of the number of bullets remaining in her clip. Her target switches to his still-usable left hand and points his weapon at Luwu's head, a grin on his face.

410041021.content: Luwu stares blankly at the hole in the criminal's temple. With her hand held over the graze wound on her shoulder, she turns around and sees Baize, who's walking towards her from around a hundred meters away.

410041022.content: Baize sighs when she spots Luwu's weapon and the bullet hole in the criminal's shoulder. She comes to stand in front of Luwu and straightens out the latter's clothes, which have become a little untidy from the chase.

410041025.content: Luwu takes her hand off her injured shoulder. While there's now a bright splotch of red on her top, the bleeding has stopped.

410041028.content: This man is a murderer and has a gun on him, and you didn't aim for his head? Please tell me you can land a shot from two meters away.

410041029.content: I mean, I was a little careless with my ammo clip. But my priority was to capture him so he can be punished by the law.

410041030.content: Well, he's been penalized in accordance with clause four of the Weapons Regulations. Any objections?

410041031.content: ... Firearms discharge is permissible when there is a threat to life. Moreover, this was an attack on a police officer. No questions, ma'am.

410041032.content: But I do not agree that I should be called a "bonehead" for my actions. If this were to happen to me again, I would do the same exact thing... But I'll pay closer attention to the number of bullets I have left next time.

410041033.content: Baize stares for Luwu for quite a while, but the latter doesn't flinch at all. Slowly Baize nods, removes the clip from her weapon, and retrieves a bullet from it.

410041034.content: Do you really believe in justice that much?

410041035.content: I... It's why I chose this vocation to begin with.

410041036.content: And I trust it must have been the same for you.

410041037.content:
... You really are a bonehead.
Take this.

410041038.content: Baize presses the bullet into Luwu's hand, then proceeds to take out her terminal and take pictures of the criminal as if nothing had happened.

410041039.content: Let this be a reminder that you must always have a way out of a situation in the back of your mind.

410041040.content: And that was how I got this bullet.

410041041.content: I had a close shave with death that day, and I suppose I hold on to this bullet to remind me to be more vigilant.

410041042.content: Luwu and Kali chat the whole way back to the Meruism headquarters. They seem to have completely forgotten the reason they didn't set out together earlier in the evening.

410041043.content: Baize sounds like a righteous person, if she went out with you on a case about a human.

410041044.content: That's true. Many CORG superintendents do not go on operations with the human officers, and only show up to take over cases where Visbane activity is suspected.

410041045.content: Baize is an excellent cop herself, and she's helped solved many cases. But she can be pretty darn rigid sometimes...

410041046.content: And what happened after that? Why did you quit being a cop and join Tian Lu Traders?

410041047.content: ... It's a long story. I'll tell you another time.

410041048.content: Is Azim back yet? I ran into Lila just before I left and she told me that Azim was late for dinner. It's now past midnight.

410041049.content: Looking a little puzzled, Kali pulls up her terminal and looks at the access history for the Meruism compound. Azim's name is not there.

410041050.content: That's odd. He's been to Vimoksha Pharma to buy medicine before quite a few times; nothing should have gone awry. Could he have been arrested at a temporary checkpoint in the affluent district?

410041052.content: Mm-hmm. That's the pharma company I was telling you about—the one that's willing to send Lila somewhere else for treatment.

410041053.content: You probably saw on the map that Gharpur and the surrounding areas are segregated from the rich folks by checkpoints. The residents of Gharpur aren't usually allowed to enter those areas.

410041054.content: But there was an old industrial park on the west side that used to house these chemical plants. It was purchased by Vimoksha Pharma and became a standalone facility outside the jurisdiction of those checkpoints.

410041055.content: The CEO of Vimoksha Pharma is really kind and very friendly with the people of Gharpur. She usually lets in those who travel there to buy medicines, which are priced quite reasonably, too.

410041056.content: Hmm... Sounds like a potential business partner for us.

410041057.content: But Vimoksha Pharma should be closed by now. If Azim isn't back by dawn, I'll head over there to check things out. I can also ask about whether they'd be interested in working with Tian Lu Traders then.

410041058.content: Heehee, you'll find Madam Seema really easy to talk to. I don't think you'll have trouble getting a deal.

410041059.content: I'll come with you. Azim is part of Meruism, after all.

410041060.content: Excellent. I'll see you at dawn.

410041061.content: ... Oh, by the way—the weather forecast says there may be scattered storms tomorrow. Remember to bring an umbrella.

410042001.content: A simply but elegantly dressed woman has emerged from the central building and is walking towards them. She is trailed by two security mechas.

410042004.content: Luwu and Seema both eye the umbrellas in each other's hands. Seema then steps forward and offers her right hand to the stranger from Xu Heng.

410042005.content:
If I remember correctly, it's customary for people to greet each other with a handshake in Xu Heng.
I'm Seema.

410042006.content:
I'm Luwu.
In actuality, our traditional greeting is slightly more complex than that.

410042007.content: But Luwu doesn't reject Seema's greeting. She meets Seema's gaze, in which she discerns a rather well-concealed impatience.

410042008.content: A single raindrop from above cuts their handshake short. Both of them take a step back from each other and open up their umbrellas.

410042010.content: Do you think we could have a chat? Possibly in an office or somewhere like that?

410042011.content: I apologize, but we don't allow visitors into the building without an appointment. That's the rule here.

410042012.content: In addition, I'm needed at the lab. I only have ten minutes to spare.

410042013.content: Oh, that's alright, we won't take up too much of your time. We just wanted to ask if you've seen Azim. He said he was coming here yesterday to buy some medicine, but we haven't seen him since then.

410042014.content: Ah, he still needs a little more money for his daughter's surgery fees, so I had him work here to make up the difference.

410042016.content: Yes. If you need to talk to him, I'll have him come out.

410042017.content: Luwu and Kali look at each other. Something isn't quite right. Just how did a man who was here to purchase medicine become an employee overnight?

410042018.content: Please do. We'd appreciate it. His daughter is waiting for him.

410042019.content:
Very well, he'll be here in five minutes.
Is there anything else I can help you with?

410042020.content: Kali tells me that you supply the people of Gharpur with medicine. The practice doesn't seem to be very commonplace among the pharma companies of Shashvat.

410042021.content: ... Merchant from Xu Heng, do you mean to attack me on behalf of those leeches from the affluent zone?

410042022.content: Leeches... You're one of the rich yourself, and yet you regard your peers like that?

410042023.content: You're mistaken—I grew up in New Town. I have never belonged to the Affluent District.

410042024.content: If you'd ever been to New Town, you would know how the people there feel about the upper class.

410042025.content: Unfortunately, there are many who would abandon principles they've held for decades if given the right opportunity. But I'm not like them.

410042026.content: Is this why you chose to build your facility right next to Gharpur? Not because the land here is cheap, but because you aren't doing that well?

410042028.content: I need to get a good understanding of someone who may one day be a business partner of ours.

410042029.content: Partnerships and expansion are for the ambitious. I'm content with how I'm doing now.

410042031.content: Kali is listening to the conversation and not saying a word. While she doesn't quite fully understand what's going on, it's clear to her that there's no partnership on the horizon. She sighs somewhat regretfully.

410042032.content: The five minutes come and go very quickly, and so does the rain. Just as the three of them are closing their umbrellas, two figures approach from behind Seema.

410042033.content: The person at the front turns out to be Azim, now dressed in a factory worker's uniform. Trailing behind him is a rather stern-looking young man.

410042034.content: Here's the man you wanted, Sis. I'll be going back now.

410042035.content: Hold on. Wait and see what Azim has to say first.

410042036.content: Luwu studies the young man who just called Seema "Sis" but doesn't see anything odd about him. She and Kali turn to face Azim.

410042037.content: What happened, Azim? Why are you working here now? This is all so sudden.

410042038.content: Well... I'm still a little short on cash.

410042039.content: But you told me last week you only needed to fight two more matches before you had all the money you need. Since you won that match yesterday, you just have to win the one that's in a few days, right?

410042040.content: I mean, you're the man who's won six matches in three months. And you told me you wanted to be a champion fighter, too!

410042041.content: Champion... I just need a little more money, and I can earn it quickly here. All I want to do is to earn this last bit of money... safely.

410042042.content: At least come back with us for a short while. Shouldn't Lila know what's going on?

410042043.content: Azim seems a little loss for words when he hears his daughter's name. He swallows hard and turns to look at Kumar, who is speaking to Seema in a hushed tone.

410042044.content: Kumar notices Azim looking at them and walks over with a frown on his face. Seema remains standing where she is, arms folded, looking at everyone coolly.

410042046.content: I know it's almost time for him to start work, but would you allow Azim to return to Gharpur for a quick visit and see his daughter?

410042047.content:
I've no objections.
Azim, do you want to go back?

410042048.content: Azim looks at Kumar, and his breathing becomes increasingly labored. About five seconds later, he slowly takes a step back and shakes his head at Kali.

410042049.content: No, there's no need for me to do that. Please tell Lila that once her papa has made enough money, he'll bring her to town for treatment.

410042051.content: You don't look well. It's almost as though you've suffered blood loss. What is this work you're doing?

410042052.content: I'm alright, you don't need to worry about me. I'm just doing some small tasks here and there on the production line.

410042053.content: He worked until quite late last night, then went to sell some of his blood before returning to the dorm. Don't worry, we're a pharma company—we understand our employees' health very well.

410042054.content: Well, if you don't have anything else for Azim, he ought to be going back.

410042055.content: I'm needed at the lab too. Please excuse me.

410042056.content: Kumar nods at Seema, taps Azim on the shoulder, and half shoves him back towards the plant.

410042057.content: Luwu and Kali share a look. The situation feels extraordinarily strange. But before they can come up with any ideas, Kumar has returned to them.

410042058.content: Merchant from Xu Heng, my sis tells me that you're here to talk business? Is it just you?

410042059.content: ... Yes. If Madam Seema is interested in some kind of partnership, I'll get my rep from Tian Lu Traders to come by tomorrow.

410042061.content: Then, as if he's suddenly lost all interest in the two of them, Kumar waves his hand. The guests are no longer welcome, and the two security AGI Mechas who had been trailing Seema step forward a little.

410042062.content: ... Not everyone is capable of doing business with Vimoksha Pharma.

410051001.content: Luwu is sitting on the rooftop of a building at the entrance of an alley. She's staring at the empty pathway below in a daze, unconsciously recalling the rebuff she experienced at Vimoksha Pharma earlier in the day.

410051002.content: There's a blinking notification light on her terminal, indicating that comms are ongoing and occurring as usual.

410051004.content: What's so strange? Are the Panthera not there yet?

410051005.content:
We still have some time before the trade time we were told about.
I was referring to Seema and Kumar.

410051006.content: Don't tell me you're mad because they refused to discuss business with you...

410051007.content: No, there's no need to get mad when it's just business.

410051008.content: But Seema wasn't as amiable as you described her to be, don't you think? Same with that Kumar. He didn't have to be so unfriendly at the end there.

410051009.content: I hear that Kumar is in charge of the factory shop floor. I guess it's not that unusual for supervisors to be gruff?

410051010.content: Boss Seema has probably been dealing with some kind of problem. I'm sure you also noticed that she was kind of distracted when she was talking to us.

410051012.content: Her medicines have saved many people. She deserves respect from the people of Gharpur.

410051013.content: I only learned today that she came from New Town. Actually, I suppose Gharpur could be considered part of New Town, just poorer. So Madam Seema is actually one of us.

410051014.content: Luwu isn't sure whether to laugh or cry at Kali's claim that Seema is "one of us." A group of people are entering the alley just then, their shadows stretched out by the last rays of the sun. She immediately lies down on her stomach and starts speaking in a much lower voice.

410051015.content: I see people coming. Looks like the tip was good.

410051016.content: Is it the Panthera? How many of them are there?

410051017.content: It's them. I remember seeing some of these faces at the arena yesterday. There's maybe thirty or forty or them.

410051018.content: That many?! Should I put on a mask and come down to give you a hand? It's going be quite difficult to deal with so many people without using your Divine Power.

410051019.content: No, I promised I wouldn't get Meruism involved in any conflicts with the Panthera... You might not get here in time, anyway.

410051020.content: Luwu pulls up the camera function on her terminal. The alley is now packed with the new arrivals. Since the buyers have arrived, the sellers should be showing their faces soon, too.
