411101015.content: Perfect? I think even those Rostach clods could have come up with something similar.

411101016.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411101016.content: You went to all that effort to optimize the weapons system, and came up with this brilliant design that leaves its weak points exposed...

411101017.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411101017.content: Such a pity. What will your investors think?

411101019.speaker: 利伯蒂
411101019.content: It doesn't matter. Let's see if your team can even make it out alive. The only victor here is me!

411101020.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411101020.content: Is that why you did it? To "win"?

411101021.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411101021.content: I remember back when we worked together, you would never dream of taking shortcuts—especially one as sloppy as the one you've taken here.

411101022.speaker: 利伯蒂
411101022.content: That's not what you said during Project Blacksteel!

411101023.speaker: 利伯蒂
411101023.content: Who cares about shortcuts anyway? This is my monument, and I'll go down in history for it!

411101024.speaker: 利伯蒂
411101024.content: This is my legacy, rather than begging fools for money and being rejected again and again or forced to meet their idiotic demands!

411101025.speaker: 利伯蒂
411101025.content: If those old farts in CORG had chosen my design, Apocalypse would have solved the problem ages ago!

411101026.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411101026.content: If your project had any merit, CORG would have taken it seriously.

411101027.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411101027.content: And let's not forget, you're the one who requested to withdraw from the project just as it was nearing completion, and I didn't hold it against you. What more do you want?

411101028.speaker: 利伯蒂
411101028.content: I wasn't the only one! You were willing to experiment on live human subjects just to achieve your aims!

411101029.speaker: 利伯蒂
411101029.content: You brainwashed living things and turned them into puppets that only know how to obey and serve you!

411101030.speaker: 利伯蒂
411101030.content: Do you think people are products you can just use? And what does that make me?

411101031.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411101031.content: I have no interest in answering your questions. You'd be better off thinking of how you're going to explain your "world-changing research" to the judge.

411101032.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411101032.content: I know what I'm doing, and I know what the consequences are.

411101033.speaker: 利伯蒂
411101033.content: Yes, because you're not the one paying the price, just so your precious Gaea can easily...

411101034.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411101034.content: And is it easy for you to throw yourself into an ethical vicious circle with no results to show for it?

411101035.speaker: 利伯蒂
411101035.content: Open your eyes, Director. I think you'll find I'm currently getting better results than you are.

411101036.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411101036.content: Do you want Apocalypse to win?

411101038.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411101038.content: I'm not just in Neuhansa to confiscate Neural Network assets. I had my own personal reasons for coming...

411101039.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411101039.content: You see, I am genuinely interested in your research.

411101040.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411101040.content: Just how good is this Apocalypse model? Can it defeat my Project Blacksteel soldiers? Hell, can it defeat a Modifier?

411101041.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411101041.content: Don't you want to find out?

411101042.speaker: 利伯蒂
411101042.content: You're crazy... Even your employees are just test subjects to you, aren't they?

411101043.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411101043.content: If Apocalypse wins, I shall request that Red Fox free you and bring you back to HQ to continue working on your research.

411101044.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411101044.content: Tell me the secrets to Apocalypse, and I will give it back to you.

411101045.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411101045.content: If you don't, I'll make you watch as we turn it into scrap.

411101046.speaker: 科尔盖专员
411101046.content: Director, we've finally managed to connect to the Sigma squad.

411101047.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411101047.content:
Excellent. Pass me the communicator.
The rest of you, prepare to log in to the Neural Network and get data readings.

411101048.content: Two figures slip through a hail of bullets, their movements in perfect sync thanks to their shared consciousness. All pain is temporarily filtered out of their perception, but who knows how long they can keep this up for.

411101050.speaker: 托特
411101050.content: Artillery fire about to come from the left!

411101051.speaker: 托特
411101051.content: Its guns can only tilt so high. We need to go up!

411101052.content: Thoth's vision is filled with images coming from the Neural Network. After another unsuccessful attack. No. 6 takes her up to a high platform.

411101053.speaker: 六号
411101053.content: We know exactly where its weak points are, and yet...

411101054.speaker: 托特
411101054.content: There's just too much information coming in at the moment—the weakness analysis from HQ, the real-time battlefield analysis, what both of us can see... We need time to adjust.

411101055.speaker: 托特
411101055.content: Let's take this opportunity to catch our breath. We'll strike again if it tries to leave the factory.

411101056.content: The holographic display shows the real-time predicted trajectory of the Mega AGI Mecha's movements. It flashes red to indicate that the situation is out of control.

411101057.speaker: 托特
411101057.content: We haven't heard anything from the reinforcements yet, and we're too exhausted to keep making futile attacks like this. We need to launch one big final attack that'll stop it once and for all.

411101058.speaker: 托特
411101058.content: Let's try a different strategy. You attract its attention and I'll disable its joints.

411101059.speaker: 托特
411101059.content: Just pay attention to the battlefield analysis and dodge when it tells you to. You got this.

411101061.content: The stress eases for just a moment, and the sensory overload dissipates. There is silence on the narrow platform, and they can hear each other's breathing and heartbeat.

411101062.speaker: 六号
411101062.content: This will probably be our last attempt... What are your plans for tomorrow if we make it out of this alive?

411101063.speaker: 托特
411101063.content: I'm going straight to HQ to sort through all the combat data. I have some questions that need answering.

411101065.speaker: 六号
411101065.content:
I'm just curious.
You never give up on something once you've set your mind to it. You're a natural born captain.

411101066.speaker: 六号
411101066.content: What about after work though? Surely you have hobbies?

411101067.speaker: 托特
411101067.content: Wow, I wasn't expecting an interrogation.

411101068.speaker: 托特
411101068.content: There's a friend I like to help out, and I get to watch her write her own story. How about you?

411101069.speaker: 六号
411101069.content: That sounds nice. Your friend is lucky to have you.

411101070.content: Thoth may not be able to see No. 6's face, but with their shared consciousness she can feel the happiness swelling in her heart.

411101072.speaker: 六号
411101072.content: If I get out of here, I'd like to go and lie in the sun.

411101073.speaker: 六号
411101073.content: This factory is too dark, and it feels like we've been in here for days.

411101074.content: No. 6 picks up her weapon and stretches, causing some chips to fall off her cracked armor. Two of her slender fingers are exposed, poking out of the armor like new shoots struggling to grow in parched soil.

411101075.speaker: 六号
411101075.content: Would you want to come with me, Captain Thoth?

411101076.speaker: 六号
411101076.content: We could find the highest rooftop in the city, where all of our troubles would just seem so far away.

411101077.speaker: 六号
411101077.content: And if there's two of us, it won't feel so lonely.

411101082.content: No. 6 looks down at the metal behemoth beneath them. Her cloak rustles as it flaps in the wind up there.

411101083.speaker: 六号
411101083.content: Let's go. Otherwise, we'll never get to go sunbathing tomorrow.

411101084.content: Light creeps up her body and into her cheeks, and her consciousness is once again flooded with information. There's a quiet hum as her energy pack is reactivated, and she leaps from the platform without a second's hesitation.

411111001.content: The Neural Network is fast reaching its saturation point, and all other sounds suddenly fall away, leaving only a voice repeating instructions over and over.

411111002.content: Thoth can't even feel her injuries anymore. She uses the terrain to constantly change position, jumping out of nowhere to send threads imbued with Divine Grace shooting toward the AGI Mecha from all angles, which then wrap tightly around its joints.

411111005.content:
The cracks are growing in No. 6's armor. If she takes one more full-on attack, it's likely to shatter completely.
But thanks to her coordination with Thoth, she's able to dart through the rubble of the production line to avoid the constant stream of bullets coming her way.

411111006.speaker: 托特
411111006.content: (It's the last one. Just a few seconds more!)

411111008.content: A series of minibombs explode along the threads Thoth had wrapped around the mecha's joints, and four rays of light converge to a point where Apocalypse is standing, suddenly igniting in a blossoming flower of flames.

411111009.content: Shouts of victory reach Thoth's ears, but they sound distant and fuzzy. No longer able to ignore her battered body and severely depleted Divine Grace, she collapses in a heap on the floor.

411111010.speaker: 托特
411111010.content: (I need to check that the hostile mecha has definitely been defeated... Dammit, I can't move...)

411111011.speaker: 托特
411111011.content: (Is No. 6 still alive? Did backup arrive?)

411111012.speaker: 托特
411111012.content: (I can't hear anything on the Neural Network... Come on, don't crash on me now...)

411111014.content: A group of AGI Mechas speed into the ruins of the factory, their monotonous voices repeating their orders as they begin to converge on where Thoth is lying.

411111016.content: Her eyelids feel like they each weigh one hundred pounds. The last thing she sees before she closes her eyes is ferocious flames licking through the darkness as a figure rushes toward her.

411111021.speaker: 托特
411111021.content: What do I have to do?

411111022.content: She searches through her mind, hoping that something will turn up if she digs all the way down to the bottom of her consciousness. But as her hand extends into the nothingness, all it feels is the nothingness and it comes back empty.

411111023.speaker: 托特
411111023.content: Looks like I need to get out of here.

411111024.content: The dust of past memories falls gently onto a sheet of paper, obscuring whatever had been written there. Her mind formulates an objective, and a path slowly unveils itself beneath her feet.

411111025.speaker: 托特
411111025.content: This feels familiar... Have I been here before?

411111027.speaker: 托特
411111027.content: Nothing will happen if I just stay here. If I want things to change, I'll need to go forward.

411111029.content: The street is awash with every color of the rainbow, but Thoth finds herself coming to a stop outside a plain, unassuming bookstore. She looks up at the quaint wooden sign, which reads "Land of Moons."

411111030.speaker: 少女
411111030.content: Welcome to the Land of Moons!

411111031.speaker: 少女
411111031.content: What can I do for you today?

411111032.content: She is greeted by a woman with a familiar face, who pokes her head out from a pile of books and puts down the quill she was writing with.

411111035.speaker: 少女
411111035.content: Pah, don't be silly! It's not often I get customers here, so take all the time you need.

411111036.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411111036.content: My name's Ygritte. Pleasure to meet you.

411111038.content: Her chest tightens, as though a heartstring had been pulled to the point of almost snapping.

411111042.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411111042.content: Of course! We had that long chat online about books! I've never met anyone else who cares as much as you do about literature, so of course I remember you!

411111043.speaker: 托特
411111043.content: Oh, you mean from the online book club?

411111044.speaker: 托特
411111044.content: (What is this? I feel like I remember this, but I'm not completely sure.)

411111045.speaker: 托特
411111045.content: (But this place must mean something to me. Maybe if I stay here, it'll jog my memory.)

411111046.speaker: 托特
411111046.content: (And she doesn't seem to mind. I might as well take a seat.)

411111047.content: The quill gently kisses the paper, each line leaving evidence of its existence. Time seems to stand still and, together with the other old-fashioned objects in the store that refuse to move with the times, they watch as Ygritte continues her writing.

411111048.speaker: 托特
411111048.content: (She must be in the zone. She's been sitting there doing nothing but write for hours now.)

411111049.speaker: 托特
411111049.content: (How long has it been, actually? I've lost all sense of time.)

411111050.speaker: 托特
411111050.content: (I can't explain it, but sitting here and watching her write makes me feel safe.)

411111051.speaker: 托特
411111051.content: (It must be nice to just sit here and write without a care in the world...)

411111055.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411111055.content:
I've finally finished my book!
Thank you for looking after me. Here, I want you to read it.

411111057.content: Thoth looks down at the notepad with its simple pattern cover, and when she looks up again the bookstore is empty. A whispered goodbye melts into the air.

411111059.content: The tightness in her chest squeezes out a jolt of pain, which rises in her throat and leaves a bitter taste in her mouth. Thoth flees the deserted bookstore and buries herself in the notepad clutched in her arms.

411111061.speaker: 托特
411111061.content: "The bird swooped down into the endless abyss."

411111063.speaker: 托特
411111063.content: "The harsh winds clawed at her wings, and the heavy rain soaked her through her feathers. An ever-burning fire raged, yet still the snow-white bird flew through the flames."

411111065.speaker: 托特
411111065.content: "When she awoke, she wanted to sing with joy, but she discovered that the smoke from the abyssal fires had rendered her mute, and the flames had burned away the feathers from her wings. She'd never be able to fly again."

411111068.speaker: 模糊的声音
411111068.content: Backup's nearly here. We're going to be okay...

411111069.content: Thoth slowly regains consciousness, and struggles to open her eyes. She feels like she's been underwater, and the muffled sounds have now sharpened into the fierce clatter of a firefight.

411111071.content:
She is lying next to a patch of hazy sunshine, her nerves prickling with pain from her injuries.
Behind her is the noise of battle, with bullets occasionally flying past and into the shadows, where they hit with a dazzling shower of sparks.

411111072.speaker: 托特
411111072.content: (What's wrong with my body? And... where's my Divine Power? At least I still have my gun.)

411111073.speaker: 六号
411111073.content: Sigma squad coordinates sent, requesting immediately backup!

411111074.content: The Sigma soldier crouched besides Thoth leans out from behind their cover, calling for reinforcements while shooting at the fast-approaching AGI Mechas. They are taking shelter among a pile of rubble, surrounded by a barrier of fallen mechas.

411111076.speaker: 托特
411111076.content: (I remember... Apocalypse, the rampaging mechas... The battle isn't over yet!)

411111078.content: Most of No. 6's armor has broken away, revealing gray, artificial skin underneath. Thoth tries to ignore the hollowness she feels inside, grits her teeth and shoots down an AGI Mecha that was about to attack from the side.

411111081.content: Thoth sits herself upright and leans against the rubble to better handle attacks from the other side, but the AGI Mechas continue to surge in an unending wave. They leap over the barrier, repeating their cold commands as they stalk the ruins.

411111082.speaker: 六号
411111082.content: You're badly hurt, you should stop moving!

411111084.speaker: 六号
411111084.content: Apocalypse has been disabled, but I don't know how many more of these AGI Mechas we're going to have to deal with.

411111085.speaker: 六号
411111085.content: Backup's nearly here. We just need to hold out for a little while longer, Captain.

411111087.content: They defeat the AGI Mechas one by one as they appear, and after a while the metallic cacophony comes to a sudden stop. The battlefield is as silent as the grave.

411111089.content: No. 6 collapses down to the ground beside Thoth and takes her hand.

411111091.content: What's left of her armor is shattered, the cracks spreading deep. The metal is peeling off, small flakes floating in the air like steel snow.

411111092.speaker: 科尔盖士兵
411111092.content: Apocalypse is down and the perimeter is secured.

411111093.speaker: 科尔盖士兵
411111093.content: Target location reached, beginning rescue mission.

411111094.content: The cuts across No. 6's skin ooze bright red blood over her gray skin, like a sea of poppies against a raincloud sky.

411111096.content: No. 6's battered helmet finally gives out, and it crumbles away from the bottom up.

411111097.content: It reveals a youthful face, her lips slightly parted as though she's about to divulge a secret.

411121001.speaker: 科尔盖专员
411121001.content: The situation is under control, Director. Now beginning clear up and asset extraction.

411121002.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121002.content: Good. What's the status of Apocalypse?

411121003.speaker: 科尔盖专员
411121003.content: It's structurally intact and we've collected the combat data from both sides.

411121006.speaker: 科尔盖专员
411121006.content: I think Captain Thoth is awake... Do you want to go to her, Director?

411121007.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121007.content: Let the medics take a look at her. There's something else I need to do first.

411121009.speaker: 医疗组队员
411121009.content: Most of her enhancements are severely damaged, and her original organs have been injured to varying degrees.

411121011.speaker: 医疗组队员
411121011.content: I think it'll be tough... She's in a deep coma at the moment, which makes any surgical procedures even more risky.

411121012.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121012.content: Keep her under observation and assess the feasibility of additional augments.

411121014.speaker: 科尔盖士兵
411121014.content: Captain Thoth, please come back! You need to recover, and there might be further threats...

411121015.content: There is a sound of a distant clamor, but the soldiers can't stop Thoth from walking through the cordon.

411121017.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121017.content: We've administered emergency first aid and the medics are treating her now.

411121018.speaker: 托特
411121018.content: Why did she agree to augmentation? What did you say to her?

411121019.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121019.content: If you had the choice between a 100% chance of failure and a 1% chance of success, which would you choose?

411121020.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121020.content: I explained all of the risks to her, and gave her the freedom to choose.

411121021.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121021.content: Her performance and resilience in protecting you exceeded all of our expectations, and indeed what she was designed to do. This wasn't a failure no matter how you look at it.

411121023.speaker: 托特
411121023.content: It's not what I'd hoped for.

411121024.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121024.content: Either way, it was her decision to make. She knew what she was signing up for.

411121025.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121025.content: I don't think she'd thank you for taking even that power away from her.

411121026.speaker: 托特
411121026.content: I just want to hear it from her.

411121027.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121027.content: Then by all means, ask her.

411121029.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121029.content: She's comatose due to consciousness overload. You'll need to jump into the Neural Network and bring her back.

411121030.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121030.content: But if you fail, you'll be lost too.

411121031.content: Thoth is silent for a moment, then looks at Paracaesar with determination in her eyes.

411121033.content: Thoth feels her body sink into nothingness as the machine continues to whir, and her consciousness walks through the void toward a weak light.

411121034.content: The light gradually spreads into clouds, illuminating layers upon layers within the void. The pathway labeled "Memory" is more convoluted than Thoth feared.

411121036.speaker: 托特
411121036.content: (This must be the way to the root of her consciousness.)

411121037.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121037.content: What about after work though? Surely you have hobbies?

411121038.speaker: 回忆中的托特
411121038.content: Wow, I wasn't expecting an interrogation.

411121039.speaker: 回忆中的托特
411121039.content: There's a friend I like to help out, and I get to watch her write her own story. How about you?

411121040.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121040.content: (Hey! She's talking about me! I'm the first one Tho-Tho thinks about when asked about her free time!)

411121041.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121041.content: (But I haven't told her about the augments yet. She's gonna be so mad at me...)

411121043.speaker: 回忆中的托特
411121043.content: Considering that was your first fight, you did a good job out there, rookie.

411121044.speaker: 回忆中的托特
411121044.content: But this mission will be even more dangerous than that. Prepare yourself mentally.

411121045.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121045.content: (She praised me! I can really do this!)

411121051.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121051.content: (That was so cool! Has Tho-Tho always been this awesome?)

411121052.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121052.content: (She's like a superhero. I wish I could be like her...)

411121054.content: Thoth's consciousness continues its descent through Ygritte's memories. The ones at the top are her happiest, the ones she is most likely to recall, but as she starts to go deeper, the fluffy white clouds grow stained with the gray wisps of worry.

411121055.speaker: 回忆中的托特
411121055.content: Ygritte, I know you've always dreamed of being able to walk again, but this is too dangerous. I couldn't bear to see you take this much of a risk.

411121056.speaker: 回忆中的托特
411121056.content: Ygritte, I love your stories and they deserve to be written down. I can help you.

411121057.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121057.content: (What would I do in her place?)

411121058.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121058.content: (What would I do if I were locked in a cage forever, needing protection, staring up at the blue skies outside the window?)

411121059.speaker: 托特
411121059.content: Why didn't I realize this sooner?

411121060.content: Black ink drops onto white paper as darkness sullies innocence. Storm clouds gather and swallow Thoth whole.

411121061.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121061.content: I hear you'd like to speak to me?

411121062.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121062.content: Yes, doctor. I'd like to hear more about the solution you were talking about the other day.

411121063.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121063.content: You've had a chance to see over these past few days how CORG surgical procedures are carried out, so there's no need for me to go into that.

411121064.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121064.content: If successful, you will be free to move around like an ordinary person, perhaps even better. You will then join CORG and help us to protect others. Your life will change completely.

411121065.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121065.content: But the operation carries certain risks. In the worst case scenario, you'll die. I've mentioned the other risks to you before, so now the decision is in your hands.

411121066.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121066.content: I understand. Doctor, I'd like to go through with the procedure. I want to be free.

411121067.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121067.content: Free... Ygritte, only those who truly know themselves are ever really free.

411121068.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121068.content: "Don't get your hopes up." This will probably also be your motto for the rest of your life if you join CORG.

411121069.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121069.content: I-I don't think I understand... But I'm willing to give it a shot, starting with the surgery you told me about!

411121070.content: She grabs Paracaesar's hand in excitement, her eyes alive with hope.

411121072.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121072.content: It hurts... My leg... Is it still there?

411121073.content: Her snow-white feathers splashed with red from the blade, she struggles to claw her way from out of the abyss.

411121074.content: Shedding its feathers is the bird's first step toward metamorphosis.

411121075.content: The girl is covered in cold tubes that seem to be sucking the life and warmth from out of her.

411121077.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121077.content: (What is this? She looks like she's in more pain than when she was on her meds.)

411121078.content: But she's used to it, she's lived with pain her entire life. But...

411121079.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121079.content: (It's just for a little while... I didn't think it would be like this...)

411121082.content: The AGI Mecha shines a harsh light on the operating table, then attacks Ygritte's body as she breathes heavily.

411121083.content: She unconsciously stretches out her hand as though begging for help.

411121085.content: Thoth runs toward her, but the operating table just gets further and further away.

411121087.content: She's wandered the corridors of the CORG Medical Center countless times, but never like this. Never in a panic to find her friend.

411121090.content: Thoth takes a minute to lean against a bookcase as she tries to catch her breath.

411121093.content: A familiar voice calls from behind, and the scene changes yet again. The cold, clinical hospital ward is doused in color, its steely light infused with warm mahogany.

411121095.content: This is Ygritte before Thoth met her. Chewing the tip of her quill, brow furrowed, she takes one blank sheet of paper after another, until it almost drowns her.

411121096.content: This is how Ygritte saw herself before Thoth walked into her life. She looks up in surprise, her eyes fixed on the moon in the sky behind Thoth.

411121097.content: The moonlight streams in through the window and onto the sheet of paper, engraving it with silver writing.

411121098.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121098.content: Hmm, how did you find me here?

411121099.content: Ygritte puts down the quill and looks at Thoth awkwardly.

411121100.speaker: 托特
411121100.content: (Is this a memory? It can't be, she didn't react to my presence in any of the others. Is this Ygritte's consciousness then?)

411121101.speaker: 托特
411121101.content: (We just need to work out why she's hiding away down here, and bring her back into the light.)

411121102.speaker: 托特
411121102.content: Ygritte, are you hiding here because of those painful memories?

411121103.speaker: 托特
411121103.content: Or is it because you're frightened?

411121104.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121104.content: No... I want to finish my book, and this will probably be my last chance. I don't want to have any regrets.

411121105.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121105.content: But despite that, I can't bring myself to write anything. It's like I'm missing something important, so all that's left is blank paper.

411121106.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121106.content: But now you're here, Tho-Tho, I feel like I can finally write my story!

411121107.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121107.content: A story about moonlight, a story about me...

411121108.content: She snatches up her quill and writes down her thoughts after these cold words.

411121109.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121109.content: Come and read my new draft. Maybe this time we'll find something we can agree on?

411121110.content: "Bathed in moonlight, the bird finally slept and had the most marvelous dream."

411121111.content: "When she awoke, she wanted to sing with joy, but she discovered that the smoke from the abyssal fires had rendered her mute, and the flames had burned away the feathers from her wings. She'd never be able to fly again."

411121113.speaker: 托特
411121113.content: Isn't this the ending you crossed out before?

411121114.content: Thoth strokes the words gently, as though by doing so she can caress the bitter or sweet memories they allude to, and feel the heart of the one who wrote them.

411121115.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121115.content: Well, when I wrote that I felt nothing but sadness. So, the bird didn't gain anything, everything was meaningless.

411121116.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121116.content: But now things are different. Now that I'm free to fly and chase the moonlight, it felt right to rewrite the ending.

411121117.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121117.content: The bird will never reach the actual moon, but she found another one she could embrace instead.

411121118.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121118.content: She surrounds herself in moonlight by becoming her own moon.

411121119.speaker: 托特
411121119.content: For once, I have no feedback.

411121120.speaker: 托特
411121120.content: By turning into a moonbird, she can light the way for others.

411121121.speaker: 托特
411121121.content: (You're so much stronger than I thought, Ygritte. You gave me all the answers, but I was too dumb to ask the questions.)

411121122.speaker: 托特
411121122.content: Oh yes, how could I have forgotten? That editor woman wanted me to tell you that they published the short story you submitted last month!

411121124.content: Ygritte gasps and grabs hold of Thoth's hands.

411121126.speaker: 托特
411121126.content: Yes. And have you noticed, that the bookstore is in darkness but it's not the same darkness as before?

411121128.speaker: 托特
411121128.content: Want me to help you tidy up?

411121130.content: They get to work putting everything back in its place. Thoth listens patiently as Ygritte tells her the story behind each of the relics.

411121131.content: Thoughts from when we met, memories we share, tiny droplets from everyday life... Time lingers in our consciousness, waiting for us to catch up.

411121132.content: They relive their entire journey together, and end up back at the entrance to the bookstore. Ygritte has a nostalgic look on her face.

411121133.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121133.content: I remember you asked me, the day before we met... whether the store would be open.

411121134.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121134.content: And I said maybe not... and you sent me a crying emoji.

411121136.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121136.content: I was so lucky I opened the store that day. Otherwise, the moonlight wouldn't have come in.

411121137.content: Thoth smiles at her and takes her by the hand.

411121139.content: The door closes and a silver bird flies out from the eaves, leaving the bookstore far behind.

411121140.content: Its body is cloaked in moonlight as it flies far away from the abyss.

411121141.speaker: 医疗组队员
411121141.content: Her vital signs are back to normal. Should we initiate the awakening procedure?

411121142.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121142.content: Yes. Make sure to monitor the stability of her consciousness.

411121143.content: Ygritte's eyes flicker open with some effort. She tries to speak, but only manages a weak croak.

411121144.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121144.content: Her vocal cords are damaged. Hook her up to the Neural Network.

411121145.content: Her vision gradually comes into focus, and her gaze settles on the girl in the bed.

411121147.content: They can only hear her voice through the system, so it doesn't sound real.

411121148.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121148.content: I'm sorry... I let this happen...

411121149.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121149.content: It's only to be expected. I did warn you about the risks of sharing a consciousness. We thought we'd lost you forever.

411121150.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121150.content: The medical team have already drawn up your treatment plan.

411121151.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121151.content: We've had to augment some of your organs, as well as your consciousness as per the original plan.

411121153.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121153.content: We're going to conduct a thorough memory wipe so you can have a brand new start.

411121155.content: Ygritte seems to be in a world of her own, and the neural network system doesn't detect any emotional changes in her.

411121157.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121157.content: Who am I if I don't have my memories? Life would be meaningless.

411121158.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121158.content: I remember that's what I said in the beginning. And I'm not changing my mind now.

411121159.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121159.content: I just want to be a normal person... Someone who cherishes life, fears death, and eventually learns to accept it.

411121160.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121160.content: I'd be happy that my life has given meaning to my decision...

411121162.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121162.content: I'm sorry. Your life was so full of promise, but this is where it ends.

411121163.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121163.content: I'll give you ten minutes to say your goodbyes.

411121164.content: Silence descends on the room once Paracaesar leaves. The only sound that can be heard is the regular beeping of the life support system.

411121167.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121167.content: Let's go and lie in the sun, like we said we would.

411121168.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121168.content: Except... I don't think I can move.

411121170.content: Thoth points to the Neural Network device on Ygritte's head, and turns to face the sunset.

411121171.speaker: 托特
411121171.content: You should have a good view from here. Can you see it?

411121172.content: Thoth turns to see Ygritte sitting beside her, back ramrod straight like any other member of the Sigma squad. She is whole, untainted by any past memories.

411121173.speaker: 托特
411121173.content: Is this an illusion being projected into my consciousness?

411121174.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121174.content: Yes. I tried it when you shared your view. I might not be able to keep it up for long, but at least I managed.

411121175.content: They both watch the setting sun in silence, their silhouettes gradually merging into the ground until they were indistinguishable from everything else around them.

411121176.speaker: 托特
411121176.content: The editor said she loved your last story, and promised she'd come visit Land of Moons next time she's in the neighborhood.

411121178.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121178.content: Thank you, Tho-Tho. And thank her for me too.

411121179.content: Ygritte stares out at the sunset, the last vestiges of its brilliance reflected in her eyes.

411121180.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121180.content: There have actually been many times when I thought my story would end.

411121181.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121181.content: Like when I was a kid and was in hospital for weeks... Before I discovered the power of books and would just lie there staring into space all day... and...

411121182.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121182.content: After I was augmented and had to pretend I didn't recognize you, Tho-Tho.

411121183.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121183.content: But now I'm standing here behind the pages, I can see that there are thousands of roles left for me to play, and that my story is only just beginning.

411121184.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121184.content: And it's only one chapter of a bigger whole.

411121185.content: Ygritte grasps Thoth's hand and looks her in the eyes.

411121186.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121186.content: I'm very happy you saw me in these stories.

411121187.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121187.content: I want you to promise me that, once this chapter is over, you won't close the book. I want you to keep on reading.

411121188.content: Thoth knows that the touch of Ygritte's skin against hers is simply a signal being manipulated in her brain, and then just like that it's gone. She watches as Ygritte's outline begins to fade from view.

411121189.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121189.content: Looks like this is the time where we say goodbye for now...

411121190.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121190.content: Tho-Tho, when you see the real moon and witness the end of everything...

411121191.speaker: 伊格莉塔
411121191.content: Write it down and read it out to me.

411121193.content: Ygritte's voice softens to a whisper, then an echo, then nothing. The sun dips completely below the horizon, ushering in infinite darkness.

411121194.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121194.content: The medics have bagged up No. 6's body. You'll be taking it back to HQ.

411121195.speaker: 托特
411121195.content: Is Liberty the reason it took you so long to get to the factory?

411121196.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121196.content: The situation is more complex than you think. You'll find out at the trial.

411121197.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121197.content: You're one of the key witnesses, so I dare imagine you'll see the whole thing.

411121198.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121198.content: Also, don't forget this case is being handled internally. The objective isn't for us to win, but for him to give up.

411121200.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121200.content: CORG needs his tech. I don't care if he spends the rest of his life locked up in a prison or our R&D Center, as long as he breaks and tells us everything he knows.

411121201.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121201.content: Right, I'm going to need your help cleaning this mess up. Go and rest up with the medics for a while, then I want to see you out here lending a hand.

411121202.speaker: 托特
411121202.content: Paracaesar... Is all of this really going to bring humanity a better future?

411121203.content: Paracaesar stops in her tracks and looks back at Thoth with an enigmatic smile.

411121204.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121204.content: All humans see is what's in front of them, and all they want is to survive.

411121205.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121205.content: Preparing the best future for them is the only reason we're doing all this.

411121206.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411121206.content: Even if they don't know it, even if they're short-sighted, even if they're reckless, they will still live to see a better tomorrow because of us.

411131001.content: The city is holding a huge book festival today. Thoth jostles her way through the crowded streets to get back to the Land of Moons bookstore.

411131002.content: The counter is piled high with invites to the festival and publisher catalogs.

411131003.speaker: 托特
411131003.content: Have they really categorized it as a children's book?

411131004.content: Thoth chuckles to herself as she runs her fingers over the ad for "The Ibis and the Moon" Volume 1.

411131005.content: Underneath a picture of the front cover is the tagline: "The fairytale that never ends."

411131006.content: There's also a package on the counter. Thoth opens it and takes out a velvet case.

411131007.content: She takes off the lid and sees a restored quill lying on a small velvet cushion. A silver star has been embroidered to the feather, and the nib has been obviously repaired.

411131008.content: The notebook on the desk has been turned to a new blank page. Thoth sits down and picks up the quill.

411131009.content:
As we've seen before, the end of one story simply marks the beginning of another.

Liberty's case finally came to a close last week, and he was sentenced to life imprisonment.

Yet, in secret, he continues to work on his weapon project through Paracaesar. The official line is that this is a necessary evil in order to protect humanity against the threat of the Visbanes.

411131013.content:
The soldier that follows Liberty into the room follows his gaze upward in confusion.
The holographic display in the middle of the room is showing a list of team members for some new project.

411131014.content: Whoever had been scrolling through the list before has stopped on the file of an engineer called Jolin.

411131015.speaker: 科尔盖士兵
411131015.content: Stop wasting time, 93. The director is waiting for you.

411131016.speaker: 利伯蒂
411131016.content: Hey! I know that, no need to push.

411131018.content:
We recovered the bodies of the others when we went in after the explosion.

We recovered the bodies of the others when we went in after the explosion.

411131020.speaker: 小女孩
411131020.content: Mommy, can you read me a story?

411131021.speaker: 中年女性
411131021.content: Shh! Everyone else is still asleep.

411131022.content: A little girl with pigtails is standing in front of her mother, holding out a brightly colored storybook with a pout on her face.

411131025.content: Seeing her mother's face drop in sadness, the girl's voice trails off. She hands her the book and trudges back to her room in disappointment.

411131026.content: Steady footsteps can be heard coming down the hall, and a silver-haired woman with cold eyes walks toward them.

411131027.speaker: 托特
411131027.content: Hello, I'm an officer from CORG's logistics liaison department. My badge number is TL7565, but you can call me Kay.

411131028.speaker: 托特
411131028.content: We have lost a talented member of staff, but to you, he was an irreplaceable member of the family...

411131029.speaker: 中年女性
411131029.content: He... He said it was a regular mission... He promised me he'd be back...

411131030.content: The woman begins to weep and wail. Thoth pats her on the back and waits patiently for her to get her sadness out.

411131031.speaker: 托特
411131031.content: My deepest condolences for No. 1... I mean Anthony. He died fighting to protect us all. He was a hero. His passing is an immeasurable loss, but his spirit and his love will always be with you.

411131032.speaker: 中年女性
411131032.content: I... I'll try to learn to live with that.

411131034.speaker: 托特
411131034.content: This is your compensation for this month. I know the future is looking bleak right now, but remember that you're not alone. CORG will always be here to support you.

411131036.speaker: 护士
411131036.content: It's time for your check-up. Please follow me to the consultation room.

411131037.content: The old woman nods, then looks at the book in her hand. She seems reluctant.

411131042.content: The little girl takes the book and stares at it blankly while stroking the cover.

411131043.speaker: 托特
411131043.content: Do you like the ending to this story?

411131044.speaker: 小女孩
411131044.content: Actually, I... don't really understand it.

411131045.content: The picture on the cover shows a robotic silver bird flying up to the moon.

411131046.speaker: 小女孩
411131046.content: The little bird gets hurt so much when she flies away.

411131047.speaker: 小女孩
411131047.content: But flying is meant to be fun, isn't it?

411131049.content:
To be honest, I didn't really fully understand your feelings until now.

I didn't understand why you'd be willing to sacrifice your life to get something you desire.

But now... I'm sure I'll come across my "moon" someday.

411131054.content: Thoth closes the notepad and approaches the young woman.

411131055.speaker: 年轻女性
411131055.content: Ah, so I did come to the right place.

411131056.speaker: 年轻女性
411131056.content: Is this where I can get an "the Ibis and the Moon" stamp?

411131057.speaker: 年轻女性
411131057.content: Huh, looks like none of the kids know they can come here for a free gift.

411131058.speaker: 托特
411131058.content: Yeah, it's because I've left the gifts at the stamp collection point in the park. There's a playground there, so it's more fun for them than hanging out here.

411131059.speaker: 年轻女性
411131059.content: I see... Well, can you stamp my copy since I'm here?

411131060.content: Thoth stamps her copy of the book, which she then picks up with a happy smile.

411131062.speaker: 年轻女性
411131062.content: I always wondered what the person who wrote this book looks like.

411131063.speaker: 年轻女性
411131063.content: I have to say, you're not exactly what I imagined.

411131064.speaker: 托特
411131064.content: Oh no, I'm just a friend who helps her send manuscripts off to the publishers.

411131065.speaker: 年轻女性
411131065.content: Really? Because the ending wasn't written by your friend, right?

411131066.speaker: 年轻女性
411131066.content: Because the ending completely changed the structure of the story, and set it up for a sequel.

411131067.speaker: 年轻女性
411131067.content: And the style in which it was written is totally different to the rest of the book... Actually, it's the ending that made me even more curious...

411131068.speaker: 年轻女性
411131068.content: The bird flies through all these worlds, so will there come a time when all these worlds come to an end? And, when they do, where will humanity be?

411131069.speaker: 年轻女性
411131069.content: And are these worlds little more than pawns on a chessboard?

411131070.speaker: 托特
411131070.content: Maybe, but that's a problem for later.

411131071.speaker: 年轻女性
411131071.content: Only someone who's very curious would write an ending like this.

411131072.speaker: 年轻女性
411131072.content: If this world, if all of "Gaea," is a game to someone, what is it that they want to get out of it?

411131073.speaker: 年轻女性
411131073.content: I've come to talk to you today because you're not the only curious person out there. Someone has brought the answers here.

411131074.content: Thoth's eyes widen slightly, and she suddenly realizes just how eerily quiet everything has become around here. She didn't notice before, but the street is deathly silent.

411131075.content: The sheer amount of Divine Power exuded from this woman has blocked everything else out, even the sound of her own breathing.

411131077.speaker: 年轻女性
411131077.content: I'm sorry, Miss Thoth, where are my manners?

319001001.content: There's rain dripping off of verdant branches, and it's sent clusters of golden flowers falling to the ground.

319001002.content: The delicate petals are scattered all over the courtyard, mottling the ground with color and making it look like an invsible force has pressed the brightness into the earth. Floating on the surface of water, they form countless ripples that glint and dance in the light.

319001003.content: Though the flowers seem like a hopeful sight in this cold season, they've wilted in the utter silence.

319001004.content: Just like she does on every rainy day, she's lying by a window and looking at the outside through the rain-streaked glass. In the distance, at the very edge of her field of view, something is hovering in the air like a kite, flying above everything in the curtain of rain.

319001005.content: Although she can't simply climb up to the dark clouds that the wind seems unable to dispel, and she can't get beyond the forbidding window lattice either, she nevertheless continues to smile.

319001006.content: She feels satisfied and at peace, not at all grieved or upset about the fading colors.

319001007.content: She sit there until tiredness creeps over her, then she falls back on her bed like she's one of those descending petals. She looks over at the open notebook on her desk and silently talks herself out of writing something new.

319001008.speaker: 塔琳娜
319001008.content: I need to stop being so greedy...

319001009.content: The sun and the rain will come and go, just like they have on every other day that has ever passed. The sweet-smelling osmanthus in the yard will bloom, then wither. She's lying down on her back, and the only sound in the room is the ticking of the clock.

319001010.content: It is not a noise she detests. The sound of time is like the sound of the world breathing, a rhythmic heartbeat. It is a sound that makes life feel real.

319001013.content: Tarina smiles politely at the woman who has just walked through the door, then sits up straight and secretly glances at the shoes beside her bed. The wrinkles on top of the shoes, created by the weight of her heels, are still there.

319001014.speaker: 格罗娅
319001014.content: There's no need to get up again, since you just lay down. We're only performing a full-body scan today.

319001015.speaker: 塔琳娜
319001015.content: I still need an examination even though I'm "looking well"?

319001016.speaker: 格罗娅
319001016.content: You know how it is. You feel fine for a few days, and then... Give me your hand.

319001017.speaker: 塔琳娜
319001017.content: I'm going to get better one day. Maybe I already am?

319001018.content: At the sight of Tarina smiling in front of her, Gloria can only shake her head. She puts a device that looks like a wristband on the girl's left arm, then pulls out a terminal and initiates a physical scan.

319001019.speaker: 格罗娅
319001019.content: If only your new neighbor was half as optimistic as you are.

319001020.speaker: 塔琳娜
319001020.content: Well, and I wish that I was half as strong as she is... How has she been?

319001021.speaker: 格罗娅
319001021.content: Her illness may not be as severe as yours, but it's also a very rare one. We haven't found a way to cure her yet.

319001022.speaker: 塔琳娜
319001022.content: Doctor, a white lie every now and then doesn't hurt, you know. It could make your patients feel better...

319001023.speaker: 格罗娅
319001023.content: If I concealed the seriousness of their illness from a patient who has no family or support system, it would be a serious dereliction of my duties. But thinking about her condition is my job—there's no need for you to worry about it.

319001024.speaker: 塔琳娜
319001024.content: I've thought about it too, you know. In fact, the solution that the Prez talked about—

319001025.speaker: 格罗娅
319001025.content: Tarina. That wasn't what the Prez meant. Our hope is that both of you will get better.

319001026.speaker: 塔琳娜
319001026.content: I don't like to think about bad outcomes, either. But...

319001027.content: A beep indicating the physical scan is complete interrupts the conversation. Gloria takes off the wristband, helps Tarina unroll her crooked cuff, and then starts to read the scan's results.

319001029.speaker: 格罗娅
319001029.content: Your indicators are where they should be... Do you feel unwell in any way?

319001030.speaker: 塔琳娜
319001030.content: No. But I do feel a little cooped up, and I'm itching to take a walk outside.

319001031.speaker: 格罗娅
319001031.content: Don't be silly. You won't get the protection outside that you do here. Your body won't be able to withstand it.

319001032.speaker: 塔琳娜
319001032.content: I can't even go for a walk on my birthday?

319001034.speaker: 塔琳娜
319001034.content: Alright... My birthday's less than a month away now, so I guess it's a no-go.

319001035.content: Tarina blinks in anticipation and purses her lips. She lowers her gaze slightly and turns to look out the window. Her eyes glaze over.

319001036.content: The clock on the wall is still ticking while the sound of the rain outside washes the world clean. They sound like overtones resonating from strings, wandering between the past and the future.

319001037.speaker: 塔琳娜
319001037.content: I guess all I can do is hope that I recover soon.

319001038.speaker: 塔琳娜
319001038.content: Maybe today will be the day...

319001039.content: The rain seems to have subsided a little, as the light of the sun is slowly piercing through thinning clouds. Tarina can now see her reflection in the window.

319001040.content: The sweet-smelling osmanthus covering the courtyard looks like a golden carpet that's rolled all the way over to her window. Tarina opens her mouth slightly and looks at the far end of this "carpet" distractedly.

319001042.content: The high wall at the end of the courtyard and the woods outside the wall are blocking the landscape further away. But Tarina's eyes are not on either of them.

319001043.content: A cluster of petals is being scattered by the wind, making it look like someone is passing by. Tarina looks at her hazy reflection in the glass, and the reflection looks back at her.

319001044.content:
Hold out your hand.

Take that step.

Run like you did in the past.

319031001.content: The orderly neighborhood is covered by a blanket of fog, its roads and buildings marked by odd-looking blemishes. It looks like there's been a great cannon strafing, the repercussions of which have been cleaned up by a crew.

319031002.content: The neighborhood's desolate silence is broken when a group of people rush out of a space pathway that's opened suddenly. Now it seems like a city.

319031005.speaker: 洛肯
319031005.content: Ha ha! What's the rush? There's no one here, anyway. Why not let some Visbanes through so we can have fun with them?

319031007.content: The frenzied sounds are in stark contrast to the orderly, disciplined movements of the CORG personnel. Only one person is casually standing directly in the entrance to the pathway, her face filled with excitement.

319031008.content: Then Bane Energy starts to flow out of the passage like a pile of sand disintegrating when a bucket of water is poured on it, darkening the entire neighborhood in an instant.

319031009.speaker: 托特
319031009.content: Why did you have to do that? The Visbanes didn't even notice us at first!

319031010.speaker: 洛肯
319031010.content: Huh? But isn't it rude to not extend a greeting when you run into somebody?

319031011.speaker: 洛肯
319031011.content: If you think fighting them is a bother, just stand to the side and watch, Captain. I'm more than capable of handling them on my own.

319031012.speaker: 托特
319031012.content: What are you going on about?!

319031013.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319031013.content: Did she just dash in on her own?! We have to go help her...

319031014.speaker: 托特
319031014.content: No, leave her be. That's how she likes it...

319031015.speaker: 托特
319031015.content: Don't be distracted by Lokken and keep your formation! Keep pushing inwards, and close that passage as quickly as you can.

319042001.content: The phrase "Data Plane Layer" on the watch's screen has gone back to normal, meaning that the Realm Cleanser invasion has stopped for now.

319042002.content: Ver clenches her hand a few times. She's feeling her strength returning to some extent and is pleased as pie. However, she sees Thoth frowning slightly.

319042003.speaker: 托特
319042003.content: Looks like "complete protection" may be too big of an ask, after all...

319042005.speaker: 托特
319042005.content:
The hyperspace, of course.
Look at this building over here.

319042006.content: Thoth points at a single-story house by the side of the road not too far from them. Or rather, at what remains of it—a pile of grayish-white concrete bits.

319042007.content: There is a hole in the edge of the pile, created during the battle that just ensued. The fragments rise slowly, then float away into the distance like the first dust rising in a vast wasteland, like they aren't affected by gravity at all.

319042008.speaker: 托特
319042008.content: It turns out that the data foundation isn't as strong as we expected... or maybe the battles have been more intense than we thought they'd be. And it's difficult to ensure that the foundation won't be damaged.

319042009.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319042009.content: Can't we get more people to help? Aren't there many capable guys in CORG?

319042010.speaker: 托特
319042010.content: That'd be ideal but... there are the technical considerations.

319042012.speaker: 托特
319042012.content: Creating a parallel world, then bringing people in from the outside... That sounds easy, doesn't it?

319042013.speaker: 托特
319042013.content: But it's already quite the challenge to keep this World Line going. There's computing power and data restoration to think about, as well as deviation monitoring and line stabilization... And then we have to cloak ourselves from Gaea from the outside.

319042014.speaker: 托特
319042014.content: Each and everyone of us who isn't supposed to be in the Molander City of 2305 is interfering with the stability of the hyperspace. If it weren't for the overtime work of the Engineering Department, even the two of us wouldn't be able to get in.

319042015.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319042015.content: Huh? But we aren't the only ones who made it in, are we? You mentioned some other people.

319042017.speaker: 托特
319042017.content: We Modifiers have to call on Gaea's computing power on a frequent basis, and this is as conspicuous as a light bulb in the Data Plane Layer and a lot more difficult to cloak.

319042018.speaker: 托特
319042018.content: By the way, do not take your watch off under any circumstances. Ever. Do you understand?

319042019.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319042019.content: Okay... understood. I won't take it off.

319042020.speaker: 托特
319042020.content: It's the only thing that keeps Gaea from seeing us. Otherwise, the entire hyperspace might have collapsed the moment we entered the Plane Layer.

319042021.speaker: 托特
319042021.content: So, the cloaking tech we have now can only cloak so many Modifiers at one time. That's why only you and I are here this time.

319042022.speaker: 托特
319042022.content: The others are all agents of the Quake Damage Control Department, and bullets don't work on those things. Besides, they have other work to do, too.

319042023.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319042023.content: Okay... If you hadn't reminded me, I would have forgotten that we're in a parallel world. It just looks and feels too real to me.

319042024.speaker: 托特
319042024.content: Many things in this world are like that. The more nondescript something is, the more work there is going on behind the scenes.

319042025.speaker: 托特
319042025.content: The agents are also wearing the same watch as we are. But don't greet them if you see them around.

319042026.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319042026.content: Got it. I mean, we are talking about agents here. Gotta stay mysterious and all.

319042028.speaker: 托特
319042028.content:
Let's head back.
It's chilly in the Plane Layer.

319042029.content: Ver nods and turns in the direction of the bookstore.

319042030.content: Then, just like what happened when they moved into the Data Plane Layer from the bookstore, Ver feels gravity suddenly shift and the sight before her distorts.Finally, the noise of the city starts to pierce through her dizziness.

319051001.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319051001.content: ... Data Plane Layer... Yeah. That's about it, I think.

319051002.speaker: 宁希达
319051002.content: Hmm, I think I got some of that. So if we don't destroy those things, they'll destroy the world, am I right?

319051005.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319051005.content: Not "more or less," that's exactly how it is. Yup—that's exactly how it is.

319051006.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319051006.content: Also, remember that you must never take that watch off. You mustn't lose it either. Otherwise, you might not be able to get out of here.

319051007.content: Ver looks away guiltily. Thankfully, this doesn't make Ningishzida suspicious, and she follows Ver to the spot where the alarm is coming from.

319051008.content: Ver has pretty much told Ningishzida everything Thoth conveyed her about the Data Plane Layer. Everything, except for one: that Ningishzida's world is just a product of a CORG experiment, which will eventually be destroyed.

319051009.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319051009.content: (But if things continue like this, what am I going to tell her when the hyperspace can no longer hold up...?)

319051010.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319051010.content: (It would be like if someone told me that Ain Soph, Aether Gazer, the Admin, everyone I know... wasn't real.)

319051011.content: Ver gulps. Just imagining this scenario has plunged her into a deep sense of fear. She can't help feeling that this experiment is cruel.

319051012.speaker: 宁希达
319051012.content: You know, I've often wondered what CORG does with all of the humans and Modifiers it has on its staff.

319051013.speaker: 宁希达
319051013.content: Thank you, all of you, for protecting us even when we don't know about it. I never thought that Gaea could be so dangerous, and that a place like the Data Plane Layer exists...

319051014.speaker: 宁希达
319051014.content: Hey, Norn, there's someone over there... Isn't that Captain Thoth?

319051015.content: Ningishzida's question snaps Ver out of her distracted state. Sure enough, she sees a person standing at the intersection marked on the map.

319051016.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319051016.content:
It is.
I knew it. I knew she wouldn't ignore this.

319051018.content: Thoth spots Ver and Ningishzida running over to her, and a look of puzzlement appears on her face. She looks down to confirm the ETA of the Realm Cleansers, just in case, while waiting for them to reach her.

319051019.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319051019.content: Hey, Thoth. Thank goodness you're here. I thought you were still out dealing with that thing you had to leave the bookstore for.

319051020.content: Thoth is momentarily taken aback by Ver's words, but ultimately says nothing in response. However, she is looking at Ningishzida with a slight frown on her face.

319051021.speaker: 托特
319051021.content: What is going on...? Ningishzida, how did you get in here?

319051022.speaker: 宁希达
319051022.content: Um... Well... If I had to explain things... I suppose it's because of a misunderstanding... Although you could also say that I was the one who barged in here...

319051023.speaker: 宁希达
319051023.content: I'm really, really sorry. I promise you I won't tell anyone about this! Please don't wipe my memory. It took me such a long time to memorize what Norn told me...

319051025.content: At Thoth's look of bewilderment, Ver suddenly realizes that Thoth doesn't know her current nom de guerre. But as soon as Thoth calls her "Verthandi," the cat will be out of the bag.

319051026.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319051026.content: AH! That's right... Ningishzida came in here by accident. I've already explained to her what's going on. We could certainly do with all the help we can get.

319051027.content: As Ver speaks, she discreetly points at herself. Thoth picks up on the movement and nods slightly to indicate she understands.

319051028.speaker: 托特
319051028.content: Well, you can put the matter of memory wiping aside for now. We'll revisit it if you survive this.

319051029.speaker: 宁希达
319051029.content: ... Stop trying to scare her, Captain Thoth.

319051030.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319051030.content: So, you two already know each other?

319051031.speaker: 托特
319051031.content: Of course. I was in charge of sealing off Nordburg, while she was sent there by Aether Gazer to help.

319051033.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319051033.content: (She really does have a quick mind. And a good memory, too, clearly...)

319051034.speaker: 托特
319051034.content: Well, it's true this will be easier with another pair of hands around... Here they come.

319051035.speaker: 宁希达
319051035.content: Huh? Do you really expect me to help? But I'm just a doctor...

319051036.content: The three watches beep simultaneously in warning, and numerous Realm Cleansers begin to fall from the sky. Ver and Thoth immediately get their weapons ready while Ningishzida instinctively finds a place to hide.

319051037.speaker: 宁希达
319051037.content: Y-you c-can c-count on my s-support!

319061002.content: A dizziness—like that of being woken up too soon—gradually recedes. Ver pats her head, rubs her eyes, and looks up.

319061003.content: From what she can remember, she was in Saint Sophia Medical Center one second, then on this strange, yet vaguely familiar street the next.

319061004.content: A slightly run-down building is the only thing in front of her, while a muffled clamor comes from some the distance behind her. Ver looks back in bewilderment, only to be scared out of her wits.

319061006.content: A high energy beam sweeps past her, nearly grazing the ribbon in her hair. Hastily bringing out her Access Key, Ver finally sees the source of the commotion.

319061007.speaker: 休
319061007.content: Don't just stand there, Ver! Fall in!

319061010.content: Though she's still not sure what's going on, Ver is accustomed to Shu and the Admin's orders from her training. As soon as she hears the command, she gets up and runs over without hesitation.

319061011.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319061011.content: Miss Shu? Admin? What are you doing here?

319061012.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319061012.content: Are those Realm Cleansers? What are they doing in Nordburg...?

319061015.content: Her old companions, apparently not hearing Ver's questions, keep their eyes fixed on the strange AGI Mechas.

319061016.content: The scattered Mechas suddenly freeze, then simultaneously turn and charge at Ver.

319061018.content: Attempting to mobilize her Divine Power, Ver is surprised to discover an endless surge of power welling up inside her.

319061019.content: Though she thinks there's something strange about Shu and the Admin, there's no mistaking those Realm Cleansers. Side-by-side with her companions, yet feeling all alone, Ver prepares to meet her opponents.

319071001.content: After leaving the restaurant, Thoth doesn't look back for a while, only stopping once she's led Ver and Ningishzida down a meandering route into a secluded alley.

319071002.speaker: 宁希达
319071002.content: You scared the heck out me... I can't believe there really are Cognizant Visbanes in this world.

319071003.speaker: 托特
319071003.content: Forget about her for now. Cognizant Visbanes won't attack humans without a reason. They've been concealing who they are all this time, so it's safe to assume that they're extremely cautious. They'd have no reason to make a move now.

319071004.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319071004.content: If that's the case, then why were we sounding her out? Wouldn't she change her mind if she thought she had been exposed?

319071005.speaker: 托特
319071005.content: I didn't want to risk that, either. But why do you think she went into that restaurant, and even went so far as to sit across from Ningishzida?

319071006.speaker: 托特
319071006.content: Norn, do you remember what happened with Linyu?

319071007.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319071007.content: ...You mean, Gremory has taken an interest in Ningishzida too?

319071008.speaker: 宁希达
319071008.content: You guys are scaring me... What does she want to do?

319071009.speaker: 托特
319071009.content: Gremory has the ability to attach herself to a Modifier and control her target's actions. And if you don't take any precautions, she can also read your memories.

319071010.speaker: 托特
319071010.content: Ningishzida, you were meant to have an unauthorized leave of absence logged tomorrow. From what I understand, attendance is important to you. It doesn't fit your MO.

319071011.content: Reading between the lines, Ningishzida cranes her neck back in fear and tightly grabs hold of Ver's arm.

319071013.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319071013.content: You won't be. She probably has to harm you before she can take you over. You're perfectly fine right now, aren't you?

319071014.speaker: 托特
319071014.content: I also don't want her to burrow her way into your head and see everything pertaining to the hyperspace experiment. So, we must warn her to give it up.

319071015.speaker: 托特
319071015.content: As for why she's taken an interest in you...

319071017.speaker: 托特
319071017.content: Truth be told, I don't know what's sticking out about you. Perhaps it has something to do with the blockade zone. Unless... you're just simply more gullible?

319071019.speaker: 宁希达
319071019.content: I don't want to talk to you anymore.

319071020.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319071020.content: Don't take her too seriously, Ningishzida. Thoth's just joking.

319071021.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319071021.content: We'd better hurry back to the bookstore. If we're too late, it won't just be a roof we're missing...

319071022.speaker: 托特
319071022.content: There's no need. I didn't bring you here just to evade Gremory.

319071023.content: Thoth lights up her watch. A ring-shaped progress bar is nearly full.

319071024.speaker: 托特
319071024.content: I'm sure I never said that the Plane Layer can only be entered through the bookstore?

319071026.content: Ningishzida shivers upon hearing the watch alert. But before she can react, everything goes a misty white.

319071027.content: There's nothing particularly out of the ordinary about the process of entering the Data Plane Layer. But when they reach the location indicated on the map, all three feel some surprise.

319071031.content: Looking up to see dots of light rapidly descending from the sky, Ver panics. Glancing once more at the familiar outline of the building behind her, she tightens her grip on her sword and shield.

319071032.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319071032.content: This time, no matter what happens, we can't let them destroy this place.

319071033.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319071033.content: Thoth, Ningishzida... Please, help me protect my home.

319091003.speaker: 小薇儿
319091003.content: ...I can hear water. Lots of it.

319091005.speaker: 小薇儿
319091005.content: The air is salty, and... windy. It's like I'm standing somewhere way up high.

319091006.speaker: 小薇儿
319091006.content: Prez, you've been covering my eyes for so long now. I'm a little scared.

319091007.speaker: 小院长
319091007.content: It's your first time seeing the ocean. I had to pick the perfect spot.

319091008.speaker: 小院长
319091008.content: ...Okay, you can open your eyes now.

319091009.content: The warmth of the Prez's palms leaves her eyes, and the nighttime breeze ruffles her eyelashes. The moisture in the air is denser than what she's used to in her patient room, but slowly—very slowly—her eyes open on their own.

319091010.content: From the claustrophobia of the orphanage, to the spick and span patient room at Saint Sophia, and then to the charming streets of Molander, there's no end beyond the end, nor any more tall walls beyond the tall wall.

319091011.content: It's as if all the barriers between her and the world have vanished, turning into endless waves rippling in the moonlight. The echoes trapped between the walls have also dissolved in the splashing of the waves.

319091013.speaker: 小院长
319091013.content: This is the world we live in.

319091014.content: Along the northern coast, the sleepless lights of West Coast Core City glow in the night sky, making this bay near Molander seem all the more serene.

319091015.speaker: 小院长
319091015.content: The world is alive. There are countless other lives out there besides ours. The sky and earth, cities and civilizations, the entire Sephirah Zone—each has its own heartbeat.

319091016.speaker: 小院长
319091016.content: Feel them, embrace them, and see all the things you like about each other. That's how you'll know that, just like them, you're alive.

319091018.speaker: 小院长
319091018.content: Mm-hm. Living... is life's toughest and noblest pursuit. After all that humanity has been through...

319091019.content: Knowing that little Ver doesn't need to understand such complex things right now, the Prez doesn't say anything more.

319091020.speaker: 小院长
319091020.content: Wanna go down for a stroll?

319091022.speaker: 小院长
319091022.content: Yep, on the beach. Take your shoes off. Stepping on sand feels amazing.

319091024.speaker: 小院长
319091024.content: If it was daytime, it would burn your feet.

319091025.speaker: 小院长
319091025.content: Come on. You have to touch the waves when you come to the beach.

319091026.content: Two lines of shallow footprints stretch slowly from the beach path to the tide-soaked shoal.

319091027.content: The two of them hold hands and stand side by side. Little Ver nervously lowers her head. Seeing a wave swell in the near distance, she squeezes her eyes shut.

319091029.content: When she opens her eyes, the wave is already receding. A line of white foam trail behind it, as if it's bidding little Ver farewell.

319091030.content: Her dainty ankles are drenched in seawater. Her feet sink slightly into the warm, wet sand, but she feels steady, like the earth is holding her up.

319091031.speaker: 小薇儿
319091031.content: It feels nice... What is that?

319091032.content: The Prez bends over to pick up what Ver is looking at, then places it in her hand.

319091033.speaker: 小院长
319091033.content: A seashell. Do you like it?

319091035.speaker: 小院长
319091035.content: Then take it back with you as a souvenir. Come on—let's see if we can find any more.

319091036.content: With hardly anyone at this small-town beach tonight, Ver and the Prez get the path formed by the undulating waves all to themselves.

319091037.content: The surface of the water glimmers fluorescently, as if reflecting the starlight above. Not as striking as the neon lights on the horizon, it meanders lithely behind their footsteps, in the space where the imaginary and the real meet.

319091039.content: Picking up a red shell, the Prez goes to wash the sand from it in the water before handing it to Ver.

319091040.speaker: 小院长
319091040.content: Here. Looking at bright colors like this will put you in a good mood.

319091041.speaker: 小薇儿
319091041.content: But you found this one... You don't want it?

319091042.speaker: 小院长
319091042.content:
I find red is a little too strong.
How about this—I'll give you this one, and you can give me one.

319091043.content: Ver nods and presents the Prez with the shell in her hand. She seemed to collect shells indiscriminately, even ending up with chipped ones.

319091044.speaker: 小院长
319091044.content: We're not litter picking here... I'll take this one, then.

319091045.content: Putting the red shell into Ver's hand, the Prez takes a half-broken white shell and pockets it.

319091047.speaker: 小院长
319091047.content: It's not really a matter of preference... Want to hear a story?

319091049.speaker: 小院长
319091049.content: Then I'll tell it to you, but don't tell anyone else.

319091050.speaker: 小院长
319091050.content: There's a sea like this one in my hometown too. A bigger, deeper... "sea" surrounding the land.

319091051.speaker: 小院长
319091051.content: Back then—like you—I'd only ever seen this word in books, because the cities and highways near the sea were all full of enemies.

319091052.speaker: 小院长
319091052.content: Then a friend said to me, "Let's sneak through and see the ocean." I don't know what came over me, but for whatever reason, I followed her there.

319091053.speaker: 小院长
319091053.content: But we didn't make it there in the end. Our teacher caught us and dragged us back, saying we were going to get hurt. We were locked in the guardhouse for three days. I asked her if she really wanted to see the ocean that badly.

319091054.speaker: 小院长
319091054.content:
She didn't say anything.
A few days later, she gave me a shell that looked a lot like this one.

319091055.speaker: 小院长
319091055.content: She said she wanted to find one that was intact, but she hadn't seen any...

319091056.speaker: 小薇儿
319091056.content: Then... maybe you should give her a pretty shell, too.

319091057.speaker: 小院长
319091057.content: There's no need. I'm sure she's seen the ocean plenty of times by now, and found all kinds of shells.

319091058.content: Little Ver feels the hand holding hers tighten its grasp, but an easy smile appears on the Prez's face.

319091059.speaker: 小院长
319091059.content: Ver—you, her, me, we're all different. I hope you won't experience that kind of regret again.

319091060.speaker: 小院长
319091060.content: I hope... I can take you to see this whole world.

319091061.content: In the distance, spots of light like indicator lights shine over the sea. Ver thinks she's seen them before—they're probably coming from some kind of maritime operations vessel.

319091062.content: Ver watches the two children walk on the beach from the coast. She can't hear what they're saying, but every word seems to resound clearly in her mind.

319091063.content: Sadly, the shells they picked up on this day were lost at some point. That carelessness has plagued her since she was a child...

319091066.content: The Prez's reflexive cry snaps Ver out of her thoughts. She can't remember the Admin ever reacting like that.

319091067.content: As the light sources over the water get closer, their contours get clearer. Ver finally realizes why they're so familiar...

319091068.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319091068.content: Realm Cleansers? But this isn't the Plane Layer!

319091069.content: She checks her watch, but it's not giving any warnings. All it's showing is that the hyperspace collapse meter has gone up a tick. Not stopping to find out why, Ver summons her Access Key and sprints to the beach.

319091072.content: The Prez looks at the AGI Mecha closing in on them, then at Ver. With an incredulous shake of the head, the Prez seems to understand something but, instead of saying anything, pulls little Ver back to the beach path.

319101001.speaker: 托特
319101001.content: "Don't stick your nose in things that aren't your business, rookie."

319101002.speaker: 托特
319101002.content: "Now, tell me. What did you see here?"

319101004.content: Thoth imitates Raphael as soon as they enter the Source Layer, and the other agents burst out laughing. Raphael grimaces.

319101005.speaker: 拉斐尔
319101005.content: You're the one who told me to do the talking, Captain.

319101006.speaker: 托特
319101006.content: Oh no, it was brilliant. I'm going to have to remember that for next time.

319101007.speaker: 拉斐尔
319101007.content: Well, stop making fun of me, then. It was all I could do to hold it in back there. I was sure that if I turned to look back at that soldier, I would have burst out laughing!

319101008.speaker: 托特
319101008.content: Then we would have had to knock him out with his own flashgun.

319101009.speaker: 托特
319101009.content: Okay, enough joking around. Let's get down to business... Norn, are you getting anything?

319101010.content: Ver scratches her head and looks around blankly, her eyes meeting the agents with some embarrassment.

319101011.speaker: 托特
319101011.content: Don't worry. Let's walk around a bit. You can tell me more about this place, or see if we can find where it is you came from.

319101012.speaker: 托特
319101012.content: Raphael, I want you to take the others and set up the monitoring node. I'm hoping our more advanced technology will detect things that we couldn't ten years ago.

319111001.content: The first time Ver met Lokken, she wasn't using the name "Norn" yet, so she isn't surprised when the latter calls her by her real name.

319111002.content: What does surprise her is Lokken's attitude, and the timing of her appearance. It's as though she's been lying in wait to fight Ver at the exit all along.

319111003.speaker: 洛肯
319111003.content: What's that in your pocket? Where are you off to?

319111004.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319111004.content: It's an OPRIC mission. I can't tell you.

319111005.speaker: 洛肯
319111005.content: "OPRIC"... Have you been lying for so long that you've even convinced yourself? That's just an identity given to you for the experiment.

319111006.speaker: 洛肯
319111006.content: What I don't understand is why they let Aether Gazer join in on the fun of such an important mission.

319111008.speaker: 洛肯
319111008.content: Isn't it strange? That's why I always say you should never let outsiders get involved...

319111009.speaker: 洛肯
319111009.content: Oh, didn't Captain Thoth tell you? They have a rule in CORG: "Always be prepared to sacrifice yourself for the Idealbild."

319111010.speaker: 洛肯
319111010.content: Even though everyone knows they're just copies of their true selves and will be recycled at some point, they still continue to play their roles faithfully... Even if they did know the truth, those CORG fools wouldn't dare say it out loud.

319111011.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319111011.content: So you also know that Gaea will eventually...

319111012.speaker: 洛肯
319111012.content: Of course. But what difference does it make to me? Tools know that they're tools, and aren't surprised when they get destroyed.

319111013.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319111013.content: If that's true, then why don't you just let me past? I really am on a mission given to me by Thoth.

319111014.speaker: 洛肯
319111014.content: Why are you talking about missions again?

319111015.content: Lokken descends one flight of stairs and the entire institute seems to come to life. Machinery clanks into life, and energy buzzes in the air.

319111016.content: AGI Mechas approach from corridors in all directions, and in the blink of an eye, Ver finds herself surrounded.

319111017.speaker: 洛肯
319111017.content: You know, it's poor manners for a guest to steal from the host... Now, what game shall we play as punishment?

319281002.content: A fine golden glow is entwined with the darkness that has surged like flames, like an arrow silently cruising in the void.

319281003.content: It is like the hands on a mechanical clock, rotating at a slow and constant speed, a trajectory determining the measurement of time with the strict precision of law and which has since become a rule that transcends the operations of time and space itself.

319281005.content: Ver slowly reaches out her hand towards the golden glow, but feels her body resisting the black flames. She pulls back her hand, as if she's afraid of the pain.

319281006.content: Then, a hand reaches out from the dreary void and grabs hold of the end of the pointer. The golden light and the black flames merge and melt into a long sword in that hand.
